original: @267a * // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @267a * // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: sh'u n+ya t'a sapta ti ki bratita //
analyzed: sh'u n+ya t'a sapta ti ki bratita //
translated: ≈ö≈´nyatƒÅsaptati·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: stong nyid bdun cu pa'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: stong nyid bdun cu pa'i 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Seventy Stanzas on Emptiness

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha

original: mdor bsdus de nyid nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mdor bsdus de nyid nges pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to ascertain reality in brief,

original: stong nyid bdun cu gsung ba gang //üîΩde la phyag 'tshal bdun cu par //
analyzed: stong nyid bdun cu gsung ba gang // de la phyag 'tshal bdun cu par //
translated: The Seventy Stanzas on Emptiness were taught.üîΩI will now explain the meaning of the Seventy

original: bstan don bdag gis yang dag dbye //
analyzed: bstan don bdag gis yang dag dbye //
translated: In accordance with the commentary.

original: 'dir slob dpon bdag nyid kyis zab pa dang shin tu rgya che ba'i dngos po rnams kyi don rnam par nges pa'i dbu ma'i bstan bcos rnams brtsams pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon bdag nyid kyis zab pa dang shin tu rgya che ba'i dngos po rnams kyi don rnam par nges pa'i dbu ma'i bstan bcos rnams brtsams pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Here, although the master himself composed treatises on the middle way that ascertain the meaning of profound and vast topics,

original: gzhung dang don dag shin tu mang ba'i phyir dang / shes rab chud rnams bya bar nges pa 'di la kun nas chags pa dang ldan pa stong pa nyid bstan pa'i snod du gyur kyang /
analyzed: gzhung dang don dag shin tu mang ba'i phyir dang / shes rab chud rnams bya bar nges pa 'di la kun nas chags pa dang ldan pa stong pa nyid bstan pa'i snod du gyur kyang /
translated: because the texts and their meanings are extremely vast, and because those with discerning minds who are certain about this teaching are vessels for the teaching on emptiness,

original: de thob pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / nye bar sems pas 'jigs pa rnams la slob dpon gyi thugs kyi rgyud shes rab dang thabs dang brtse ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bdun cus kyang khyad par du 'phags pa don grub par gzigs nas /
analyzed: de thob pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / nye bar sems pas 'jigs pa rnams la slob dpon gyi thugs kyi rgyud shes rab dang thabs dang brtse ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bdun cus kyang khyad par du 'phags pa don grub par gzigs nas /
translated: Having attained it, and having grasped it, and having reflected upon it, he saw that the meaning of the seven hundred verses is accomplished, and is superior, because of the knowledge, means, and compassion of the mind of the Master who is engaged in the protection of those who are frightened.

original: mdor bsdus pas de kho na nyid nges pa'i don du stong pa nyid bdun cu pa zhes bya ba 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas de kho na nyid nges pa'i don du stong pa nyid bdun cu pa zhes bya ba 'di brtsams so //
translated: Therefore, he composed this work called ‚ÄúThe Perfection of Wisdom in Seventy Verses‚Äù for the ascertainment of the meaning of reality in brief.

original: de yang mdor bsdus pas de kho na nyid nges pa 'di ni shin tu don chen po yang gnas pa dang skye ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten pas bde blag tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdus pas de kho na nyid nges pa 'di ni shin tu don chen po yang gnas pa dang skye ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten pas bde blag tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, this ascertainment of reality in brief has a great meaning, because it is easily understood by the world through such topics as the abiding, arising, and so forth.

original: gang zhig thog ma med pa ni sa log pa'i lta ba la goms pa'i phyir byis pa log par rtog pa'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa'i mtshan nyid la gnas pa la chags pa'i rten la dngos por nye bar brtags la /
analyzed: gang zhig thog ma med pa ni sa log pa'i lta ba la goms pa'i phyir byis pa log par rtog pa'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa'i mtshan nyid la gnas pa la chags pa'i rten la dngos por nye bar brtags la /
translated: Because they are accustomed to the wrong view that things have existed from beginningless time, childish beings are attached to the intrinsic characteristics of things that are established by their own characteristics.

original: de'i dbang las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang phyug gzhan la rag las nas 'jug pa dag las mi byed par gnas pa ni skad cig kyang mi rnyed la /
analyzed: de'i dbang las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang phyug gzhan la rag las nas 'jug pa dag las mi byed par gnas pa ni skad cig kyang mi rnyed la /
translated: They are attached to the basis of that and do not act without relying on another, the powerful one who arises from that, such as attachment.

original: gal te yang las mi byed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te yang las mi byed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: But if they do not act,

original: 'di ltar las can rnams kyi las de'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir des par skye ba ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar las can rnams kyi las de'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir des par skye ba ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: then the karma of those who possess karma would not exist. Because the result that arises from the cause of that karma would not exist, they would definitely stop taking rebirth.

original: gang zhig dang drag cing rgyun ring ba'i mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang phyug gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skye ba'i skye bo rnams las mi byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig dang drag cing rgyun ring ba'i mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang phyug gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skye ba'i skye bo rnams las mi byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is impossible that there are people who are born under the influence of the lord of afflictions, such as intense and long-lasting grasping at the supreme,

original: @267b las kyi 'bras bu yang srid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba 'di lta bu yod pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: @267b las kyi 'bras bu yang srid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba 'di lta bu yod pa yang mi srid do //
translated: resentment, desire, etc., and who do not perform actions and do not experience the results of actions in the form of rebirth.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa ni byis pa rnams kyi don ma yin pa thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa ni byis pa rnams kyi don ma yin pa thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo'o //
translated: Therefore, attachment to endurance, etc., is the primary cause of all the misfortune of the childish.

original: gnas pa 'di yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa dang ldan pas nges par skye ba dang 'jig pa la ltos la /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa dang ldan pas nges par skye ba dang 'jig pa la ltos la /
translated: Moreover, this endurance is definitely related to the intrinsic nature of dependent origination and is associated with it, and so it depends on arising and destruction.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang mi ldan pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa ni gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang mi ldan pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa ni gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Space, etc., which are not associated with arising and destruction, are not endurance.

original: des na gnas pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas rnams 'chad par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi la sogs pa la dpyad pa stong pa nyid la mos pa rna mas kyi yid mgu ba'i phyir brjod do //
analyzed: des na gnas pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas rnams 'chad par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi la sogs pa la dpyad pa stong pa nyid la mos pa rna mas kyi yid mgu ba'i phyir brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in order to please the minds of those who aspire to emptiness, the analysis of the characteristics, the basis of characteristics, and so on, which are taught in terms of endurance, is expressed.

original: gzhan yang gnas pa la sogs pa'i don 'di rnams 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nye bar bstan bzhin pa'am bzung bzhin pa dag mtshan gzhi la ltos pa kho nas gnas la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas pa la sogs pa'i don 'di rnams 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nye bar bstan bzhin pa'am bzung bzhin pa dag mtshan gzhi la ltos pa kho nas gnas la /
translated: Moreover, these objects such as endurance are only dependent on the basis of characteristics, as they are taught or grasped as the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: mtshan gzhi de yang mtshan nyid med na mtshan nyid la ltos pas mtshan gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi de yang mtshan nyid med na mtshan nyid la ltos pas mtshan gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the basis of characteristics has no characteristics, then since it depends on characteristics, the basis of characteristics does not exist.

original: de bzhin phan tshun brten pas bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag mtshan nyid la ltos par mtshan gzhir gyur pa gang du gnas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rten 'grub par gal 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin phan tshun brten pas bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag mtshan nyid la ltos par mtshan gzhir gyur pa gang du gnas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rten 'grub par gal 'gyur //
translated: In the same way, the objects that are included by mutual dependence, the characteristics and the basis of characteristics, are dependent on characteristics. In what basis of characteristics do the characteristics such as endurance exist?

original: gnas pa la sogs pa ma grub pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa ma grub pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Since abiding and so on are not established, consciousness and so on do not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po med na de la ltos nas de las log pa'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po med na de la ltos nas de las log pa'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ga la yod /
translated: If the entities of consciousness and so on do not exist, how could there be a nature that is the opposite of those, the nonexistence of entities?

original: dngos po med par gyur pa la ci rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yod dam /
analyzed: dngos po med par gyur pa la ci rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yod dam /
translated: In the absence of entities, is there an object of consciousness?

original: dmigs pas bskyed pa'i rnam bar shes pa dmigs pa med par skye bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pas bskyed pa'i rnam bar shes pa dmigs pa med par skye bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness generated by an object is not able to arise without an object.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba med na 'dod chags la sogs pa rten med pas na med la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba med na 'dod chags la sogs pa rten med pas na med la /
translated: If consciousness does not arise, attachment and so on do not exist because they lack a basis.

original: phyin ci log rtsad nas phyung la yod pa ma yin pas las skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log rtsad nas phyung la yod pa ma yin pas las skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Since error is completely eliminated, it does not exist and is not a cause that generates karma.

original: las med na de'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mi 'byung ba dang / sngar skyes pa'i nye bar len pa zad pas nyer len med de /
analyzed: las med na de'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mi 'byung ba dang / sngar skyes pa'i nye bar len pa zad pas nyer len med de /
translated: If there is no karma, the effect of that, future birth, does not occur, and since the appropriated aggregates that were previously born have ceased, there is no appropriation.

original: nges par gnas pa la sogs pa la dpyod pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i snod du 'gyur ro //üîΩji skad du 'phags pa las /
analyzed: nges par gnas pa la sogs pa la dpyod pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i snod du 'gyur ro // ji skad du 'phags pa las /
translated: Those who analyze abiding, etc. become vessels for nirvana.

original: gang gi rnam @268a * //üîΩshes de nyid dang // gnas pa la sogs rnam shes pa //
analyzed: gang gi rnam @268a * // shes de nyid dang // gnas pa la sogs rnam shes pa //
translated: As it is said in the ƒÄrya≈õatasƒÅhasrikƒÅpraj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ:üîΩThe consciousness of thatness

original: de tshe blo ldan nyon mongs la //
analyzed: de tshe blo ldan nyon mongs la //
translated: and the consciousness of abiding, etc.

original: nam yang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The wise are never attached

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: to the afflictions.

original: gal te de ltar gnas pa la sogs pa med na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gnas pa la sogs pa med na /
translated: If abiding, etc. do not exist,

original: de lta na gang zhig 'di ltar phyin ci log gi ma rig pa ma lus pa bral bas mngon par rtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na gang zhig 'di ltar phyin ci log gi ma rig pa ma lus pa bral bas mngon par rtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa /
translated: then how is it that the Buddha, the realized one, free from all errors and ignorance, said this:

original: dge slong dag 'dus byas ni skye bar yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dus byas ni skye bar yang rab tu shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, I know that conditioned things arise and

original: 'gag par yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'gag par yang rab tu shes so //
translated: I know that they cease.

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bar yang rab tu shes so zhes so //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bar yang rab tu shes so zhes so //
translated: I know that they abide and I know that they change.‚Äù

original: de ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung don med par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung don med par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: How could it be right that the words of the TathƒÅgata be meaningless?

original: 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni bden la /
analyzed: 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni bden la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said that these are true.

original: 'di dag don med par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩrgyu mtshan cis na gang gi phyir //
analyzed: 'di dag don med par 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te / rgyu mtshan cis na gang gi phyir //
translated: It is not reasonable that these would be meaningless.üîΩWhy is it so?

original: gnas pa'i skye 'jig yod med dam //
analyzed: gnas pa'i skye 'jig yod med dam //
translated: Because of the existence or nonexistence of the arising andüîΩcessation of endurance,

original: dman pa'am mnyam pa'am khyad par can //
analyzed: dman pa'am mnyam pa'am khyad par can //
translated: inferiority, equality, or superiority,

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten snyed dbang gis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten snyed dbang gis //
translated: the Buddha taught in accordance with the world,

original: gsungs kyi yang dag dbang gis min //üîΩ'dir dngos po rnams phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis bden pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsungs kyi yang dag dbang gis min // 'dir dngos po rnams phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis bden pa gnyis te /
translated: not in accordance with reality.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya bar 'phags pas tha snyad mdzad la /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya bar 'phags pas tha snyad mdzad la /
translated: Here, due to the power of the cognition of things that is either erroneous or nonerroneous, there are two truths, called the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.üîΩThe ƒÅryas make this distinction.

original: 'phags pa 'ba' zhig kho na bden pa gnyis rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'ba' zhig kho na bden pa gnyis rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not only the ƒÅryas who make this distinction between the two truths.

original: 'jig rten pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyang bden pa gnyis tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyang bden pa gnyis tha snyad byed do //
translated: Even worldly people who are skilled in worldly conventions make this distinction between the two truths.

original: 'di ltar bden pa'i don ni mi snang la sgro btags pa'i don rigs par tha snyad byed pa la 'di ni kun rdzob pa'o zhes tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa'i don ni mi snang la sgro btags pa'i don rigs par tha snyad byed pa la 'di ni kun rdzob pa'o zhes tha snyad byed do //
translated: Thus, the meaning of ‚Äútruth‚Äù does not appear, and the meaning of ‚Äúsuperficial‚Äù is the conventional usage of reason.

original: gang du bden pa'i don mi snang ba ma yin la sgro ma btags pa'i don rig pa'i tha snyad la /
analyzed: gang du bden pa'i don mi snang ba ma yin la sgro ma btags pa'i don rig pa'i tha snyad la /
translated: Where the meaning of ‚Äútruth‚Äù does appear, and the meaning of ‚Äúsuperficial‚Äù is the conventional usage of reason,

original: de la 'di ni don dam pa kho na'o zhes rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de la 'di ni don dam pa kho na'o zhes rnam par 'jog go //
translated: there it is established that this is the ultimate alone.

original: re zhig gang la 'di kun rdzob ces tha snyad byed pa de la mi bden pa'i don 'dig rten pas khong du chud pa nyid kyis de'i yul la bsam pa gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig gang la 'di kun rdzob ces tha snyad byed pa de la mi bden pa'i don 'dig rten pas khong du chud pa nyid kyis de'i yul la bsam pa gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: First, one should not give up the consideration of the object of the conventional usage of ‚Äúsuperficial,‚Äù because it is understood that the meaning of ‚Äútruth‚Äù is not present there.

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la bden par 'dod pa de yang 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden par bzhed de /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la bden par 'dod pa de yang 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden par bzhed de /
translated: Also, that which is accepted as ‚Äútruth‚Äù in the conventional usage of the world is accepted by the ƒÅryas as the conventional truth of the world.

original: med pa'i don la tha snyad 'dogs pa ltar don med pa nyid du @268b brjod do //
analyzed: med pa'i don la tha snyad 'dogs pa ltar don med pa nyid du @268b brjod do //
translated: It is said that it is meaningless, like the conventional usage of a nonexistent object.

original: de yang brdzun pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa /
analyzed: de yang brdzun pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa /
translated: Also, it is understood to be false.

original: 'phags pa nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pa rab tu grags pa'i rigs pa nyid kyis nye bar ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pa rab tu grags pa'i rigs pa nyid kyis nye bar ston par mdzad de /
translated: The noble one teaches by means of the very reasoning that is well known in the world, which will be explained.

original: de ni rab tu grags pa'i dpes ma grags pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rab tu grags pa'i dpes ma grags pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the example of what is well known causes one to understand what is not well known.

original: de ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la rnam par dpyad na /
translated: Here, when one analyzes worldly conventions,

original: yang dag pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir 'phags pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la kun rdzob ces gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir 'phags pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la kun rdzob ces gsungs so //
translated: the noble one declares that worldly conventions are the relative because the meaning of reality is not established.

original: kun rdzob kyi sgra ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rnam grangs ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi sgra ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rnam grangs ma yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúrelative‚Äù is not a synonym for worldly convention.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas de ni rnam pa gnyis su gnas pa'i phyir dang tha snyad kyi phyogs gcig la kun rdzob kyi sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas de ni rnam pa gnyis su gnas pa'i phyir dang tha snyad kyi phyogs gcig la kun rdzob kyi sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is twofold, divided into the relative and the ultimate, and because the term ‚Äúrelative‚Äù expresses one part of convention.

original: rigs pa'i stobs kyis 'di'i don ni gang zhig 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la kun rdzob kyi sgras brjod la /
analyzed: rigs pa'i stobs kyis 'di'i don ni gang zhig 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la kun rdzob kyi sgras brjod la /
translated: By the power of reasoning, the meaning of this is as follows: That which is expressed by the term ‚Äúrelative‚Äù in worldly conventions

original: de ni 'di ltar gnag 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'di ni 'jig rten kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gnag 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'di ni 'jig rten kun rdzob ste /
translated: The noble ones alone are correct to say that this is so, that the conventions of the world are the conventional truth of the world,

original: de ni de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes 'phags pa kho na gsungs par rigs la /
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes 'phags pa kho na gsungs par rigs la /
translated: and that this is not reality.

original: tha snyad dang kun rdzob kyi sgra dag kyang rnam grangs nyid de /
analyzed: tha snyad dang kun rdzob kyi sgra dag kyang rnam grangs nyid de /
translated: The terms conventional and conventional truth are synonyms.

original: de la skyon med do //
analyzed: de la skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in this.

original: de skad du mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du mdo las /
translated: A sutra says:

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional truth?

original: ji srid du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yi ge dang skad kyis ston pa'o//
analyzed: ji srid du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yi ge dang skad kyis ston pa'o//
translated: It is whatever is taught by the conventions of the world, by letters and language.

original: zhes so // yang na ci zhig la 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // yang na ci zhig la 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya zhe na /
translated: Or else, what is called the conventions of the world here?

original: de la re zhig bud shing la brten nas me bzhin du phung bo la brten nas brtags pa'i gang zag la 'jig rten zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la re zhig bud shing la brten nas me bzhin du phung bo la brten nas brtags pa'i gang zag la 'jig rten zhes brjod do //
translated: First, the person imputed in dependence on the aggregates is called the world, just as fire is in dependence on fuel.

original: de yang phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold, because of being either erroneous or nonerroneous.

original: de la dbang po nyams pa'i rab rib can la sogs pa phyin ci log yin la /
analyzed: de la dbang po nyams pa'i rab rib can la sogs pa phyin ci log yin la /
translated: Those with diseased vision and so on are erroneous.

original: phyin ci ma log pa ni dbang po ma nyams pa rab rib can la sogs pa las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa ni dbang po ma nyams pa rab rib can la sogs pa las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Non-erroneous is that of one whose sense-faculties are not impaired, as opposed to those with defective sense-faculties, such as those with jaundice.

original: 'di nyid kho na yang 'dir 'jig rten pa'i sgras brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'di nyid kho na yang 'dir 'jig rten pa'i sgras brjod kyi /
translated: It is just this that is referred to here by the word ‚Äòmundane‚Äô,

original: cig shos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin te /
translated: and not the other,

original: 'jig rten pa kho na la rnam pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa kho na la rnam pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only the former is a valid means of knowledge in the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du gsungs pa yang gzhan gyi khong du chud par 'dod pa'i dngos po kun nas rtogs pa'i dngos po sna tshogs pa gzhan gyi rgyud la rtog pa 'jug par byed pa la tha snyad ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du gsungs pa yang gzhan gyi khong du chud par 'dod pa'i dngos po kun nas rtogs pa'i dngos po sna tshogs pa gzhan gyi rgyud la rtog pa 'jug par byed pa la tha snyad ces brjod do //
translated: And the statement ‚Äòin terms of mundane convention‚Äô is made in order to introduce to others the various things that are understood in the world, for ‚Äòconvention‚Äô is said to be the engagement in the various things that are understood in the stream of consciousness of others.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni 'jig rten tha snyad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni 'jig rten tha snyad de /
translated: Mundane convention is the world‚Äôs convention.

original: @269a * // ji ltar 'jig rten pa rtogs par 'dod pa'i don phan tshun du rtogs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: @269a * // ji ltar 'jig rten pa rtogs par 'dod pa'i don phan tshun du rtogs par byed pa'am /
translated: It is the mutual understanding of the things that are understood in the world,

original: shes par 'dod pa'i don khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa'i don khong du chud pa'o //
translated: or the comprehension of the things that are to be known.

original: de bzhin du don de la brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa dang / shes bya shes byed du rnam par 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du don de la brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa dang / shes bya shes byed du rnam par 'jog par byed cing /
translated: Likewise, in regard to that object, the relationship of the expressed and the expresser is posited, and the relationship of the knower and the known is posited.

original: dus gzhan du yang tha snyad kyi gdams pa mi 'chad pa'i don du de la 'di ltar rjod byed dang brjod bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid can gyi don phyin ci log tsam gyis nye bar bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po la tha snyad ces brjod kyi /
analyzed: dus gzhan du yang tha snyad kyi gdams pa mi 'chad pa'i don du de la 'di ltar rjod byed dang brjod bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid can gyi don phyin ci log tsam gyis nye bar bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po la tha snyad ces brjod kyi /
translated: And at another time, in order to not interrupt the conventional instruction, it is said that the conventional is the entity that is merely generated by the error of the characteristics of the object and the object-possessor, which are the expresser and the expressed, and the knower and the known.

original: byed pa po'i tshogs pa gcig dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po'i tshogs pa gcig dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not related to a single collection of agents.

original: de nyid kyang 'jig rten pa bden par 'dod pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi bden pa zhes bya ste gcig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyang 'jig rten pa bden par 'dod pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi bden pa zhes bya ste gcig go //
translated: And because that is asserted to be the worldly truth, it is called the conventional truth of the world.üîΩThese are the first two.

original: re zhig 'di dag 'jig rten pa phyin ci log gi shes pa'i dbang las bden pa la /
analyzed: re zhig 'di dag 'jig rten pa phyin ci log gi shes pa'i dbang las bden pa la /
translated: From the perspective of the world, which is mistaken consciousness, these are the truth.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i dbang las don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i dbang las don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: From the perspective of the unmistaken, the ultimate truth is posited.

original: slar yang ci de phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa yin /
analyzed: slar yang ci de phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa yin /
translated: Again, is that a non-erroneous cognition?

original: gang du yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which does not superimpose what is not real.

original: yang ci yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: yang ci yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa yin /
translated: Again, is that which does not superimpose what is not real?

original: de ni ji ltar gnas pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar gnas pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is that which observes the nature of phenomena just as it abides.

original: slar yang ci 'di ni chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: slar yang ci 'di ni chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin //
translated: Again, is that the nature of phenomena just as it abides?

original: ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is not fabricated.

original: yang ci ma byas pa yin /
analyzed: yang ci ma byas pa yin /
translated: Again, is it not fabricated?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: 'di ni brdar btags pa'i ming yin nam ci ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni brdar btags pa'i ming yin nam ci ma yin te /
translated: Is this a conventional name? No, it is not.

original: 'jig rten pa yang ma byas pa nyid la rang bzhin zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang ma byas pa nyid la rang bzhin zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because worldly people also call that which is not fabricated a nature.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig tu bslu ba'i tha snyad dmigs pa na 'di'i tha snyad 'di ni byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig tu bslu ba'i tha snyad dmigs pa na 'di'i tha snyad 'di ni byas pa ste /
translated: Thus, when worldly people observe a conventional designation that is deceptive in some respect, they say, This conventional designation is fabricated,

original: rang bzhin ma yin pa'o zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin pa'o zhes smra ba'o //
translated: it is not a nature.

original: de bzhin du sgyu ma'i skyes bu dmigs pa na skyes bu 'di ni byas pa'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgyu ma'i skyes bu dmigs pa na skyes bu 'di ni byas pa'o zhes brjod de /
translated: Likewise, when one observes an illusory person, one says, ‚ÄúThis person is created.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not natural.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten du rang bzhin zhes bya ba ma byas pa la brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten du rang bzhin zhes bya ba ma byas pa la brjod do //
translated: Likewise, in the world, one says that what is not created is natural.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir byas pa nyid du yod pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i don kyang bslu bar so sor snang ba'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir byas pa nyid du yod pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i don kyang bslu bar so sor snang ba'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they are dependently arisen, form, feeling, and so on, which exist as created, also appear to be deceptive.

original: gang zhig gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa 'di dag nye bar dmigs @269b pa'i rang bzhin de ni byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa 'di dag nye bar dmigs @269b pa'i rang bzhin de ni byas pa ste /
translated: The nature of these form, feeling, and so on that are observed is created.

original: byas pa'i phyir rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are created, they are not natural.

original: de lta na yang byas pa'i rang bzhin du zhog shig ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yang byas pa'i rang bzhin du zhog shig ce na /
translated: Even if they are created, let them be natural.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: dngos po byas pa ma yin pa med la gang zhig gi rang bzhin no zhes pa'i ming yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po byas pa ma yin pa med la gang zhig gi rang bzhin no zhes pa'i ming yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If there is no uncreated thing, then what is the name for that which is natural?

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i rang bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pas dmigs par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i rang bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pas dmigs par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it is asked whether it is observed by a consciousness that is unmistaken with respect to the nature of how it exists,

original: de yang med la /
analyzed: de yang med la /
translated: that also does not exist.

original: de med na yul med pas shes pa skye ba med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de med na yul med pas shes pa skye ba med do zhes bya ste /
translated: If that does not exist, since there is no object, consciousness does not arise.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i don du sgro 'dogs /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i don du sgro 'dogs /
translated: Why is it imputed in the ultimate?

original: gang yang 'di ni yang dag pa'i sgro btags pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos te ;
analyzed: gang yang 'di ni yang dag pa'i sgro btags pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos te ;
translated: Also, that is a correct imputation in dependence on relative truth.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la brten nas don dam pa'i bden pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la brten nas don dam pa'i bden pa zhes brjod la /
translated: In dependence on worldly conventions, it is called ‚Äúultimate truth.‚Äù

original: de yang mtshan ma med pa'i phyir brjod bya rjod byed dang shes bya shes byed kyi tha snyad med do //
analyzed: de yang mtshan ma med pa'i phyir brjod bya rjod byed dang shes bya shes byed kyi tha snyad med do //
translated: Since that is also without signs, the conventions of the object of expression and the means of expression, the object of cognition and the means of cognition, do not exist.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in a s≈´tra:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is ultimate truth?

original: gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes so //
analyzed: gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes so //
translated: If the movement of the mind does not exist, what need is there to mention syllables?‚Äù

original: de ltar bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa la /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa la /
translated: In that way, in the presentation of the two truths,

original: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas pa la sogs par bstan brtags nas brjod na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas pa la sogs par bstan brtags nas brjod na de'i tshe /
translated: If it is argued that the teaching of abiding, etc. is made in terms of the teaching of ultimate reality, then it is not reasonable, because the Tathagata's teaching would be meaningless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung don med par 'gyur bas mi rigs so zhes pa'i brtsad pa rigs par 'gyur la gnas pa la sogs pas bstan pa'i yul ni 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung don med par 'gyur bas mi rigs so zhes pa'i brtsad pa rigs par 'gyur la gnas pa la sogs pas bstan pa'i yul ni 'di ma yin no //
translated: The domain of the teaching of abiding, etc. is not this.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du'o //
translated: However, it is in terms of mundane convention.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi mthus gnas pa la sogs pa nye bar bstan /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi mthus gnas pa la sogs pa nye bar bstan /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat Buddha taught abiding, etc. by the power of mundane convention,

original: gzhan gyi rkyen la mi ltos pa'i ye shes la ltos nas ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen la mi ltos pa'i ye shes la ltos nas ma yin no //
translated: not in terms of the wisdom that does not depend on other conditions.

original: de'i ye shes ni rang bzhin yul yin pa'i phyir ni chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad par med pa de gnas la sogs pa nye bar dmigs shing /
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni rang bzhin yul yin pa'i phyir ni chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad par med pa de gnas la sogs pa nye bar dmigs shing /
translated: Since that wisdom is naturally objective, it does not apprehend abiding, etc. because it is not different from nirvana, which is the nature of all things.

original: kho bo cag gnas pa la sogs pa 'gegs par byed pa lung gis gnod pa go skabs ga la yod ces bya ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gnas pa la sogs pa 'gegs par byed pa lung gis gnod pa go skabs ga la yod ces bya ste /
translated: How could we be faulted by scripture for refuting endurance, etc.?

original: lung gis brtsad pa rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: lung gis brtsad pa rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not logical to dispute this with scripture.

original: ji ltar gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa sel ba yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis brjod pa la lung gis gnod par mi nus so //üîΩde bzhin du @270a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa sel ba yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis brjod pa la lung gis gnod par mi nus so // de bzhin du @270a * //
translated: Just as endurance, arising, and destruction are stated in terms of the power of mundane convention, scripture cannot refute them.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can sel ba la yang gnod par mi nus so //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can sel ba la yang gnod par mi nus so //
translated: Likewise, it cannot refute the exclusion of existence and nonexistence, inferiority and equality, and superiority.

original: de la yod ces brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la yod ces brjod pa ni /
translated: In this regard, existence is said to be

original: gang yod pa 'di lta ste /üîΩda ltar ba'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams sam /
analyzed: gang yod pa 'di lta ste / da ltar ba'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams sam /
translated: what exists, such as

original: 'dus byas rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams so //
translated: the present aggregates, elements, and bases, or conditioned phenomena.üîΩNonexistence is said to be

original: med pa zhes brjod pa ni gang med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa zhes brjod pa ni gang med pa ste /
translated: what does not exist, such as

original: 'di ltar gang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams sam 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams sam 'dus ma byas so //
translated: the past and future aggregates, elements, and bases, or unconditioned phenomena.

original: yang ji ltar na gnas pa la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyis de rnams sel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na gnas pa la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyis de rnams sel bar 'gyur /
translated: itself eliminate them?

original: de skad du yang rtsa ba'i rab byed bdun par /üîΩskye dang gnas dang 'jig pa yi //
analyzed: de skad du yang rtsa ba'i rab byed bdun par / skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa yi //
translated: In this way, the seventh chapter of the Prajfiiimula says:üîΩThe establishment of the produced

original: 'dus byas grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist as origination, endurance, and destruction.

original: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub na //
analyzed: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub na //
translated: If the produced is not established,

original: 'dus ma byas de ji ltar 'dod //üîΩces bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas de ji ltar 'dod // ces bya ste /
translated: How can the unproduced be asserted?üîΩSince produced things are posited by the three times, if there were no produced things, there would be no three times.

original: 'dus byas rnams ni dus gsum gyis rnam par gnas la 'dus byas med na dus gsum ga la zhig / de la da ltar ba'i dus med pas dngos po med la /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni dus gsum gyis rnam par gnas la 'dus byas med na dus gsum ga la zhig / de la da ltar ba'i dus med pas dngos po med la /
translated: Since there would be no present time, there would be no thing.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med pas dngos po med pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med pas dngos po med pa yang med do //
translated: Since there would be no past and future, there would be no nonthing.

original: de'i phyir dngos po 'di gnyis kyang gnas la sogs pa med bzhin du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po 'di gnyis kyang gnas la sogs pa med bzhin du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs so ;
translated: Therefore, these two things, thing and nonthing, are said to exist by the power of mundane convention, even though they do not exist in terms of endurance, etc.

original: / ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gnas pa la sogs pa ma grub la /
analyzed: / ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gnas pa la sogs pa ma grub la /
translated: How is it that things and nonthings are not established as enduring, etc.?

original: de bzhin du dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Likewise, inferior, equal, and superior.

original: de la dman pa ni khyad par can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la dman pa ni khyad par can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Among them, the inferior is not superior.

original: 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: For example, the afflictions.

original: khyad par can ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par can ni dge ba ste /
translated: The superior is virtuous.

original: 'di lta ste dge ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, virtue, etc.

original: mnyam pa ni bar ma ste lung du ma bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa ni bar ma ste lung du ma bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The equal is the middle, which is neutral. For example,

original: mig la sogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the eyes, etc.

original: 'di dag ni nye bar bstan pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nye bar bstan pa tsam ste /
translated: These are merely illustrations.

original: 'di ltar khyad par thams cad 'dir gnas pa la sogs pa ma grub pas ma grub par khong du chud par bya ba tha snyad kyi dbang gis brjod pas lung gi gnod pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par thams cad 'dir gnas pa la sogs pa ma grub pas ma grub par khong du chud par bya ba tha snyad kyi dbang gis brjod pas lung gi gnod pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, since all distinctions are not established here in terms of abiding, etc., one should understand that they are not established. By expressing them due to the power of convention, one should abandon the fault of contradiction with scripture.

original: ngang gi sgra'i don la'am gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: ngang gi sgra'i don la'am gyi sgra'o //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúown‚Äù is the term ‚Äúown.‚Äù

original: de yang ma smos pa rnams sdud pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang ma smos pa rnams sdud pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it includes what is not mentioned.

original: rnam par brtags pa thams cad dgag pa gnas pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i sgo nas @270b gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa thams cad dgag pa gnas pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i sgo nas @270b gsungs pa la /
translated: All conceptual distinctions are negated through the negation of abiding, etc.

original: lung gis gnod pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs pas spang bar byos shig / slar yang 'di dag 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi ngor 'jig pas mdzad pa'i dgos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: lung gis gnod pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs pas spang bar byos shig / slar yang 'di dag 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi ngor 'jig pas mdzad pa'i dgos pa ci zhe na /
translated: Again, what is the purpose of the refutation of these from the perspective of mundane convention?

original: 'di la dgos pa che ste /
analyzed: 'di la dgos pa che ste /
translated: This has great purpose.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad khas ma blangs na 'jig rten pa dang mi mthun pas rtag tu 'jig rten pa'i log rtogs las bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad khas ma blangs na 'jig rten pa dang mi mthun pas rtag tu 'jig rten pa'i log rtogs las bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If one does not accept mundane convention, one will not accord with the world, and one will not always be able to avert the misconceptions of the world.

original: kla klo bzhin no //
analyzed: kla klo bzhin no //
translated: One will be like a barbarian.

original: kla klo 'phags pa'i skad mi shes pa la 'phags pa'i skad 'ga' zhig las bzlog par mi nus la /
analyzed: kla klo 'phags pa'i skad mi shes pa la 'phags pa'i skad 'ga' zhig las bzlog par mi nus la /
translated: One cannot avert some of the misconceptions of a barbarian who does not understand the language of the ƒÅryas.

original: kla klo'i skad rjes su mthun pas bde blag tu bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kla klo'i skad rjes su mthun pas bde blag tu bzlog par 'gyur ro //

original: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos nyid la gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos nyid la gnas par gyur na /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa la ngo mtshar bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa la ngo mtshar bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and would not be amazed at the deeds of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin du nga yir 'dzin pa la yang sbyar bar bya'i //
analyzed: de bzhin du nga yir 'dzin pa la yang sbyar bar bya'i //
translated: The same is to be applied to the grasping of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gang yang 'di ltar pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med kyang 'jig rten pa'i ngor 'jug tu nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa yod pa lta bur mtshon no //
analyzed: gang yang 'di ltar pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med kyang 'jig rten pa'i ngor 'jug tu nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa yod pa lta bur mtshon no //
translated: Although there is no grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù in this way, it is illustrated that there is grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù in the perspective of the world.

original: de bzhin du dngos por gyur pa gzhan gsung ba na yang dngos po de'i rang bzhin lta bur mtshon par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos por gyur pa gzhan gsung ba na yang dngos po de'i rang bzhin lta bur mtshon par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, when other things are spoken of, it should be accepted that they are illustrated as if they were the nature of those things.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pas dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid de 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pas gsungs pa'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pas dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid de 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pas gsungs pa'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the things spoken of by the Blessed Buddhas do not exist, but are spoken of in accordance with worldly conventions.

original: nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa bzhin brjod byas stong pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa bzhin brjod byas stong pa'i phyir na /
translated: Like the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù they are empty of what is expressed.

original: brjod bya med par rab tu byed pa rdzogs kyi bar gyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod bya med par rab tu byed pa rdzogs kyi bar gyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The absence of what is expressed will be fully taught up to the end of this chapter.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi rjod byed ni brjod bya med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi rjod byed ni brjod bya med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the expressions of these such as endurance are without what is expressed.

original: tha snyad kyi dbang gis brjod pa 'ga' zhig tu grub kyi don dam pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dbang gis brjod pa 'ga' zhig tu grub kyi don dam pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Some things are established by the power of convention, but not by the power of the ultimate.

original: gal te gsungs pa thams cad dngos med pa tshig tsam kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te gsungs pa thams cad dngos med pa tshig tsam kho na yin na /
translated: If all that is said is mere words,

original: gang du bcom ldan @272b 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang du bcom ldan @272b 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: then how could the Buddha have said:

original: bdag nyid la ni bdag nyid mgon //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni bdag nyid mgon //
translated: The self is the protector of the self;üîΩwho else could be the protector?

original: rjes su mgon byed gzhan su zhig / bdag nyid legs par dul gyur na //
analyzed: rjes su mgon byed gzhan su zhig / bdag nyid legs par dul gyur na //
translated: When the self is well disciplined,

original: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
translated: the wise attain the higher realms.

original: zhes gsungs pa de la bdag la sogs pa yod pa min na mgon la sogs pa ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de la bdag la sogs pa yod pa min na mgon la sogs pa ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: If the self and so on do not exist, how could it be tenable to say that the self is the protector of the self?

original: de'i phyir yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the self and so on exist.

original: gal te yang khyod ni rang nyid kyis yongs su spangs nas rtsod pa'i skabs tshol bar byed la de lta na yang smras pa /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod ni rang nyid kyis yongs su spangs nas rtsod pa'i skabs tshol bar byed la de lta na yang smras pa /
translated: Even though you have completely abandoned the self and seek an opportunity to debate, we have said:üîΩThe self is not the self; the self is not selfless;

original: bdag min bdag med min bdag dang // bdag med min pas rjod 'ga'ang med //
analyzed: bdag min bdag med min bdag dang // bdag med min pas rjod 'ga'ang med //
translated: the self is not the possessor of the self; the self is not the non-possessor of the self.üîΩThe self is inexpressible;

original: brjod bya mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: brjod bya mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: nirvana is also inexpressible.

original: dngos po kun gyis rang bzhin stong //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyis rang bzhin stong //
translated: All things are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de la bdag med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de la bdag med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthere is no self‚Äù is a remainder.

original: 'dir bsgom pa las byung ba'i ngor rlom sems pa ni bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa las byung ba'i ngor rlom sems pa ni bdag ces bya'o //
translated: Here, the one who conceives of himself as the object of meditation is called the ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: de nyid sred pa'i dngos por gyur pas sred pa'i snying stobs kyi phyir sems can no //
analyzed: de nyid sred pa'i dngos por gyur pas sred pa'i snying stobs kyi phyir sems can no //
translated: Since he is the object of craving, he is called a ‚Äúsentient being‚Äù because of the courage of craving.

original: srog gi dbang po dang 'brel bas 'tsho bas na srog go //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang 'brel bas 'tsho bas na srog go //
translated: Since he is connected with the life faculty, he is called ‚Äúlife‚Äù because of living.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas skye ba gzhan du skye bar byed pas skye ba po'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas skye ba gzhan du skye bar byed pas skye ba po'o //
translated: Since he is born in another life through karma and afflictions, he is called a ‚Äúliving being.‚Äù

original: yid gtso bor gyur pa las skyes pas shed las skyes so //
analyzed: yid gtso bor gyur pa las skyes pas shed las skyes so //
translated: Since he is born from the mind that is the principal factor, he is called a ‚Äúhuman.‚Äù

original: yid shas che bar gyur ba'i phyir shed can no //
analyzed: yid shas che bar gyur ba'i phyir shed can no //
translated: Since the mind is dominant, he is called a ‚Äúperson.‚Äù

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i las byed du 'jug pa'i phyir byed pa po'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i las byed du 'jug pa'i phyir byed pa po'o //
translated: Since he is engaged in virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions, he is called an ‚Äúagent.‚Äù

original: de'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pa'i phyir rig pa po'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pa'i phyir rig pa po'o //
translated: Since he experiences the results of those actions, he is called a ‚Äúknower.‚Äù

original: yul yongs su dpyod pa'i phyir shes pa po'o //
analyzed: yul yongs su dpyod pa'i phyir shes pa po'o //
translated: Since he analyzes objects, he is called a ‚Äúperceiver.‚Äù

original: dpyod par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams de'i ming gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams de'i ming gi khyad par ro //
translated: Because it is the analyzer, it is the seer, and so on. These are the specific names of the self.

original: bdag de yang rtsa ba'i rab byed bcu par ;üîΩ/ re zhig shing la me min zhing //
analyzed: bdag de yang rtsa ba'i rab byed bcu par ; / re zhig shing la me min zhing //
translated: Moreover, in the tenth chapter of the Fundamental Treatise,üîΩFire is not in fuel,

original: shing las gzhan du me ma yin //üîΩme ni shing dang ldan min la //
analyzed: shing las gzhan du me ma yin // me ni shing dang ldan min la //
translated: Nor is fire in fuel.üîΩFire is not conjoined with fuel,

original: me la shing med der de med //
analyzed: me la shing med der de med //
translated: Nor is fire unjoined with fuel.

original: me dang bud shing bshad pa yis //
analyzed: me dang bud shing bshad pa yis //
translated: By explaining fire and fuel,

original: bdag dang nye bar len rim bzhin //
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar len rim bzhin //
translated: The self and appropriation are to be understood in the same way.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis nye bar len pa las de nyid dang gzhan pa rnam pa lngas dpyad na mi srid pas bdag med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis nye bar len pa las de nyid dang gzhan pa rnam pa lngas dpyad na mi srid pas bdag med do zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the self is not possible in any of the five ways, such as being identical to or different from the appropriated aggregates, it is said that the self does not exist.

original: yang na 'dir phyogs snga ma gzhan te /
analyzed: yang na 'dir phyogs snga ma gzhan te /
translated: Or, here the opponent‚Äôs position is different.

original: gal te yang sangs rgyas rnams ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang sangs rgyas rnams ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the buddhas have abandoned the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i gsung dngos po med la /
analyzed: nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i gsung dngos po med la /
translated: they do not lack the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin @273a * //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin @273a * //
translated: The apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: pa ma spangs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i brjod pa don dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: pa ma spangs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i brjod pa don dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But worldly people‚Äôs expressions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù are not empty of meaning.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:üîΩThe expressions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i tshig don dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i tshig don dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: are not accepted by worldly people.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir bdag min ces bdag dgag pa sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag min ces bdag dgag pa sngar bzhin no //
translated: Because the self does not exist.

original: bdag ma grub pas kyang 'jig rten gyi nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i rjod byed kyang brjod byas stong pa'o //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: bdag ma grub pas kyang 'jig rten gyi nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i rjod byed kyang brjod byas stong pa'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Since the self does not exist, the expressions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù are also empty.

original: gal te bdag med na yang de lta na yang ngar 'dzin pa sems las byung ba'i chos rang rig par yod pas de'i rjod byed tshig tsam ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na yang de lta na yang ngar 'dzin pa sems las byung ba'i chos rang rig par yod pas de'i rjod byed tshig tsam ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Here someone might argue as follows: Even if the self does not exist, the expression of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is not just an expression because the apprehension of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù which is a mental event, exists and is self-aware.

original: slar yang ngar 'dzin pa de'i dmigs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang ngar 'dzin pa de'i dmigs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the object of that apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù?

original: bdag go // gal te de lta na bdag med na dmigs pa las gzhan du ngar 'dzin ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag go // gal te de lta na bdag med na dmigs pa las gzhan du ngar 'dzin ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: It is the self. If that is so, then if the self does not exist, how could the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù arise without an object?

original: dmigs pa med par sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba ni med do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba ni med do //
translated: But there is no mind or mental factor that arises without an object.

original: kha cig ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ltos pa med par sems dang sems las byung ba skye ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ltos pa med par sems dang sems las byung ba skye ste /
translated: Some say: Mind and mental factors arise without depending on an external object,

original: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: like dreams and so on.

original: dpe 'di ni gnyi ga la ma grub pas rnam par rig par smra ba'i 'dod pa'i don grub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe 'di ni gnyi ga la ma grub pas rnam par rig par smra ba'i 'dod pa'i don grub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: This example is not established for both parties, so it does not prove the point of the Vij√±aptika.

original: khyod la yang dpe med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo zhe na ;
analyzed: khyod la yang dpe med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo zhe na ;
translated: If you say that the point is not established for you because there is no example,

original: slar yang kho bo'i 'dod pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang kho bo'i 'dod pa ci zhe na /
translated: then what is the point of the Vij√±aptika?

original: rnam par shes pa'i phyi rol la dmigs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phyi rol la dmigs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: It is that consciousness engages external objects.

original: slar yang de ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: slar yang de ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: How is that not established?

original: kho bos sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bos sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is refuted by us.

original: gal te khyod kyi skyon brjod pa nus pa dang ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi skyon brjod pa nus pa dang ldan par gyur na /
translated: If you were able to state a fault,

original: de ltar 'gyur la rag na gnyi ga la grags pa'i dpe brjod pa med pas nus pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur la rag na gnyi ga la grags pa'i dpe brjod pa med pas nus pa med do //
translated: then it would be so, but since you do not state an example that is established for both parties, you are not able to do so.

original: khyod la yang kho bo la ltos nas gnyi ga la grub pa'i dpe nus pa med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: khyod la yang kho bo la ltos nas gnyi ga la grub pa'i dpe nus pa med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo //
translated: For you, too, the example that is established for both of us has no power, and so your intended meaning is not established.

original: slar yang ci kho bo'i 'dod pa rnam par shes pa phyi rol la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: slar yang ci kho bo'i 'dod pa rnam par shes pa phyi rol la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Again, is it that we assert that consciousness is the object of external observation?

original: rnam par shes pa nyid kho bo mi 'dod na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid kho bo mi 'dod na /
translated: But we do not assert consciousness itself.

original: ci'i phyir phyi rol la dmigs par byed pa po nyid kho bo'i 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyi rol la dmigs par byed pa po nyid kho bo'i 'dod pa yin /
translated: Why is it that we assert the agent of external observation?

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kho bos khas blangs la de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa yang 'jig rten pas shes kyi kho bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kho bos khas blangs la de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa yang 'jig rten pas shes kyi kho bos ni ma yin no //
translated: We accept worldly convention, and the object and consciousness of that are known by the world, not by us.

original: khyod kyis kyang kho bo cag dang 'brel ba'i 'jig rten pa'i @273b don 'di sel bar mi nus so //
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang kho bo cag dang 'brel ba'i 'jig rten pa'i @273b don 'di sel bar mi nus so //
translated: You also cannot eliminate this worldly object that is related to us.

original: de la ci 'jig rten pa la sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma grub pas /
analyzed: de la ci 'jig rten pa la sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma grub pas /
translated: In that regard, is it that the world does not establish that mind and mental factors have objects?

original: de las dmigs pas bskyed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa med na de med pas bdag med na ngar 'dzin pa med par grub bo //
analyzed: de las dmigs pas bskyed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa med na de med pas bdag med na ngar 'dzin pa med par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, if the object does not exist, then the mind and mental factors that are generated from the object do not exist. If they do not exist, then the self does not exist. If the self does not exist, then the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is established as nonexistent.

original: kho bos de ltar khas ma blangs so zhe na /
analyzed: kho bos de ltar khas ma blangs so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe do not accept that,‚Äù

original: slar yang ci dngos po 'di dag 'jig rten pa la ma grub pas gang zhig khyod kyang khas mi len nam /
analyzed: slar yang ci dngos po 'di dag 'jig rten pa la ma grub pas gang zhig khyod kyang khas mi len nam /
translated: then again, why do you not accept that these things are not established for the world?

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa la grub la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa la grub la /
translated: We say that these things are established for the world,

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten rmongs pas phyin ci log ji lta ba de lta bar 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes kho bo smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten rmongs pas phyin ci log ji lta ba de lta bar 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes kho bo smra'o //
translated: but the world is confused and engages in error.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i 'di dag kyang kho bos khas mi len no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i 'di dag kyang kho bos khas mi len no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, we do not accept these things of the world.‚Äù

original: smras pa / 'dir don rtogs pa po rnams kyi don rtogs pa 'dzin pa las sam bstan bcos las 'gyur grang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir don rtogs pa po rnams kyi don rtogs pa 'dzin pa las sam bstan bcos las 'gyur grang /
translated: We reply: Do the realizations of the meaning of this treatise come from the understanding of the meaning by the people or from the treatise?

original: de la re zhig 'jig rten pa khyod la tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'jig rten pa khyod la tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: First, you are not a valid person for the world.

original: bstan bcos las khas blangs pa'i don kyang gzhan la bsgrub par nus pa med la /
analyzed: bstan bcos las khas blangs pa'i don kyang gzhan la bsgrub par nus pa med la /
translated: And the meaning of the treatise that you accept cannot be established for others.

original: de'i phyir khyod dang mtshungs pa'i skye bo'i sgra'i rjes su khyod 'jug pa'i rigs kyi mkhas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod dang mtshungs pa'i skye bo'i sgra'i rjes su khyod 'jug pa'i rigs kyi mkhas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, you are not a wise person who engages in the scriptures of the wise.

original: mkhas pa ni 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i bstan bcos kyi tshad ma brjod pas sam /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i bstan bcos kyi tshad ma brjod pas sam /
translated: The wise person is one who speaks with valid treatises that are reasonable.

original: 'jig rten pa las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa las so //
translated: Or, he is one who speaks with the world.

original: 'thad pa med pa tshig tsam gyi bstan bcos tshad mar byed na bstan bcos thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thad pa med pa tshig tsam gyi bstan bcos tshad mar byed na bstan bcos thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a valid treatise out of mere words that are unreasonable, then all treatises would be valid.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la mi ltos pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la mi ltos pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no mind or mental factor that does not depend on an external object.

original: rigs pas dpyad na phyi rol gyi dmigs pa mi srid la /
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na phyi rol gyi dmigs pa mi srid la /
translated: When analyzed with reasoning, an external object is impossible.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos par sems dang sems las byung ba kho na khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos par sems dang sems las byung ba kho na khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, one should accept that mind and mental factors do not depend on external objects.‚Äù

original: ji ltar khyod kyis dpyad pas phyi rol gyi dmigs pa mi srid la /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis dpyad pas phyi rol gyi dmigs pa mi srid la /
translated: How is it that, when analyzed, an external object is impossible?

original: de bzhin du kho bos dpyad na sems dang sems las byung ba ni srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du kho bos dpyad na sems dang sems las byung ba ni srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, when I analyze, mind and mental factors exist because they are possible.üîΩTherefore, like external objects, you should give up the position that mind and mental factors exist in every way.

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yod pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du gtang bar byos shig / slar yang gzhan zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yod pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du gtang bar byos shig / slar yang gzhan zhig gis smras pa /
translated: Again, another says:

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin la /
translated: Not all consciousnesses have objects.

original: gal te yang rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur na /
translated: If all consciousnesses had objects,

original: @274a * // mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: @274a * // mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: then a consciousness that has as its object the son of a barren woman would arise.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have no object.

original: 'o na mo gsham gyi bu zhes pa'i ming 'di nyid 'di'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na mo gsham gyi bu zhes pa'i ming 'di nyid 'di'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the name ‚Äúson of a barren woman‚Äù the object of that consciousness?

original: de ci 'di'i dmigs pa med do zhes smra /
analyzed: de ci 'di'i dmigs pa med do zhes smra /
translated: How can you say that it has no object?

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist.

original: mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra thos pa na gal te 'di'i ming nyid mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra thos pa na gal te 'di'i ming nyid mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the sound of the son of a barren woman were the object of a consciousness that has the name itself as its object,

original: de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bu med do zhes pa na de nyid kyi ming yang med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bu med do zhes pa na de nyid kyi ming yang med par 'gyur na /
translated: then when one says ‚Äúthe son of a barren woman does not exist,‚Äù the name itself would not exist.

original: de lta bu ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de lta bu ni ma yin no ;
translated: But that is not the case.

original: / de'i phyir 'di'i ming nyid la dmigs pas ma yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'di'i ming nyid la dmigs pas ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the name itself is its object.

original: nges par rnam par shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig / rnam par shes pa 'di ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rnam par shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig / rnam par shes pa 'di ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: What is the object of this consciousness? This consciousness has a nonexistent as its object.

original: mo gsham gyi bu ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The son of a barren woman is a nonexistent.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di ni dngos po med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di ni dngos po med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness that has him as its object has a nonexistent as its object.

original: slar khyod kyi dmigs pa'i don ci zhig yin /
analyzed: slar khyod kyi dmigs pa'i don ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the object of consciousness?

original: smras pa / rnam par shes pa la rang gi rnam par gtong pa'i don ni dmigs pa'i don to zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par shes pa la rang gi rnam par gtong pa'i don ni dmigs pa'i don to zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the object of consciousness is that which casts an aspect to consciousness,

original: gal te de lta na mo gsham gyi bu mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par gtod dam ci gal te gtod na de'i tshe dngos po ming pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin
analyzed: gal te de lta na mo gsham gyi bu mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par gtod dam ci gal te gtod na de'i tshe dngos po ming pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin
translated: If you say that consciousness focuses on the son of a barren woman, then it is not tenable that consciousness related to the aspect of a nominal thing is a thing.

original: du mi 'thad pas de 'di dag ni 'ga' la 'gal ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dus gcig la gcig tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du mi 'thad pas de 'di dag ni 'ga' la 'gal ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dus gcig la gcig tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for a thing and a nonthing to be one.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par 'gyur na yang /
translated: Even if a thing and a nonthing were to occur,

original: rnam par shes pa gnyis su ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnyis su ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: how could there be a single consciousness?

original: de dag mun pa dang snang ba dag gcig pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag mun pa dang snang ba dag gcig pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like darkness and light, which are not the same.

original: sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa sngon po yin pa ltar /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa sngon po yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as the object of a consciousness that conceives of blue is blue,

original: dngos po med pa rtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa dngos po med par rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa dngos po med par rigs so //
translated: it is logical that the object of a consciousness that understands a nonthing is a nonthing.

original: de ltar na dngos po med pa dang rnam pa dag 'gal bas 'di ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po med pa dang rnam pa dag 'gal bas 'di ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since the absence of an entity and its aspect are mutually exclusive, this consciousness is not an entity, like the son of a barren woman.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam pa dang 'gal ba'i dkar po bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam pa dang 'gal ba'i dkar po bzhin no //
translated: It is like a consciousness of the aspect of blue that is not the aspect of white, which is mutually exclusive with the aspect of blue.

original: dmigs pa @274b dang rnam pas dben pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa na gang zhig ngo bo tha dad pa'i rnam par 'jog par byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa @274b dang rnam pas dben pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa na gang zhig ngo bo tha dad pa'i rnam par 'jog par byed /
translated: When consciousness is devoid of an object and an aspect, what establishes it as having a different nature?

original: ci nges par dmigs pa'i rnam pa tsam zhig kho na rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: ci nges par dmigs pa'i rnam pa tsam zhig kho na rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: Is consciousness definitely just the aspect of the object?

original: gal te de ltar gyur na de'i tshe dmigs pa nyid rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na de'i tshe dmigs pa nyid rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the object would be consciousness.

original: de ni dmigs pa kho na rnam par shes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa kho na rnam par shes pa ma yin la /
translated: That is not the object itself that is consciousness.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa'i rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa'i rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: However, it is the nature of the ascertainment of the aspect of the object.

original: de nyid kyis na rnam par shes pa dang dmigs pa dag rnam pa mtshungs mod kyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rnam par shes pa dang dmigs pa dag rnam pa mtshungs mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, consciousness and the object have the same aspect.

original: dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: However, the object is not consciousness.

original: yongs su gcad par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / yongs su gcod pa po ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su gcad par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / yongs su gcod pa po ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the nature of what is to be delimited, and because it is not the delimeter.

original: dmigs par byed pa po yang dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa po yang dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The agent of observation is not the observed object,

original: yongs su gcad par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gcad par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the nature of what is to be delimited, and because it is the nature of the delimeter.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rnam pa tsam ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rnam pa tsam ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere aspect of the observed object is not consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it different from the consciousness of the observed object,

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo med do //
translated: because there is no nature of consciousness that is different from the aspect of the observed object.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa rjes su byed pas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dngos po med pa dang rnam pa dag 'gal bas dngos po las log nas rnam par shes pa dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa rjes su byed pas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dngos po med pa dang rnam pa dag 'gal bas dngos po las log nas rnam par shes pa dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, consciousness, which is generated by the imitation of a nonentity, is a nonentity, because the aspect and consciousness are mutually exclusive, having turned away from an entity.

original: rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa na yang mo gsham gyi bu ni dngos po med pa'o zhes ji skad brjod do /
