analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa na yang mo gsham gyi bu ni dngos po med pa'o zhes ji skad brjod do /
translated: But if consciousness is not a thing, how can you say that the son of a barren woman is not a thing?

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa 'di ni skye ba las sngon rol du ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin la ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa 'di ni skye ba las sngon rol du ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin la ;
translated: Moreover, this consciousness is not of the nature of anything prior to its arising.

original: de yang yul gyi rnam pa ma bzung bas skye ba thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: de yang yul gyi rnam pa ma bzung bas skye ba thob par mi byed do //
translated: And it does not cause the attainment of arising by apprehending the aspect of an object.üîΩSo at that time, you should establish the arising of that which is not of the nature of anything by apprehending that which is not a thing.

original: de'i tshe ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin pa 'di la 'dzin pas skye ba bsgrub par byos shig / dngos po med pa la dmigs pas dngos po med pa'i rnam pa thob pa ni skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin pa 'di la 'dzin pas skye ba bsgrub par byos shig / dngos po med pa la dmigs pas dngos po med pa'i rnam pa thob pa ni skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur la /
translated: The attainment of the aspect of a non-thing by observing a non-thing is the attainment of a state that is completely incompatible with arising.

original: ma skyes pas dngos po med pa la 'dzin par rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pas dngos po med pa la 'dzin par rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that the realization of the apprehension of a non-thing is non-arisen.

original: yang na nges par 'dis dngos po med pa la dmigs pa nyid du rtog par byed na /
analyzed: yang na nges par 'dis dngos po med pa la dmigs pa nyid du rtog par byed na /
translated: Moreover, if you definitely imagine that it observes a non-thing,

original: de'i skye ba las snga rol gyi gnas skabs nyid la brtag par bya na /
analyzed: de'i skye ba las snga rol gyi gnas skabs nyid la brtag par bya na /
translated: then you should investigate the state prior to its arising.

original: ma skyes @275a * //
analyzed: ma skyes @275a * //
translated: It is unborn.üîΩüîΩ

original: pa'i gnas skabs su dngos po med pa dang rnam pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i gnas skabs su dngos po med pa dang rnam pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the state of non-arising is incompatible with the entity.

original: yang na gnas skabs de na dmigs pa la 'dzin par byed ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la dmigs pa po nyid ni mi 'dod la /
analyzed: yang na gnas skabs de na dmigs pa la 'dzin par byed ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la dmigs pa po nyid ni mi 'dod la /
translated: Or else, since the entity does not exist at that time, the entity is not accepted as the objective support of the non-existent, because the entity does not have the nature of apprehending the objective support.

original: smos pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir na gnas skabs gzhan yang thob pa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smos pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir na gnas skabs gzhan yang thob pa pa ma yin no //
translated: And, because of the fault of the consequence, the other state is also not the objective support.

original: gal te yang mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pas dngos po mang po la dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang mo gsham gyi bu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pas dngos po mang po la dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the consciousness that has the barren woman‚Äôs son as its objective support has many entities as its objective support,

original: de lta na sngon po'i sgra la ma ltos par sngon po'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra la ma ltos par don rtogs la rag na rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: de lta na sngon po'i sgra la ma ltos par sngon po'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra la ma ltos par don rtogs la rag na rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: then, just as the consciousness that has the aspect of blue does not understand the object without depending on the word blue, so too, without depending on the word barren woman‚Äôs son, the understanding of the object would not exist.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi sgo can gyi rnam par shes pa de ni rgyu mtshan med par 'jug par mi nus so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi sgo can gyi rnam par shes pa de ni rgyu mtshan med par 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: The consciousness that has a reason does not have the ability to engage without a reason.

original: gal te rgyu mtshan las gzhan yang rnam par shes pa 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan las gzhan yang rnam par shes pa 'jug na /
translated: If consciousness were to occur from a cause other than an objective support,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would also occur in nirvana without remainder.

original: skye ba log pas mi 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba log pas mi 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not occur because of the cessation of birth,

original: mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness that has a signless objective support would not cease.

original: nyon mongs pa log na las ldog par 'gyur bas skye ba mi len no zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa log na las ldog par 'gyur bas skye ba mi len no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not take birth because of the cessation of afflictions due to the cessation of karma,

original: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can gyi rnam par shes pa de ltar ma gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can gyi rnam par shes pa de ltar ma gyur kyang /
translated: even if that consciousness that is the cause of karma and afflictions does not occur,

original: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dmigs pa la rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dmigs pa la rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: uncontaminated consciousness would always occur with nirvana as its objective support.

original: rigs pas ni gang zhig chos thams cad skye ba med pa la mtshan ma 'ga' yang mi dmigs la mtshan ma med pas rnam par shes pa mi 'jug go zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pas ni gang zhig chos thams cad skye ba med pa la mtshan ma 'ga' yang mi dmigs la mtshan ma med pas rnam par shes pa mi 'jug go zhes bya'o //
translated: By reasoning, it is said that when no sign of any kind is observed in the non-arising of all phenomena, consciousness does not occur due to the absence of signs.

original: de nyid kyis 'dir stong pa nyid du smra bas chos thams cad sel ba la rjes su sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'dir stong pa nyid du smra bas chos thams cad sel ba la rjes su sgrub par byed la /
translated: Therefore, here, the proponent of emptiness proves that all phenomena are eliminated.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la mtshan ma mi dmigs pas rnam par shes pa ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la mtshan ma mi dmigs pas rnam par shes pa ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness is reversed because the sign is not observed in the nature of all phenomena, which are essenceless.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'phags pas brten pa 'di lta bu //
analyzed: 'phags pas brten pa 'di lta bu //
translated: The noble ones‚Äô reliance is not like this.

original: dngos pos rtogs pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: dngos pos rtogs pa ma yin zhing //
translated: It is not realized through entities.

original: rgyu mtshan med pas rnam shes ni //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pas rnam shes ni //
translated: Since there is no sign,

original: nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness will never arise.

original: 'phags pa lhas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa lhas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: ƒÄryadeva also says:

original: srid pa'i sa bon rnam par shes //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness is the seed of existence.

original: yul ni de yi spyod yul la //
analyzed: yul ni de yi spyod yul la //
translated: Objects are its domain.

original: mthong ba'i yul rnams bdag med phyir //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul rnams bdag med phyir //
translated: Since the seen objects are selfless,

original: srid pa'i sa bon @275b 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon @275b 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: The seed of existence is stopped.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gyi sgo can gyi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu 'ba' zhig pa dmigs pa ma yin no zhes rigs so //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gyi sgo can gyi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu 'ba' zhig pa dmigs pa ma yin no zhes rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that consciousness, which has a sign as its gateway, is not observed, because it has no sign, like the son of a barren woman.

original: gal te gang gi dngos po med pa rnam par shes pas dmigs na'o //
analyzed: gal te gang gi dngos po med pa rnam par shes pas dmigs na'o //
translated: If you think that consciousness perceives the nonexistence of a thing,

original: su zhig 'di skad smra /
analyzed: su zhig 'di skad smra /
translated: who says that?

original: dngos po med pa 'di ni rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba'o zhes pa 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'di ni rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba'o zhes pa 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: You should say this: ‚ÄúThe nonexistence of a thing is perceived by consciousness.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i sgo la mi ltos par dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig rnam par shes pas mi dmigs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i sgo la mi ltos par dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig rnam par shes pas mi dmigs so zhes bya ste /
translated: We say that consciousness does not perceive a bare nonexistence that does not depend on a thing.

original: dper na sngon po'i rnam par shes pa ser po la sogs pa la mi ltos pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na sngon po'i rnam par shes pa ser po la sogs pa la mi ltos pa bzhin /
translated: For example, a consciousness of blue does not depend on a consciousness of yellow, etc.

original: ji ltar na dngos po'i sgo can yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos po'i sgo can yin /
translated: How can it be that it depends on a thing?

original: slar yang 'di'i gtan med kyi rnam par shes pa mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra la ltos pa bzhin no //üîΩ'dir sgra 'ga' zhig ni don dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'di'i gtan med kyi rnam par shes pa mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra la ltos pa bzhin no // 'dir sgra 'ga' zhig ni don dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is like the consciousness of the son of a barren woman, which does not depend on a sound.üîΩHere some sounds have meaning,

original: 'ga' zhig don med pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig don med pa'o //
translated: and some sounds do not have meaning.

original: don dang bcas pa ni lha sbyin la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: don dang bcas pa ni lha sbyin la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Sounds such as ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù have meaning.

original: lha sbyin ni 'jig rten na za ba'i bya ba rdzogs pa'i rgyur dmigs pas don nges na lha sbyin gyi sgra don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin ni 'jig rten na za ba'i bya ba rdzogs pa'i rgyur dmigs pas don nges na lha sbyin gyi sgra don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù is meaningful in the sense that it is the cause for the perception of the act of eating in the world.

original: mo gsham gyi bu bstan kyang 'jig rten pa la mi dmigs la /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bstan kyang 'jig rten pa la mi dmigs la /
translated: Even though the son of a barren woman is taught, he is not perceived in the world.

original: dmigs pa ma yin pa ni dngos po zhes rnam par mi 'jig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma yin pa ni dngos po zhes rnam par mi 'jig go //
translated: And what is not perceived is not destroyed as a thing.

original: de'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra 'di yang bsgrub bya'i don gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu'i sgra 'di yang bsgrub bya'i don gyis stong pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this word ‚Äúson of a barren woman‚Äù is also empty of the object to be established.

original: rnam par shes pa yang sgra'i don mngon par shes pa rnams la don gyis stong pa'i sgra la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang sgra'i don mngon par shes pa rnams la don gyis stong pa'i sgra la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Consciousness also observes a word that is empty of meaning for those who understand the meaning of a word.

original: don dngos po med pa'i sgo nas don med pa nyid du nges par 'gyur la /
analyzed: don dngos po med pa'i sgo nas don med pa nyid du nges par 'gyur la /
translated: One will ascertain that it is meaningless by way of the nonexistence of the object.

original: de la 'di'i sgra'i don yul 'ga' zhig na med cing dus nam zhig na med la rtogs pa po 'ga' zhig la snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di'i sgra'i don yul 'ga' zhig na med cing dus nam zhig na med la rtogs pa po 'ga' zhig la snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: In that regard, one should say that the meaning of this word does not exist in some place, does not exist at some time, and does not appear to some cognizer.

original: thams cad du dmigs pas gtan med ces 'jig rten du rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: thams cad du dmigs pas gtan med ces 'jig rten du rnam par 'jog go //
translated: It is posited in the world as completely nonexistent because it is not observed at all.

original: de yang 'di'i gtan med ni sgra'i dngos po la brten te /
analyzed: de yang 'di'i gtan med ni sgra'i dngos po la brten te /
translated: Moreover, the non-existence of this is imagined on the basis of the entity of sound.

original: sgra'i don mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas yongs su brtags la /
analyzed: sgra'i don mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas yongs su brtags la /
translated: It is imagined by the world on the basis of the non-apprehension of the object of sound.

original: de bzhin du dngos po la brten nas snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pa pa rnams 'jig rten pas rnam par brtags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po la brten nas snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pa pa rnams 'jig rten pas rnam par brtags so //
translated: Similarly, non-existence prior to that and mutual non-existence are imagined by the world on the basis of entities.

original: de la da lta ba'i dngos po la ltos nas de'i skye ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la snga na med pa zhes rnam par 'jog la /üîΩnam yang dngos po mi srid pa de ni snga na med pa ma @276a * //
analyzed: de la da lta ba'i dngos po la ltos nas de'i skye ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la snga na med pa zhes rnam par 'jog la / nam yang dngos po mi srid pa de ni snga na med pa ma @276a * //
translated: In this regard, non-existence prior to that is posited in dependence on the present entity, in relation to the state prior to its arising.

original: yin te / 'di lta ste mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: yin te / 'di lta ste mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: That which is never possible as an entity is not non-existence prior to that, like the son of a barren woman.

original: da ltar ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ni mi rtag pa'i phyir /üîΩgang zhig 'jig pa'i gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ni mi rtag pa'i phyir / gang zhig 'jig pa'i gnas skabs sam /
translated: The nature of the present entity is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la zhig nas med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la zhig nas med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is in the state of destruction or impermanence is called ‚Äúnon-existence after destruction.‚Äù

original: gcig la gcig med pa yang gsal bar dngos po la brten pa nyid do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa yang gsal bar dngos po la brten pa nyid do zhes bya ste /
translated: Mutual non-existence is also clearly dependent on entities.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba dngos po la ltos pa 'ba' zhig pa rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa ni mdo de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba dngos po la ltos pa 'ba' zhig pa rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa ni mdo de nyid kyis na /
translated: The so-called non-entity is only dependent on an entity, and is apprehended by consciousness.

original: 'phags pa lhas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa lhas gsungs pa /
translated: ƒÄryadeva says:

original: dngos po med na dngos med ni //
analyzed: dngos po med na dngos med ni //
translated: If there is no entity,

original: shes pa srid pa ma yin la //
analyzed: shes pa srid pa ma yin la //
translated: non-entity is not possible to know.

original: dngos po med na dngos med ni //
analyzed: dngos po med na dngos med ni //
translated: If there is no non-entity,

original: grub par 'gyur ba ga la zhig / ces gsungs so //üîΩde nyid kyis na gang du mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: grub par 'gyur ba ga la zhig / ces gsungs so // de nyid kyis na gang du mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: how could a non-entity be established?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pa na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pa na /
translated: Therefore, wherever the nature of nirvƒÅ·πáa or a phenomenon similar to nirvƒÅ·πáa is understood,

original: de la dngos po med pa yang nye bar len pa med pas med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa yang nye bar len pa med pas med do zhes bya ste /
translated: there non-entity is also not appropriated and does not exist.

original: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po dang dngos po med pa la kun du 'dzin pa zad pas rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'gog pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po dang dngos po med pa la kun du 'dzin pa zad pas rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'gog pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the complete exhaustion of the grasping of entity and non-entity, the yogis and yoginƒ´s attain the non-arising of consciousness and the cessation of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de'i phyir 'dir dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa med la /
translated: Therefore, consciousness that observes only non-entity does not exist.

original: de las kyang bdag ma grub pas ngar 'dzin pa'i brjod pa dngos po med pa'o zhes 'dir grub bo //
analyzed: de las kyang bdag ma grub pas ngar 'dzin pa'i brjod pa dngos po med pa'o zhes 'dir grub bo //
translated: Moreover, since the self is not established, it is established here that the expression ‚ÄúI‚Äù is a non-entity.

original: 'o na chos 'di dag ni rang rig bas myong ba 'di lta ste ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yig 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na chos 'di dag ni rang rig bas myong ba 'di lta ste ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yig 'dzin pa'o //
translated: But these phenomena are experienced by reflexive awareness, such as the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the apprehension of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gal te de dag dmigs par bya bar med kyang de lta na yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa 'di dag ni med pa'o zhes brjod par mi nus so zhe na /üîΩci byang phyogs su kha bltas sam /
analyzed: gal te de dag dmigs par bya bar med kyang de lta na yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa 'di dag ni med pa'o zhes brjod par mi nus so zhe na / ci byang phyogs su kha bltas sam /
translated: Even if they are not objects of observation, still, because they are the nature of experience, it is not possible to say that the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the apprehension of ‚Äúmine‚Äù do not exist.

original: 'on te gzhan du kha ba ltas pa yin //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du kha ba ltas pa yin //
translated: Do you face north or do you face another direction?

original: 'di ni shar gyi phyogs so zhes nyams su myong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni shar gyi phyogs so zhes nyams su myong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that you experience this as the eastern direction?

original: byang la sogs pa'i phyogs 'di rnams shar phyogs su 'gyur ba mi rigs la /
analyzed: byang la sogs pa'i phyogs 'di rnams shar phyogs su 'gyur ba mi rigs la /
translated: It is not tenable that these northern and other directions become the eastern direction.

original: rab rib can gyis skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i don med kyang rang gis ci'i phyir nyams su ma myong /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i don med kyang rang gis ci'i phyir nyams su ma myong /
translated: Why don‚Äôt those with eye disease experience nonexistent things such as hair, bees, and so on?

original: 'di dag sems can gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag sems can gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: They do not arise from other sentient beings.

original: nyams su myong ba tsam gyis yang dag pa'i don gyi @276b dngos por rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam gyis yang dag pa'i don gyi @276b dngos por rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot posit the experience of the mere appearance of things as the real thing.

original: de'i phyir gal te rang nyid kyis ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa nyams su myong yang de lta na yang yod par lung dang rigs pa dang 'gal bas med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rang nyid kyis ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa nyams su myong yang de lta na yang yod par lung dang rigs pa dang 'gal bas med do zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if you experience the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù still, because that contradicts scripture and reasoning, it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù of the world is the same as the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù of the TathƒÅgata.

original: chos thams cad ming tsam du grub bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad ming tsam du grub bo //
translated: All phenomena are established as mere names.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te de ltar bdag med kyang //
analyzed: gal te de ltar bdag med kyang //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though there is no self,

original: re zhig de dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa yod la /
analyzed: re zhig de dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa yod la /
translated: there is a selflessness that is the opposite of that.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi rang bzhin dang 'gal bas chos thams cad ni bdag med par khas blangs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi rang bzhin dang 'gal bas chos thams cad ni bdag med par khas blangs so //
translated: Likewise, because of being contradictory with the nature of self, all phenomena are accepted as selfless.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pas bdag ni mi rtag pa ma skyes pa ngar 'dzin pa'i yul te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pas bdag ni mi rtag pa ma skyes pa ngar 'dzin pa'i yul te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄòAll phenomena are selfless.‚Äô Self is impermanent, unarisen, the object of the conception of ‚ÄòI.‚Äô

original: chos thams cad ni de lta ma yin no zhes so //üîΩde'i phyir bdag gi rang bzhin dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni de lta ma yin no zhes so // de'i phyir bdag gi rang bzhin dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ram /
translated: All phenomena are not like that.‚Äù

original: bdag dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni bdag med ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni bdag med ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because of being contradictory with the nature of self, because of being selfless, or because of being devoid of self, all phenomena are selfless.

original: de yang yod la de'i phyir bdag gi chos med pas chos thams cad ming tsam ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang yod la de'i phyir bdag gi chos med pas chos thams cad ming tsam ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And since that exists, because of the absence of the phenomena of self, all phenomena are not mere names.

original: smras pa / ci khyod ni bdag med pa la phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: smras pa / ci khyod ni bdag med pa la phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs par byed /
translated: In response to that, it is said: Do you superimpose the opposite of selflessness?

original: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gi dngos po med pa dang / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gi dngos po med pa dang / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: The nonexistence of the self imagined by the heterodox and the selflessness of all things are not established by the nonexistence of the self and by the nonself nature imagined by the heterodox.

original: de lta na ji ltar 'dir bdag med pa yin /üîΩnye bar len pa la btags nas sam /
analyzed: de lta na ji ltar 'dir bdag med pa yin / nye bar len pa la btags nas sam /
translated: How then is selflessness here?üîΩIt is taught as the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas.

original: rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs la bdag med pa nyid du bstan pa na don chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs la bdag med pa nyid du bstan pa na don chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the great meaning is taught as the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas, great benefit arises.

original: de la phung po la brten nas btags pa'i gang zag la bdag ces brjod de /
analyzed: de la phung po la brten nas btags pa'i gang zag la bdag ces brjod de /
translated: In this regard, the person is designated in dependence on the aggregates and is called the self,

original: 'jig rten pa'i ngar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ngar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the worldly conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The self imagined by the heterodox is not so.

original: de yang mun nag gi nang du gyur pa'i skyes bu'i rnam pa la yongs su brtags pa bzhin du nyung zad kyis shin tu phyin ci log pas yongs su brtags kyi /
analyzed: de yang mun nag gi nang du gyur pa'i skyes bu'i rnam pa la yongs su brtags pa bzhin du nyung zad kyis shin tu phyin ci log pas yongs su brtags kyi /
translated: That self is imagined to be like a person in a dark cave, with a slight resemblance, but with a great deal of error.

original: 'di ni ma lus pa'i 'gro bas yongs su brtags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ma lus pa'i 'gro bas yongs su brtags pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not imagined by all migrating beings.

original: gang du phung po la brten nas 'gro ba ma lus pa nga yir 'dzin pa'i yin la /
analyzed: gang du phung po la brten nas 'gro ba ma lus pa nga yir 'dzin pa'i yin la /
translated: Where the self is imagined in dependence on the aggregates, that is imagined as ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: @277a * // de ni mngon bar zhen pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'dir bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: @277a * // de ni mngon bar zhen pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'dir bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Since that is the basis of attachment, it is to be eliminated here.

original: bdag brtags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rnam par gzhag pa nyid las shin tu bsal ba'i phyir de ni de kho na nyid la dpyod pa'i dbang du byas kyi /
analyzed: bdag brtags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rnam par gzhag pa nyid las shin tu bsal ba'i phyir de ni de kho na nyid la dpyod pa'i dbang du byas kyi /
translated: The self‚Äôs imputation is completely eliminated in the context of the presentation of worldly conventions, so that is done in the context of analyzing reality.

original: de sel ba'i dbang du byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: de sel ba'i dbang du byas pa ma yin /
translated: It is not done in the context of eliminating that.

original: gal te mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag 'dir 'gegs par mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag 'dir 'gegs par mi byed na /
translated: If the self imputed by tƒ´rthikas is not refuted here,

original: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis ci zhig dgag pa'i don du 'di skad gsungs /
analyzed: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis ci zhig dgag pa'i don du 'di skad gsungs /
translated: then what is the point of the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs statement:

original: mig ni bdag dang bdag gi brtag pa brten pa ther zug pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pas stong par grub bo zhes so//
analyzed: mig ni bdag dang bdag gi brtag pa brten pa ther zug pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pas stong par grub bo zhes so//
translated: The eye is empty because it is not tenable to impute the self and being mine to it, because it is dependent, because it is impermanent, and because it is subject to change.

original: mig la brten nas btags pa'i bdag gis stong pa dang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du lung 'dis gsal bar mdzad kyi /
analyzed: mig la brten nas btags pa'i bdag gis stong pa dang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du lung 'dis gsal bar mdzad kyi /
translated: This sutra clearly explains that the self imputed in dependence on the eyes is empty of intrinsic existence.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not explain that the eyes are empty of an internal creator.

original: de la mig ni bdag gis stong ngo zhes pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched la brten nas gang zhig la btags la bdag de ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la rnam pa lngas med kyang phung po dang khams dang skye mched la brtan nas
analyzed: de la mig ni bdag gis stong ngo zhes pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched la brten nas gang zhig la btags la bdag de ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la rnam pa lngas med kyang phung po dang khams dang skye mched la brtan nas
translated: The eyes are empty of self means that the self imputed in dependence on the aggregates, elements, and bases does not exist in the aggregates, elements, and bases in any of the five ways.

original: 'dogs la / de yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dogs la / de yang med pa nyid de /
translated: However, the self is still imputed in dependence on the aggregates, elements, and bases, and it is also nonexistent.üîΩOne should understand that the eyes and so on are also nonexistent in each of the five ways.

original: mig la sogs pa so so la rnam pa lngas kyang med pa nyid du khong du chud par bya'o zhes thar pa 'dod pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das gdams pa ston par bzhed pa nyid kyis mig ni bdag gis stong par grub po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa so so la rnam pa lngas kyang med pa nyid du khong du chud par bya'o zhes thar pa 'dod pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das gdams pa ston par bzhed pa nyid kyis mig ni bdag gis stong par grub po zhes gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, wishing to teach those who desire liberation, said, ‚ÄúThe eyes are empty of self.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mig la dpyad pa na bdag mi srid pa de'i phyir mig ni bdag gis stong pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la dpyad pa na bdag mi srid pa de'i phyir mig ni bdag gis stong pa ste /
translated: Because the self is not possible when the eye is investigated, therefore the eye is empty of self.

original: bdag dang bral ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag dang bral ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is devoid of self.

original: shva'i sgra ni ga pa la sogs par dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: shva'i sgra ni ga pa la sogs par dpyad pa ste /
translated: The ≈õva suffix is analyzed as gha√± and so on.

original: des na de'i phyir bshad pa zhes pas 'di'i don ni ga ba la sogs pa la yang dang ti byas pas shu n+ya ste stong pa'am dben pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir bshad pa zhes pas 'di'i don ni ga ba la sogs pa la yang dang ti byas pas shu n+ya ste stong pa'am dben pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of that, the meaning of this is that it is empty ≈õ≈´nya, devoid of gha√± and so on, because of the addition of the suffix ta.

original: 'phros pa las ring po nyid do zhes pa'am ga ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa las skye bo dang bral ba'i dben pa la stong pa'i sgrar sgra pa rnams 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: 'phros pa las ring po nyid do zhes pa'am ga ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa las skye bo dang bral ba'i dben pa la stong pa'i sgrar sgra pa rnams 'chad par byed do //
translated: Or the grammarians explain that the term empty ≈õ≈´nya refers to the absence of jana and so on, because of the explanation of gha√± and so on.

original: des na gang zhig gang dang bral ba de des stong pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang dang bral ba de des stong pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is devoid of that is empty of that.

original: 'di ni bshad pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni bshad pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the explanation.

original: mod pa la yang stong pa'i sgra mthong ste /
analyzed: mod pa la yang stong pa'i sgra mthong ste /
translated: The term empty is also seen in the present tense.

original: 'di lta ste lha sbyin gyis stong pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lha sbyin gyis stong pa'o zhes so //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThe house of Devadatta is empty.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni snga ma nyid gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni snga ma nyid gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the past tense should be accepted.

original: mig ni bdag dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bdag med pas bdag gi cung @277b zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig ni bdag dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bdag med pas bdag gi cung @277b zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: The eye is empty because it is devoid of a self. Since it is devoid of a self, it does not exist even a little bit as mine.

original: bdag gir bya ba dang bral bas stong la /
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba dang bral bas stong la /
translated: It is empty because it is devoid of being mine.

original: bdag gir bya ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i mig gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i mig gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no eye that is different from the nature of being mine.

original: mig la brten nas bdag tu btags pa dang ldan pa bzhin bdag gis bdag tu byas pas 'di ni bdag gi ba zhes bya la /üîΩbdag med na nye bar blangs pa 'ga' yang med pas nye bar len pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa las gzhan pa'i mig med la /
analyzed: mig la brten nas bdag tu btags pa dang ldan pa bzhin bdag gis bdag tu byas pas 'di ni bdag gi ba zhes bya la / bdag med na nye bar blangs pa 'ga' yang med pas nye bar len pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa las gzhan pa'i mig med la /
translated: The self is imputed in dependence on the eye, and since the self is made into a self by the self, it is called mine.

original: bdag gi bas stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pas mig gi rang bzhin ma grub pa nyid bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bas stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pas mig gi rang bzhin ma grub pa nyid bshad pa'o //
translated: Since there is no appropriation at all without a self, appropriation is not tenable. Since there is no eye other than appropriation, and since it is established that the eye is empty of being mine, the nature of the eye is not established.

original: yang na bdag gi sgra ni rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: yang na bdag gi sgra ni rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs te /
translated: Alternatively, the term mine is a synonym for nature.

original: mig bdag gis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig bdag gis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe eye is empty of self‚Äù means ‚Äúempty by nature.‚Äù

original: bdag gi bas zhes pa rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i gang su yang rung bas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi bas zhes pa rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i gang su yang rung bas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúempty of what belongs to a self‚Äù means ‚Äúempty of any nature whatsoever.‚Äù

original: 'o na de lta na mig nyid med do zhes smras par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na mig nyid med do zhes smras par 'gyur bas /
translated: Well then, it would follow that the statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not exist‚Äù would be made.

original: de ltar smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar smra bar bya ste /
translated: This is exactly what we would say.

original: mig med do zhes de nyid gsal por smra bar byos shig / smras pa /
analyzed: mig med do zhes de nyid gsal por smra bar byos shig / smras pa /
translated: So go ahead and clearly state that the eye does not exist.

original: kho bo ni mig nyid med do zhes mi smra ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni mig nyid med do zhes mi smra ste /
translated: Objection: I do not say that the eye does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir mig med par 'jig rten pa smra'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig med par 'jig rten pa smra'am /
translated: Why do you say that the world speaks of the nonexistence of the eye?

original: bstan bcos las bshad /üîΩde la re zhig 'jig rten pa la mig med do zhes smra ba med de /
analyzed: bstan bcos las bshad / de la re zhig 'jig rten pa la mig med do zhes smra ba med de /
translated: Response: This is explained in the treatise.

original: bdag tu brten pa la nye bar brten pa nyid kyi mig yod bzhin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag tu brten pa la nye bar brten pa nyid kyi mig yod bzhin pa'i phyir te /
translated: First, the world does not speak of the nonexistence of the eye because the eye exists in dependence on the self.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug go zhes pas ming dang gzugs la brten nas byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug go zhes pas ming dang gzugs la brten nas byung ba'i phyir /
translated: This is because the statement ‚ÄúThe six sense bases are conditioned by name and form‚Äù indicates that the eye arises in dependence on name and form.

original: des na gzugs mthong ba dang reg pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na gzugs mthong ba dang reg pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the cause of seeing and touching form.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar 'jig rten pa la mig med do zhes med na de'i tshe kho bo 'jig rten pa mig med par khas len no zhes ji ltar smra /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar 'jig rten pa la mig med do zhes med na de'i tshe kho bo 'jig rten pa mig med par khas len no zhes ji ltar smra /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe eye does not exist in the world,‚Äù then at that time, how could you say, ‚ÄúWe accept that the eye does not exist in the world‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir re zhig 'jig rten pa mig med do zhes mi smra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig 'jig rten pa mig med do zhes mi smra'o //
translated: Therefore, first, you should not say, ‚ÄúThe eye does not exist in the world.‚Äù

original: da ni bstan bcos las kyang mig med do zhes bstan pa bstan bcos zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa'i lam des nyon mongs pa 'jig par byed pas so //
analyzed: da ni bstan bcos las kyang mig med do zhes bstan pa bstan bcos zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa'i lam des nyon mongs pa 'jig par byed pas so //
translated: Now, the treatise also teaches that the eye does not exist. The treatise is the unmistaken path. Since it destroys afflictions,

original: 'gog pa na 'jig rten pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa na 'jig rten pa ste /
translated: it is worldly.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na gsod pan chad pa chen pos 'jig par byed do zhes zer la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na gsod pan chad pa chen pos 'jig par byed do zhes zer la /
translated: In the world, it is said, ‚ÄúThose who kill are destroyed by a great punishment.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log pa'i lam yang phyin ci log nye bar bstan pa las nye bar thob pa yod pa mi srid ces bya ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i lam yang phyin ci log nye bar bstan pa las nye bar thob pa yod pa mi srid ces bya ste /
translated: The mistaken path is also the mistaken teaching. It is impossible to obtain that which exists.

original: mi dmigs @278a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs @278a * //
translated: Because it is not observed.

original: pa'i phyir de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i mig med do zhes med pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa'i phyir de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i mig med do zhes med pa nyid do //
translated: At that time, the eye of the world does not exist. Therefore, it does not exist.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin mchog tu rjes su tshol ba nyid ni de'i phyin ci ma log pa'i lam de yang rang bzhin med pa skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir snang ba med pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin mchog tu rjes su tshol ba nyid ni de'i phyin ci ma log pa'i lam de yang rang bzhin med pa skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir snang ba med pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: That is also called ‚Äúnonappearance‚Äù because it is devoid of nature, because it is unborn.

original: dmigs pa med pa rnal 'byor pa su zhig gis khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rnal 'byor pa su zhig gis khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: What yogi would comprehend the nonexistence of the object?

original: khong du chud pa med pas med pa nyid nye bar ston par mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khong du chud pa med pas med pa nyid nye bar ston par mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: Since there is no comprehension, nonexistence is not demonstrated.

original: de ltar bstan bcos las kyang mig med do zhes kho bo mi smra'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos las kyang mig med do zhes kho bo mi smra'o //
translated: Thus, a treatise also says, ‚ÄúI do not say that the eye does not exist.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa la kun rdzob tu mig rang gi mtshan nyid sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa khas blangs shing de don dam par med do zhes rtog pa de
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa la kun rdzob tu mig rang gi mtshan nyid sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa khas blangs shing de don dam par med do zhes rtog pa de
translated: Thus, in the context of the presentation of the two truths, conventional and ultimate, the eye is accepted as conventional truth, which is like an illusion, a mirage, or a city of gandharvas.

original: rnams ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos yang dag par rtogs par mi brjod do //
analyzed: rnams ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos yang dag par rtogs par mi brjod do //
translated: and the treatises on the middle way are not said to be the means of understanding reality.

original: mig ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid grub pa lta bur byis pa rnams kyis rtogs pas /
analyzed: mig ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid grub pa lta bur byis pa rnams kyis rtogs pas /
translated: The eye, which is not established by intrinsic identity, is perceived by the childish as if it were established by intrinsic identity.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu mig gi rang gi mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu mig gi rang gi mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, the eye does not exist conventionally by virtue of its intrinsic identity.

original: gang zhig kho na kun rdzob tu yang med la de kho na nyid kyi shes pa la yang de nyid med pa'i phyin ci log tu brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig kho na kun rdzob tu yang med la de kho na nyid kyi shes pa la yang de nyid med pa'i phyin ci log tu brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist even conventionally is not imagined to be a distortion in the cognition of reality.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams de khong du chud pa la mngon par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams de khong du chud pa la mngon par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because yogis do not aspire to understand that.

original: yang na kun rdzob tu mig yod la don dam par med do zhes pa'i tshig gi rigs pa yang gdon mi za bar nus par rung na yang /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob tu mig yod la don dam par med do zhes pa'i tshig gi rigs pa yang gdon mi za bar nus par rung na yang /
translated: Or, if it is possible to use the expression ‚Äúthe eye exists conventionally, but does not exist ultimately,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang rang gi mtshan nyid khas len pa dang spong ba dag nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rang gi mtshan nyid khas len pa dang spong ba dag nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: then still, it is not possible to accept or reject intrinsic identity.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob tu phyin ci log med la don dam par rang bzhin med pa nus pa dang ldan no zhes pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob tu phyin ci log med la don dam par rang bzhin med pa nus pa dang ldan no zhes pa yang /
translated: Likewise, the statement ‚ÄúAlthough there is no error conventionally, ultimately it has no intrinsic reality and is endowed with power‚Äù is also like that.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs pa de ni skyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs pa de ni skyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The assertion of the intrinsic identity of things is not suitable as an example, such as an illusion.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs pa la sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / slu ba med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs pa la sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / slu ba med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the assertion of intrinsic identity is not related to an example, such as an illusion, and because it is asserted to be undeceiving.

original: gal te de ltar mig stong pa nyid du khyod la ma grub na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mig stong pa nyid du khyod la ma grub na /
translated: If you do not establish that the eye is emptiness in that way,üîΩthen how is the eye‚Äôs emptiness of self and being mine established by the reasoning explained above?

original: ji skad smos pa'i rigs pas mig bdag dang bdag gi bas stong par bshad pas mig rang bzhin gyis stong par ci zhig 'grub @278b ci nges par mig gi rang bzhin yod pa gang zhig dang bral ba las mig rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni ma yin te
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i rigs pas mig bdag dang bdag gi bas stong par bshad pas mig rang bzhin gyis stong par ci zhig 'grub @278b ci nges par mig gi rang bzhin yod pa gang zhig dang bral ba las mig rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni ma yin te
translated: What is the intrinsic reality of the eye that is not devoid of intrinsic reality?

original: / gal te yin na de'i tshe de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: / gal te yin na de'i tshe de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it were, then it would not be emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: gal te 'di ltar rang bzhin med pa de ni sel ba mi rung la /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar rang bzhin med pa de ni sel ba mi rung la /
translated: If it were like this, then it would be impossible to eliminate intrinsic realitylessness.

original: gang zhig gang na med pa de ni sel bar mi rung zhing gang na med pa der ni sel bar mi byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang na med pa de ni sel bar mi rung zhing gang na med pa der ni sel bar mi byed de /
translated: And if something does not exist somewhere, then it is impossible to eliminate it there.

original: 'di lta ste chu'i dro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chu'i dro ba'o //
translated: For example, it is impossible to eliminate the heat of water.

original: rang bzhin du skyes pa sel bar byed na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin du skyes pa sel bar byed na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you eliminate what is born as intrinsic reality, this fault would occur.

original: 'on kyang mig rang bzhin med par gnas pa nyid la 'jig rten pa phyin ci log tu rmongs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mig rang bzhin med par gnas kyang logs su bzhag nas rang bzhin dang bcas par rtogs la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig rang bzhin med par gnas pa nyid la 'jig rten pa phyin ci log tu rmongs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mig rang bzhin med par gnas kyang logs su bzhag nas rang bzhin dang bcas par rtogs la /
translated: However, the eye is established as existing without intrinsic reality, but the consciousness of the world, confused by error, posits the eye as existing with intrinsic reality, although it exists without intrinsic reality.

original: de la mngon bar zhen pas 'di dag kho na bden par yod gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes 'di dag bden par mngon bar zhen pas mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa skyed pas 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: de la mngon bar zhen pas 'di dag kho na bden par yod gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes 'di dag bden par mngon bar zhen pas mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa skyed pas 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: Through the manifest clinging to the reality of that, they grasp the extreme of the reality of those, thinking, ‚ÄúOnly these exist, the others are confused.‚Äù Thus, through the manifest clinging to the reality of those, they generate the bodily knots of grasping the extreme of reality, and they circle in cyclic existence.

original: 'di dag bden par mngon bar zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa de'i gnyen por kho bos mig rang bzhin med par rnam par gnas pa nyid mig rang bzhin med pa'o zhes pa'i tshig gis shes par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag bden par mngon bar zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa de'i gnyen por kho bos mig rang bzhin med par rnam par gnas pa nyid mig rang bzhin med pa'o zhes pa'i tshig gis shes par byed kyi /
translated: The antidote to the physical knot of clinging to the extreme of the true existence of these is the statement ‚ÄúThe eye is empty of the eye, because the eye is devoid of intrinsic existence.‚Äù

original: kho bos rang bzhin sel bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kho bos rang bzhin sel bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: We do not say that the eye is empty of the eye because we are eliminating intrinsic existence.

original: ji skad smros pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad smros pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore the absurd consequence that we would not be able to posit the eye does not follow.

original: gal te de ltar mig rang bzhin stong par bsgrubs na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mig rang bzhin stong par bsgrubs na /
translated: If you prove that the eye is empty of intrinsic nature,

original: de lta na mig de ni rang bzhin gang zhig gis stong par rnam par gzhag par yod pa ste /
analyzed: de lta na mig de ni rang bzhin gang zhig gis stong par rnam par gzhag par yod pa ste /
translated: then in what way is the eye empty of intrinsic nature?

original: 'di ltar khang pa lha sbyin gyis stong ngo zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar khang pa lha sbyin gyis stong ngo zhes brjod pa na /
translated: For example, when it is said that ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs house is empty,‚ÄùüîΩthe house is understood to exist, but Devadatta does not exist.

original: lha sbyin med pa nyid la khyim yod pa nyid du rtogs pas gang du gnyi ga yang stong bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: lha sbyin med pa nyid la khyim yod pa nyid du rtogs pas gang du gnyi ga yang stong bar mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert that both are empty,üîΩthen emptiness is not tenable.

original: de ni stong pa nyid du mi rung de zhes 'dir rnam par rig par smra bas smras pa /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du mi rung de zhes 'dir rnam par rig par smra bas smras pa /
translated: The Proponents of Consciousness respond:

original: gzhan dbang ni yod pa kun brtags ni med pa'i phyir kho bo cag kho na la stong pa 'thad kyi gang zhig stong pa nyid gang zhig gis stong par khas mi len pa'i phyir dbu ma pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dbang ni yod pa kun brtags ni med pa'i phyir kho bo cag kho na la stong pa 'thad kyi gang zhig stong pa nyid gang zhig gis stong par khas mi len pa'i phyir dbu ma pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: Since the dependent is existent and the imagined is nonexistent, emptiness is tenable only for us, not for the Centrists, because they do not accept that anything is empty of anything.

original: stong pa des ci zhig bya ste des stong pa dang de nyid kyis stong par mi rung ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa des ci zhig bya ste des stong pa dang de nyid kyis stong par mi rung ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the use of that emptiness? It is not tenable that it is empty of that, or that it is empty of itself.

original: 'dir gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brjod du med pa dngos po tsam la de ni rnam pa @279a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brjod du med pa dngos po tsam la de ni rnam pa @279a * //
translated: Here, the nature of the dependent is mere thing, inexpressible dependent origination.

original: gnyis te rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis te rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
translated: It is twofold: pure and impure.

original: de la yongs su ma dag pa ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin par yongs su brtags pa'i dri mas bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su ma dag pa ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin par yongs su brtags pa'i dri mas bsgos pa'o //
translated: Of these, the completely impure is the dependent nature that has been habituated since beginningless time in cyclic existence, and is imbued with the stains of the imagined, the imputative subject and object.

original: yongs su dag pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spros pa'i bag chags kyi gnas ngan len spangs nas /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spros pa'i bag chags kyi gnas ngan len spangs nas /
translated: The completely pure is the dependent nature in which the addictions, the negative reflex actions of the imputative subject and object, have been abandoned.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa yongs su gyur pa dag pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa yongs su gyur pa dag pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba /
translated: The transformation of the basis is the nature of the pure transformation of the buddhas, which is to be personally experienced.

original: de yang gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin 'di ni rang nyid kho na mi 'byung ba dang rang bzhin la gzhan gyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye bas na gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: de yang gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin 'di ni rang nyid kho na mi 'byung ba dang rang bzhin la gzhan gyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye bas na gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: Moreover, this dependent nature is dependent because it does not occur by itself alone and because it arises by the power of other conditions.

original: de yang rang bzhin ni dngos po'i ngo bo'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi rkyen las mthong ba'i phyir gzhan dbang du brjod la /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin ni dngos po'i ngo bo'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi rkyen las mthong ba'i phyir gzhan dbang du brjod la /
translated: Moreover, it is called dependent because its nature is the essence of things and because it is seen to be dependent on other conditions.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin la tha dad pa'i phyir dbang gi sgra ni gtso bo la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin la tha dad pa'i phyir dbang gi sgra ni gtso bo la 'jug ste /
translated: The term dependent is used for the principal because it is different from other natures.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'dir ni bdag rang dbang ba'o zhes smra ba na rang nyid gtso bor smra ba'o zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'dir ni bdag rang dbang ba'o zhes smra ba na rang nyid gtso bor smra ba'o zhes bya la /
translated: Thus, when it is said in the world, ‚ÄúI am independent here,‚Äù it is said that one is principal.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang las shes pas gzhan dbang ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang las shes pas gzhan dbang ste /
translated: This is dependent because it is known to be dependent on other things.

original: gzhan las skye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba'o //
translated: It is dependent arising.

original: yang na brgyud cing skyed pas dbang la gzhan dbang ni gzhan gyis bskyed pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na brgyud cing skyed pas dbang la gzhan dbang ni gzhan gyis bskyed pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Or else, since it is generated in dependence, the dependent is that which is generated by another.

original: gzhan dbang de ni kun rdzob kyi dngos po rang yod pa'i phyir dang brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kha na mtho ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dbang de ni kun rdzob kyi dngos po rang yod pa'i phyir dang brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kha na mtho ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: That dependent is emptiness, because it exists conventionally, and because it is not the apprehended object or apprehending subject that is imagined.üîΩAs it is said in a Sutra: ‚ÄúWhatever is absent in this, that is emptiness. Whatever remains present here, that is existent. This is the correct view, just as it is.‚Äù

original: ji skad du mdo las gsungs pa gang zhig gang na med pa de ni stong la gang yang 'dir lhag ma de ni yod pa la 'dir yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes 'di skad smra na stong pa nyid la
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las gsungs pa gang zhig gang na med pa de ni stong la gang yang 'dir lhag ma de ni yod pa la 'dir yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes 'di skad smra na stong pa nyid la
translated: One who speaks in this way is

original: phyin ci ma log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: not mistaken with regard to emptiness.

original: gang du dge sbyong ngam bram ze dag de yang gang zhig gis stong pa mi 'dod na de ni stong pa las phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang du dge sbyong ngam bram ze dag de yang gang zhig gis stong pa mi 'dod na de ni stong pa las phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere are the ascetics or Brahmins who do not accept emptiness? They are mistaken with regard to emptiness.‚Äù

original: 'o na gal te gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the nature of the dependent is intrinsically real, it will not be dependently arisen.

original: su zhig 'di skad smra /
analyzed: su zhig 'di skad smra /
translated: Who says this?

original: skye ba las snga rol du gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin yod do zhes so //
analyzed: skye ba las snga rol du gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin yod do zhes so //
translated: We say that prior to arising, the nature of the dependent exists.

original: skyes nas 'di'i rang bzhin yod do zhes brjod do //üîΩsmras pa / gang zhig skye ba las snga rol du 'di'i rang bzhin med na cir @279b 'gyur ba'i 'di'i skye ba yod pa yin /
analyzed: skyes nas 'di'i rang bzhin yod do zhes brjod do // smras pa / gang zhig skye ba las snga rol du 'di'i rang bzhin med na cir @279b 'gyur ba'i 'di'i skye ba yod pa yin /
translated: We say that after it has arisen, its nature exists.üîΩ Objection: If prior to arising, its nature does not exist, what arises?

original: skyes nas yod pa la 'di ni yod pa'o zhes rung gi ma skyes pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas yod pa la 'di ni yod pa'o zhes rung gi ma skyes pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: After it has arisen, its nature exists. It is appropriate to say that it exists, but not before it has arisen.

original: skyes pa nyid kyang nges par gzung bar mi nus na khyad par brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa nyid kyang nges par gzung bar mi nus na khyad par brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If arising itself cannot be ascertained, it is impossible to ascertain its distinction.

original: pha rol pos 'di zhes pa de las skye bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i khyad par nges par gzung bar mi nus la /
analyzed: pha rol pos 'di zhes pa de las skye bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i khyad par nges par gzung bar mi nus la /
translated: The opponent cannot ascertain the distinction of that which is arising from that which is not arising.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i skye ba med la ma skyes pa la ci yod la nyid ni ga la zhig ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i skye ba med la ma skyes pa la ci yod la nyid ni ga la zhig ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since it does not arise, how could it exist, and how could it be this or that?

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist.

original: gal te 'di yod pa ma yin na rgyu mtshan med pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di yod pa ma yin na rgyu mtshan med pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not exist, then without a reason, cyclic existence and nirvana would not exist.

original: gal te re zhig 'di yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig 'di yod par gyur na /
translated: If it existed,

original: mu stegs byed kyis brtags pa'i bdag kyang yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis brtags pa'i bdag kyang yod par 'gyur la /
translated: then the self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas would exist.

original: de ni tshig tsam gyis smra ba'o //
analyzed: de ni tshig tsam gyis smra ba'o //
translated: That is mere words.

original: gal te kho bo cag gi bdag med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te kho bo cag gi bdag med par gyur na /
translated: If our self did not exist,

original: bcing ba dang grol ba la sogs pa mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: bcing ba dang grol ba la sogs pa mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: then bondage, freedom, and so on would not be established.

original: 'di ni re zhig bdag yod par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig bdag yod par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But first, it is not tenable that the self exists.

original: 'di gnyis ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these two are contradictory to reason.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dbang dngos por yod na nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu yang yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dbang dngos por yod na nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu yang yod la /
translated: Thus, if the dependent were an existent thing, then an internal agent would also exist.

original: 'di ni ma dpyad pa'i yod pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ma dpyad pa'i yod pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called ‚Äúexistence without analysis.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist for the world.

original: de'i phyir gal te rigs pa de dag la ba gcig po yod cing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur rtog na gnyis pa yang brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rigs pa de dag la ba gcig po yod cing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur rtog na gnyis pa yang brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if you think that the cause of cyclic existence and nirvana is a single entity, you should also consider a second cause.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of cyclic existence and nirvana is the nature of things.

original: de lta na gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: In that case, how could the BhagavƒÅn have said:üîΩ‚ÄúWhatever remains here, that I know to exist just as it is.‚Äù

original: gang yang 'dir lhag ma yod pa de ni yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes thos pa de ji ltar gsungs /
analyzed: gang yang 'dir lhag ma yod pa de ni yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes thos pa de ji ltar gsungs /
translated: How could he have said that?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni dngos por gyur pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni dngos por gyur pa byas pa ste /
translated: Dependent origination is a thing that is produced.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin med la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin med la /
translated: Because it is dependently originated, it does not exist like a reflection.

original: gang zhig byis pa rnams dngos por mngon par zhan pa'i gnas su gyur pa de yang byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul la rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos por gyur pa brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can ni yod la de'i rang bzhin ni med do //
analyzed: gang zhig byis pa rnams dngos por mngon par zhan pa'i gnas su gyur pa de yang byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul la rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos por gyur pa brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can ni yod la de'i rang bzhin ni med do //
translated: That which is the basis for childish beings‚Äô manifest attachment to things is a false, deceptive phenomenon that exists as an object of the childish mind in that way, but it does not exist by way of its intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir gang gang na med pa de ni des stong ngo zhes bya'o //üîΩbrdzun gyis @280a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gang na med pa de ni des stong ngo zhes bya'o // brdzun gyis @280a * //
translated: Therefore, whatever does not exist in something is said to be empty of that.

original: slu ba'i chos can dngos por gyur pa la rang bzhin med pas de'i phyir dngos por gyur pa de de'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: slu ba'i chos can dngos por gyur pa la rang bzhin med pas de'i phyir dngos por gyur pa de de'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: False, deceptive phenomena exist as things, but they do not exist by way of their intrinsic nature. Therefore, those things are empty of their intrinsic nature.

original: gang yang 'dir lhag ma zhes pa ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub pa /
analyzed: gang yang 'dir lhag ma zhes pa ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub pa /
translated: Here, the remainder is the false, deceptive phenomenon that is not established by way of its intrinsic character.

original: byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul phyin ci log las ma grol ba ni yod de /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul phyin ci log las ma grol ba ni yod de /
translated: It exists as the object of the childish mind that is not freed from error.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: sgyu ma'i rnam pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rnam pa de ni yod do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat illusion-like thing exists.‚Äù

original: byis pa rnams kyi brjod pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi brjod pa de ni yod do //
translated: The statement of the childish is: ‚ÄúIt exists.‚Äù

original: rmongs pa chags pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: rmongs pa chags pa de ni yod do //
translated: The attachment of the ignorant is: ‚ÄúIt exists.‚Äù

original: de ltar gang cung zad tsam de ni yod do zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar gang cung zad tsam de ni yod do zhes so //
translated: Thus, whatever is even slightly existent is: ‚ÄúIt exists.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags pas dpyod pa pos brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can dngos por gyur pa mngon du shes pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags pas dpyod pa pos brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can dngos por gyur pa mngon du shes pas /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the analyzer, who has directly understood the false, deceptive phenomena that are things,

original: 'jig rten pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa rnams brdzun pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can la gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa rnams brdzun pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can la gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: does not undermine the world‚Äôs causes that are false things, such as cyclic existence and nirvana and so on.

original: de la mi gnod pas chad par smra ba'am med pa nyid mi ltung la ;
analyzed: de la mi gnod pas chad par smra ba'am med pa nyid mi ltung la ;
translated: Since he does not undermine them, he does not fall into the extreme of nihilism or nonexistence.

original: rang bzhin la sgro ma btags pas phyin ci ma log pa la gnas te phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i 'khor ba nges par spong zhing rtag par smra bar mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sgro ma btags pas phyin ci ma log pa la gnas te phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i 'khor ba nges par spong zhing rtag par smra bar mi ltung ngo //
translated: Since he does not superimpose intrinsic nature, he abides in the absence of error and definitely abandons cyclic existence, which is produced by error, and does not fall into the extreme of eternalism.

original: 'dir yang thog ma nyid du 'thad pa dang bcas pas don chen por yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir yang thog ma nyid du 'thad pa dang bcas pas don chen por yang 'gyur la /
translated: Here, first, since it is tenable, it is also of great purpose.

original: gzhan du rang bzhin yod pa nyid ni 'thad pa dang bram ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rang bzhin yod pa nyid ni 'thad pa dang bram ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, intrinsic reality would be tenable, but it is not.

original: ci slar rang bzhin med pa dngos por gyur pa la brten nas skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci slar rang bzhin med pa dngos por gyur pa la brten nas skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Do you think that things that lack intrinsic reality arise in dependence on things that lack intrinsic reality?üîΩYou are a fool who has entered the stage of playing with the worst kind of error.

original: phyin ci log bdag nyid ngan pa la rnam par rol pa'i go 'phang la zhugs pas dag dod smos pa nyid las rgyas pa gsal bar rten cing 'brel pa rang bzhin med pa sgrub byed kyi ming thos pa lta bur rlom sems nas 'dri ba la 'jug pa
analyzed: phyin ci log bdag nyid ngan pa la rnam par rol pa'i go 'phang la zhugs pas dag dod smos pa nyid las rgyas pa gsal bar rten cing 'brel pa rang bzhin med pa sgrub byed kyi ming thos pa lta bur rlom sems nas 'dri ba la 'jug pa
translated: You are like a person who, having heard the name of a proof of the absence of intrinsic existence, thinks that he has understood the proof and then asks questions about it.

original: kye ma ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: kye ma ngo mtshar to //
translated: Oh my!üîΩYou should think about the analyses that have been presented.üîΩYou should think about this passage, because it also clarifies this point.

original: ji skad du smos pa'i dpyad pa rnams sems la gyis shig / lung 'di las kyang 'di gsal bar byed pas sems la zhog shig / ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i dpyad pa rnams sems la gyis shig / lung 'di las kyang 'di gsal bar byed pas sems la zhog shig / ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: brag phug ri dang rdzong dang chu klung la //
analyzed: brag phug ri dang rdzong dang chu klung la //
translated: In caves, on mountains, in forts, and by rivers,

original: gang zhig brjod pa la brten brag ca bzhin //
analyzed: gang zhig brjod pa la brten brag ca bzhin //
translated: Echoes arise in dependence on what is said.

original: 'dus byas 'di kun sgyu ma lta bu dang // smig rgyu dang mtshungs 'gro kun shes par gyis //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'di kun sgyu ma lta bu dang // smig rgyu dang mtshungs 'gro kun shes par gyis //
translated: and all beings are like mirages.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir gang zhig gang na med pa de ni des stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams kyis de ltar yang don rnam par phye ba'i phyir de @280b rnams stong pa nyid la phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir gang zhig gang na med pa de ni des stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams kyis de ltar yang don rnam par phye ba'i phyir de @280b rnams stong pa nyid la phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who say that something is empty of something else, and who say that the meaning of emptiness is the nonexistence of something, are not correctly understanding emptiness, because the meaning of emptiness is explained in this way.

original: gang yang tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang yang tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad du /
translated: Also, the following verse is well explained by the explanation given above:üîΩThe imagined is not a real entity,

original: kun brtags dngos po yod min zhing //
analyzed: kun brtags dngos po yod min zhing //
translated: but the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptinessüîΩas the extreme of nihilism are lost.üîΩThe imagined is not a real entity,

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa na //
translated: but the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptinessüîΩas the extreme of nihilism are lost.üîΩThe imagined is not a real entity,

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
translated: but the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptinessüîΩas the extreme of nihilism are lost.üîΩThe imagined is not a real entity,üîΩbut the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptinessüîΩas the extreme of nihilism are lost.üîΩThe imagined is not a real entity,üîΩbut the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptiness

original: mthar rtogs pa ni phung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mthar rtogs pa ni phung bar 'gyur //
translated: as the extreme of nihilism are lost.üîΩThe imagined is not a real entity,

original: zhes pa de yang ji skad du smos pa'i bshad pas legs par bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa de yang ji skad du smos pa'i bshad pas legs par bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: but the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptinessüîΩas the extreme of nihilism are lost.

original: rang bzhin du brtags pa med la /
analyzed: rang bzhin du brtags pa med la /
translated: The imagined is not a real entity,üîΩbut the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptinessüîΩas the extreme of nihilism are lost.üîΩThe imagined is not a real entity,üîΩbut the dependent is.üîΩThose who understand emptiness

original: gzhan dbang yang brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can byas pa rang bzhin med pa yod pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dbang yang brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can byas pa rang bzhin med pa yod pa la /
translated: as the extreme of nihilism are lost.

original: gang zhig de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa la sgro 'dogs par byed pa dang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa byas pa ni med do zhes smra ba de ni nges par phung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa la sgro 'dogs par byed pa dang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa byas pa ni med do zhes smra ba de ni nges par phung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever at that time imputes intrinsic reality and says, ‚ÄúThe illusion-like is not produced,‚Äù will certainly be ruined.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha'i phyogs nas gnas pas nges par ngan 'gror ltung bas /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha'i phyogs nas gnas pas nges par ngan 'gror ltung bas /
translated: Because they abide in the extreme of eternalism and nihilism, they will certainly fall into miserable realms.

original: 'di ltar rnam rig tu smra ba de rnams la stong pa nyid phyin ci log par rtogs pa med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam rig tu smra ba de rnams la stong pa nyid phyin ci log par rtogs pa med do zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that those who propound consciousness do not understand emptiness in a distorted way.

original: de rnams ni mkhas pa rnams kyi tshad mar brjod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de rnams ni mkhas pa rnams kyi tshad mar brjod par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to call them authorities for the wise.

original: de ltar yang bdag dang bdag gi bas stong par bsgrubs pas mig rang bzhin med par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar yang bdag dang bdag gi bas stong par bsgrubs pas mig rang bzhin med par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established the eye as lacking intrinsic existence by proving it to be empty of self and being mine,

original: slar yang mig gi rang bzhin stong par bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang mig gi rang bzhin stong par bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: again, in order to establish the eye‚Äôs intrinsic nature as empty, it is said:

original: rtag pa brtan pa ther zug pa yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pas mig stong ngo zhes par 'brel to //
analyzed: rtag pa brtan pa ther zug pa yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pas mig stong ngo zhes par 'brel to //
translated: Since it is not permanent, stable, enduring, and not subject to change, the eye is empty.

original: de bzhin du yang bdag gi sgras ni rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs kyi phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bdag gi sgras ni rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs kyi phyir skyon med do //
translated: Likewise, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is not faulty because it is a synonym for ‚Äúintrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: de la mi rtag pa dang bral bas rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa dang bral bas rtag pa'o //
translated: It is permanent because it is free from impermanence.

original: mi g-yo ba'i phyir brtan pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i phyir brtan pa'o //
translated: It is stable because it does not move.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ther zug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ther zug pa'o //
translated: It is eternal because it endures in all circumstances.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur bas yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur bas yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: It is not subject to change because it does not change into something else.

original: 'di rnams ni rang bzhin gyi ming gi bye brag yin gyi nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rang bzhin gyi ming gi bye brag yin gyi nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu'i ni ma yin te /
translated: These are the different names for intrinsic nature, not for an internal agent.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di pa tsam la rnam par gnas pas na sngar nyid du de dag bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di pa tsam la rnam par gnas pas na sngar nyid du de dag bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is established as mere conditionality, dependent origination, they have already been refuted.
