original: ji skad du stong pa nyid don dam pa'i mdo las /üîΩmig skyes bzhin pa gang du yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du stong pa nyid don dam pa'i mdo las / mig skyes bzhin pa gang du yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As the S≈´tra on the Meaning of Emptiness says,üîΩThe eye does not come from anywhere when it arises.

original: 'gag bzhin pa nam yang dmyal bar 'gro ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa nam yang dmyal bar 'gro ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The eye does not go anywhere when it ceases.

original: las yod cing las kyi rnam par smin pa @281a * //
analyzed: las yod cing las kyi rnam par smin pa @281a * //
translated: Karma exists and the evolution of karma exists,

original: yod la / byed pa po ni ma dmigs so //
analyzed: yod la / byed pa po ni ma dmigs so //
translated: but the agent is not apprehended.

original: gang phung po 'di ni 'jig la phung po gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor te /
analyzed: gang phung po 'di ni 'jig la phung po gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor te /
translated: This is because this very same person who is the agent of actions and experiences their results is not apprehended as permanent or impermanent, and so on.

original: chos kyi brda gzhan las so //
analyzed: chos kyi brda gzhan las so //
translated: The expression of the teaching of the Dharma is different.

original: de la chos kyi brda ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi brda ni 'di'o //
translated: The expression of the teaching of the Dharma is as follows:

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, the karmic predispositions; and so on up to: Conditioned by birth, old age and death.‚Äù

original: mdo 'dir ni thog mar byed pa po bkag la /
analyzed: mdo 'dir ni thog mar byed pa po bkag la /
translated: In this sutra, the Buddha first refutes the agent and then posits dependent origination.

original: phyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: phyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The positing of dependent origination is for the sake of those who desire liberation.

original: gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa las mig yod pa thob pa la /
analyzed: gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa las mig yod pa thob pa la /
translated: For those who have attained the eye of the teaching of dependent origination,

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams mig tu mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen por chos thams cad bdag med par nye bar bsten pas stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams mig tu mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen por chos thams cad bdag med par nye bar bsten pas stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the antidote to the attachment to the eye is the teaching of the selflessness of all things. Thus, they enter the door of liberation that is emptiness.

original: de'i tshe rtag pa'i bdag bkag pas cung zad kyang nye bar mkho bo med cing /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag pa'i bdag bkag pas cung zad kyang nye bar mkho bo med cing /
translated: At that time, there is no need to refute a permanent self in the least.

original: mig ji lta bar gnas pa la mngon par zhen pa ma bkag na rtag pa'i bdag bkag kyang mig la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i ba spu yang 'gul bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig ji lta bar gnas pa la mngon par zhen pa ma bkag na rtag pa'i bdag bkag kyang mig la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i ba spu yang 'gul bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If one does not refute the manifest clinging to the eyes as they are, then even though one refutes a permanent self, one will not be able to move a hair on the head of the manifest clinging to the eyes and so on as a self.

original: ri dags dang bya la sogs pa bdag rtag pa mi dmigs kyang der zhen pas de'i phyir 'dir rtag pa'i bdag bkag pa'i sgo nas mig bdag med par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri dags dang bya la sogs pa bdag rtag pa mi dmigs kyang der zhen pas de'i phyir 'dir rtag pa'i bdag bkag pa'i sgo nas mig bdag med par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Although a permanent self is not observed in deer, birds, and so on, they cling to it as such. Therefore here the eyes are not posited as selfless by way of refuting a permanent self.

original: 'jog na yang nye bar len pa la rtag pa'i bdag bkag pas sam rang bzhin dang bcas pa bkag pas so //üîΩgang yang de ltar ci skad gsungs pa'i rigs pas bdag med pas de'i tshe /üîΩgnyen po med pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'jog na yang nye bar len pa la rtag pa'i bdag bkag pas sam rang bzhin dang bcas pa bkag pas so // gang yang de ltar ci skad gsungs pa'i rigs pas bdag med pas de'i tshe / gnyen po med pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Even if they were posited, it would be by refuting a permanent self in the appropriated aggregates or by refuting that it has an intrinsic nature.üîΩAlso, by the reasoning stated above, if the self does not exist,üîΩthen since there would be no antidote, selflessness would not exist either.

original: bdag med mi na zhes pa la /
analyzed: bdag med mi na zhes pa la /
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf selflessness does not exist . . .‚Äù

original: bdag dang 'gal ba'i chos 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag dang 'gal ba'i chos 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no phenomenon whatsoever that is contradictory to the self.

original: yang na ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa ltar bdag dang bdag med la /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa ltar bdag dang bdag med la /
translated: Or else, just as there is neither existence nor nonexistence, so there is neither self nor selflessness.

original: ji ltar yang dngos po med na dngos po med pa med la /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dngos po med na dngos po med pa med la /
translated: And just as there is no nonexistence when there is no existence,

original: de bzhin du bdag med na bdag med pa yang srid pa med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med na bdag med pa yang srid pa med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: so there is no selflessness when there is no self.

original: yang gang du bdag yod pa yin na de ni bdag med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por yang de med de /
analyzed: yang gang du bdag yod pa yin na de ni bdag med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por yang de med de /
translated: Moreover, when there is a self, there is no nonself, and there is no thing such as form, etc.

original: nye bar len pa po med na nye bar blangs pa med pas gzugs la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po med na nye bar blangs pa med pas gzugs la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa /
translated: When there is no appropriator, there is no appropriated, and form, etc., are not established.

original: bdag med min pa ste bdag med pa yang ma grub @281b pas chos thams cad ming tsam du grub pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med min pa ste bdag med pa yang ma grub @281b pas chos thams cad ming tsam du grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is no nonself, and since there is no self, all things are established as mere names.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te yang bdag 'ba' zhig pa med na bdag med pa 'ba' zhig pa yang med la /
analyzed: gal te yang bdag 'ba' zhig pa med na bdag med pa 'ba' zhig pa yang med la /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no self at all, there is no selflessness at all.

original: de ltar na yang me dang bud shing dag bzhin du bdag dang bdag med dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yod pas des bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis ka yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang me dang bud shing dag bzhin du bdag dang bdag med dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yod pas des bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis ka yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But still, you might say, just as fire and fuel are established in mutual dependence, so too self and selflessness exist, since they are established in mutual dependence.

original: gsungs pa / de ltar yang bdag dang bdag med ces pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / de ltar yang bdag dang bdag med ces pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: In response to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Thus self and selflessness Do not exist.

original: gal te yang dpyad bzhin pas bdag gam bdag med pa 'ga' zhig yod na /
analyzed: gal te yang dpyad bzhin pas bdag gam bdag med pa 'ga' zhig yod na /
translated: If, while being analyzed, either self or selflessness existed,

original: de'i tshe phan tshun ltos pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe phan tshun ltos pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: then at that time mutual dependence would be established.

original: gang du de gnyis med na bdag dang bdag med pa ga la 'byung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang du de gnyis med na bdag dang bdag med pa ga la 'byung zhes bya ste /
translated: But when those two do not exist, how could self and selflessness arise?

original: des na bdag dang bdag med pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag dang bdag med pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore self and selflessness do not exist.

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan te /
translated: Or this is another point:

original: kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some say,

original: gal te yang bdag dang bdag med pa med la de lta na yang bdag dang bdag med pa bkag pa'i bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin pa yod la /
analyzed: gal te yang bdag dang bdag med pa med la de lta na yang bdag dang bdag med pa bkag pa'i bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin pa yod la /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though self and selflessness do not exist, self and selflessness that are the negations of those two exist.

original: de yod pas dgag bya bdag med pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pas dgag bya bdag med pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, the selflessness that is the object of negation also arises.üîΩIf the nature of phenomena is free from the duality of self and selflessness, it would be neither self nor selflessness.

original: gal te yang bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis su brtags pa dang bral ba chos rnams kyi rang bzhin bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di yang mi rigs so zhes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te yang bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis su brtags pa dang bral ba chos rnams kyi rang bzhin bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di yang mi rigs so zhes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: To understand that this is also illogical, the text says:

original: bdag dang bdag med 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med 'ga' yang med //
translated: Neither self nor selflessness.

original: ces bya'o // 'ga' yang med ces pa'i 'gag pa 'di ji ltar phyis de ma thag pa'i brjod pa 'ga' dang mngon par 'brel la /
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'ga' yang med ces pa'i 'gag pa 'di ji ltar phyis de ma thag pa'i brjod pa 'ga' dang mngon par 'brel la /
translated: The negation ‚Äúat all‚Äù is connected to the previous statement, ‚Äúneither self nor selflessness.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du sngar gyi de ma thag pa'i bdag dang bdag med pa dang yang 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar gyi de ma thag pa'i bdag dang bdag med pa dang yang 'brel to //
translated: It is also connected to the previous statement, ‚Äúneither self nor selflessness.‚Äù

original: de la 'dir ri zhig sngar gyi rtog pa brjod de /
analyzed: de la 'dir ri zhig sngar gyi rtog pa brjod de /
translated: Here, the previous thought is stated again.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis ka yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis ka yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because neither self nor selflessness is established by the reasoning explained above,

original: de bkag na bdag dang bdag med pa ga la 'byung zhes sgrub byed gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bkag na bdag dang bdag med pa ga la 'byung zhes sgrub byed gsungs pa /
translated: If that is refuted, how could there be a self or selflessness?

original: bdag min zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag min zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The proof of that is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThere is no self.‚Äù

original: phyi ma'i rtog pa yang bdag dang bdag med pa logs su bzhag pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yang med la /
analyzed: phyi ma'i rtog pa yang bdag dang bdag med pa logs su bzhag pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yang med la /
translated: The latter conception is that the nature of things that are posited as separate from self and selflessness does not exist.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin @282a * //üîΩpa 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin @282a * // pa 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Since a nature that is established as different from self and selflessness does not exist, there is nothing that is not self or selflessness.

original: bdag dang bdag med min 'ga' med //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med min 'ga' med //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúThere is nothing that is not self or selflessness.‚Äù

original: ces so // yang 'di'i don gzhan te /üîΩchos thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes rnam par gzhag pa na mu stegs pas smras pa /
analyzed: ces so // yang 'di'i don gzhan te / chos thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes rnam par gzhag pa na mu stegs pas smras pa /
translated: There is another interpretation of the meaning of this passage.

original: chos thams cad ming tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ming tsam ma yin te /
translated: When it is posited that all phenomena are mere names, the tƒ´rthikas say, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not mere names.

original: kho bo cag gi grub mthas bshad pa brtag pa ma byas pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i bdag gi don yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi grub mthas bshad pa brtag pa ma byas pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i bdag gi don yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the self that is described in our tenets, which is qualified as being unanalyzed and so on, exists.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bdag med de /
analyzed: bdag med de /
translated: There is no self.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol po'i bdag gi sgra la brjod bya'i don bdag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol po'i bdag gi sgra la brjod bya'i don bdag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the referent object of the term ‚Äúself‚Äù does not exist for the opponent.

original: rang nyid las ma skyes pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin la /üîΩbrtag pa ma byas pa kun tu 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid las ma skyes pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin la / brtag pa ma byas pa kun tu 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: It is like the horn of a donkey, because it does not arise from itself.üîΩIt is not a universal, because it does not arise, like a sky flower.

original: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir bdag med do //üîΩ'byung ba'i sems pa can yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir bdag med do // 'byung ba'i sems pa can yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore there is no self.

original: bdag med pa ni bden la /
analyzed: bdag med pa ni bden la /
translated: The mind that arises thinks, ‚ÄúSelflessness is true.

original: 'on kyang bdag med pa 'byung ba tsam yod do zhes so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag med pa 'byung ba tsam yod do zhes so //
translated: However, the mere arising of selflessness exists.‚Äù

original: rang gi sde pa dag kyang smras te /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag kyang smras te /
translated: Our own schools also say,

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba'i bdag med pa phung po tsam yod la /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba'i bdag med pa phung po tsam yod la /
translated: ‚ÄúSelflessness is the mere aggregates that are devoid of an inner creator, a person.

original: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes so //
analyzed: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes so //
translated: The self does not exist in any way.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement that is dependent on them is not about selflessness.

original: de dag la ltos nas gsungs pa bdag med min no / bdag med pa ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag la ltos nas gsungs pa bdag med min no / bdag med pa ni med pa nyid de /
translated: Selflessness is nonexistence.

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar yang sngar nyid du rgyas par bsgrubs so //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar yang sngar nyid du rgyas par bsgrubs so //
translated: As it does not exist, it was extensively established earlier.

original: yang rang gi sde pa kha cig ni 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: yang rang gi sde pa kha cig ni 'di skad smra ste /
translated: Another Buddhist school makes the following assertion:

original: nye bar len pa la btags pa'i rdzas su yod cing gang zag tu yod pa'i dngos po ni yod la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa la btags pa'i rdzas su yod cing gang zag tu yod pa'i dngos po ni yod la /
translated: The substantial reality that is imputed to the appropriated aggregates and the reality of the person exist.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa 'di la 'ga' zhig gis dbang du byas pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa 'di la 'ga' zhig gis dbang du byas pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since this selflessness of all phenomena is not controlled by anyone,

original: de yang yod pas de'i phyir bdag med pa yang yod do zhes so //
analyzed: de yang yod pas de'i phyir bdag med pa yang yod do zhes so //
translated: it also exists. Therefore selflessness exists.

original: smras pa / bdag dang bdag med 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag dang bdag med 'ga' yang med //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Neither self nor selflessness exists.

original: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas chos dang gang zag dag bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas chos dang gang zag dag bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the reason stated refutes both phenomena and persons,

original: gang gi tshe yang 'di ltar bdag dang bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'di ltar bdag dang bdag med pa ste /
translated: at that time neither self nor selflessnessüîΩexists.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa yang mi 'thad la /
translated: Since neither self nor selflessness is tenable,

original: de'i tshe thams cad tshig tsam ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad tshig tsam ste /
translated: at that time everything is mere words.

original: don gyis stong par grub bo //
analyzed: don gyis stong par grub bo //
translated: It is established that they are empty of meaning.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gal te yang khyod kyis brjod bya'i don bkag la /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis brjod bya'i don bkag la /
translated: Even though you have refuted the meaning of the statement,

original: de lta na yang gang zhig don gyis stong pa'i tshig de de bzhin du yod la /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang zhig don gyis stong pa'i tshig de de bzhin du yod la /
translated: the words that are empty of meaning still exist.

original: de @282b las tshig dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de @282b las tshig dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Since the words are the referent, the referent also arises.

original: yang na brjod bya las gzhan du rjod byed mi 'thad la /
analyzed: yang na brjod bya las gzhan du rjod byed mi 'thad la /
translated: Moreover, it is untenable that the expression is different from the referent.

original: tshig 'di dag ma bkag par yod pas de'i phyir brjod bya yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshig 'di dag ma bkag par yod pas de'i phyir brjod bya yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since these words exist without being refuted, therefore the referent also arises.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:

original: smras pa / gal te rjod byed yod pa nyid na brjod bya 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te rjod byed yod pa nyid na brjod bya 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the expression existed, the referent would arise.üîΩBut it does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: He states the proof:

original: brjod 'ga' med ces so //
analyzed: brjod 'ga' med ces so //
translated: There is no expression whatsoever.

original: brjod bya las gzhan du rjod byed kyang mi 'jug pas brjod pa yang med do //
analyzed: brjod bya las gzhan du rjod byed kyang mi 'jug pas brjod pa yang med do //
translated: Since the expression is not engaged apart from the referent, there is also no expression.

original: 'o na mo gsham gyi bu'i brjod pa brjod pa brjod bya'i don gyis stong yang brjod bya las gzhan pa yod pas rjod pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mo gsham gyi bu'i brjod pa brjod pa brjod bya'i don gyis stong yang brjod bya las gzhan pa yod pas rjod pa yod do zhe na /
translated: Well, although the expression of the son of a barren woman is empty of the referent‚Äôs meaning, since it exists apart from the referent, the expression exists.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:

original: smras pa / brjod pas ni ji lta bar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i brjod bya la brdar byed la /
analyzed: smras pa / brjod pas ni ji lta bar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i brjod bya la brdar byed la /
translated: The expression is applied to the referent of an entity and nonentity as it is.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag kyang med do zhes bsgrubs la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag kyang med do zhes bsgrubs la /
translated: And since things and nonthings do not exist,

original: de dag med na gzhan brjod bya ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de dag med na gzhan brjod bya ci zhig yod /
translated: what other object of expression exists?

original: brjod bya med na rjod byed med pas brjod pa yang med do //
analyzed: brjod bya med na rjod byed med pas brjod pa yang med do //
translated: Since there is no object of expression, there is no expression.

original: yang na gnas pa la sogs pa med par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: yang na gnas pa la sogs pa med par bsgrubs pas /
translated: Or else, since it is established that endurance and so on do not exist,

original: gnas pa la sogs pa med na sgra mi 'grub pa thugs la bzhag nas brjod 'ga' med ces so //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa med na sgra mi 'grub pa thugs la bzhag nas brjod 'ga' med ces so //
translated: think about how sound is not established if endurance and so on do not exist, and then say, ‚ÄúThere is no expression.‚Äù

original: yang na tshig ni don gyis stong par bsgrubs la /
analyzed: yang na tshig ni don gyis stong par bsgrubs la /
translated: Or else, since it is established that words are empty of meaning,

original: sgra yang sgra gzhan gyi brjod bya yin pas don nyid la don de yang med pa nyid do zhes bya la /
analyzed: sgra yang sgra gzhan gyi brjod bya yin pas don nyid la don de yang med pa nyid do zhes bya la /
translated: and since sound is the object of expression of another sound, then that meaning itself does not exist.

original: don med pa'i phyir sgra yang med par gzigs nas gsungs pa brjod 'ga' med ces so //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir sgra yang med par gzigs nas gsungs pa brjod 'ga' med ces so //
translated: And since the meaning does not exist, sound also does not exist. Seeing this, he said, ‚ÄúThere is no expression.‚Äù

original: brjod pa med par gyur na yang brjod bya'i don grub pa med do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: brjod pa med par gyur na yang brjod bya'i don grub pa med do zhes gnas so //
translated: And when there is no expression, the object of expression is not established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te rjod byed kyis brjod pa'i don kyang med na /
analyzed: gal te rjod byed kyis brjod pa'i don kyang med na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the object of expression of the expression does not exist,

original: de'i tshe ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci zhig yod /
translated: then what exists?‚Äù

original: smras pa / kho bos sgyur ma'i nor gyis phyug por byed pa'am smig rgyu'i chus khyod kyi chu'i gdung ba sel bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / kho bos sgyur ma'i nor gyis phyug por byed pa'am smig rgyu'i chus khyod kyi chu'i gdung ba sel bar byed pa'am /
translated: Objection: I cannot make you rich with the wealth of a mirage, nor can I relieve your thirst with the water of a mirage,

original: sgyu ma'i ri dags kyi shas bkres pa nye bar zhi bar byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i ri dags kyi shas bkres pa nye bar zhi bar byed par mi nus so //
translated: nor can I satisfy your hunger with the flesh of a mirage.

original: 'o na 'dir kho na nyid gang yin pa de nyid gzung bar bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir kho na nyid gang yin pa de nyid gzung bar bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: Well then, what is reality here that you should apprehend it?

original: slar yang 'dir  de kho na nyid de ci zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang 'dir  de kho na nyid de ci zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is that reality here?

original: smras pa / gal te khyod de kho na nyid la phyin ci log tu go ba dang spong ba dag gis log par sgrub par mi byed cing chos nyid zab mo la gus pa yang skyed na de'i tshe khyod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te khyod de kho na nyid la phyin ci log tu go ba dang spong ba dag gis log par sgrub par mi byed cing chos nyid zab mo la gus pa yang skyed na de'i tshe khyod kyi /
translated: Response: If you do not practice incorrectly through misunderstanding and abandoning reality, and if you also generate respect for profound reality, then at that time your reality

original: brjod bya mya ngan 'das @283a * //
analyzed: brjod bya mya ngan 'das @283a * //
translated: is similar to nirvana,

original: dang mtshungs // dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin stong //
analyzed: dang mtshungs // dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin stong //
translated: the emptiness of the nature of all things.

original: rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid dang de kho na nyid ces pa rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid dang de kho na nyid ces pa rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúNature,‚Äù ‚Äúessence,‚Äù and ‚Äúreality‚Äù are synonyms.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Emptiness of intrinsic nature means being devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag pa ma lus pa skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid cung zad kyang med pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag pa ma lus pa skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid cung zad kyang med pa ste /
translated: Nirvana is the non-arising of all that is permanent. It has no intrinsic identity whatsoever.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nges par 'di ni sdug bsngal ma lus pa spongs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nges par 'di ni sdug bsngal ma lus pa spongs pa /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThat which is the complete abandonment of suffering,

original: bor ba byang bar gyur pa zad pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa nye bar zhib nub par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal gzhan du nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba /
analyzed: bor ba byang bar gyur pa zad pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa nye bar zhib nub par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal gzhan du nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba /
translated: the casting off of burdens, the dissolution of the constituents, the exhaustion of craving, the absence of attachment, cessation, tranquility,üîΩthe excellent,

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa med pa'o //
translated: the absence of appropriation,

original: 'di ni zhi ba gya nom pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba gya nom pa'o /
translated: the peaceful, the sublime,

original: 'di ltar phung po thams cad spangs pa sred pa zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po thams cad spangs pa sred pa zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes so //
translated: the abandonment of all the aggregates, the exhaustion of craving, the absence of attachment, cessation, is nirvana.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ci yang med pa de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ci yang med pas de'i phyir chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par bsten pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ci yang med pa de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ci yang med pas de'i phyir chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par bsten pa /
translated: Thus, just as the nature of nirvana is nothing whatsoever, so the nature of all phenomena is nothing whatsoever. Therefore, the reality of phenomena should be relied upon without error.

original: gang zhig chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that the nature of all phenomena is the same as nirvana.

original: de ltar na chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par brten par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par brten par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the reality of phenomena will be relied upon without error, but not otherwise.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal dang bral ba tsam la rang bzhin med pa ni rung gi / phyi dang nang gi chos 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa dang / ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyis nye bar bskyed pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa rnams ji lta bar rang dang spyi dang thun mong du nyams su myong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa las shin tu bskal pa'i
analyzed: re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal dang bral ba tsam la rang bzhin med pa ni rung gi / phyi dang nang gi chos 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa dang / ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyis nye bar bskyed pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa rnams ji lta bar rang dang spyi dang thun mong du nyams su myong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa las shin tu bskal pa'i
translated: It is reasonable that nirvana, which is the mere absence of suffering, is essenceless, but how could the internal and external phenomena, such as compounded phenomena and sprouts, and such things as ignorance and seeds, which exist by being produced through causes and conditions, be like nirvana, which is utterly separate from them, in being essenceless?üîΩ

original: mtshan nyid rnams ji ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du bsgrub par nus /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ji ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du bsgrub par nus /
translated: For now, it is reasonable that nirvana, which is the mere freedom from suffering, is essenceless, but how could the characteristics of all internal and external phenomena, such as compounded phenomena and sprouts, and of all external and internal causes and conditions, such as ignorance and seeds, which exist as the nature that is produced by causes and conditions, and which are experienced as their own characteristics, whether individually, in general, or in common, be established as essentially empty, since they are very distant from nirvana?

original: de'i phyir gang chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you may say, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not the nature of nirvana.‚Äù

original: smras pa / gal te ma rig pas phyin ci log pa'i rnam par shes pa la nyams su myong ba rnams tshad mar 'gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te ma rig pas phyin ci log pa'i rnam par shes pa la nyams su myong ba rnams tshad mar 'gyur na /
translated: We say: If what is experienced by consciousness that is distorted by ignorance were valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe 'phags pa dang 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci dgos par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'phags pa dang 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci dgos par 'gyur /
translated: In that case, what need would there be for the ƒÅryas and the ƒÅryan path?

original: byis pa'i skye bos nyams su myong ba nyid tshad ma la /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bos nyams su myong ba nyid tshad ma la /
translated: The experience of ordinary beings is itself valid cognition.

original: tshad mas @283b yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ma btsal bar de rnams grol bar gyur te /
analyzed: tshad mas @283b yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ma btsal bar de rnams grol bar gyur te /
translated: Because they see reality with valid cognition, they would be liberated without effort.

original: de lta bu yang med pas de rnams kyis nyams su myong ba ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu yang med pas de rnams kyis nyams su myong ba ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But since that is not the case, their experience is not valid cognition.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam gyis mngon du byas pa'i 'phags pas chos rnams kyi chos nyid gzigs par gyur pa de la rang bzhin no zhes rigs te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam gyis mngon du byas pa'i 'phags pas chos rnams kyi chos nyid gzigs par gyur pa de la rang bzhin no zhes rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to call the reality of phenomena that is perceived by the ƒÅryas through the ƒÅryan path ‚Äúintrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: gang zhig ma mthong ba las byis pa rnams nyon mongs la /
analyzed: gang zhig ma mthong ba las byis pa rnams nyon mongs la /
translated: Because ordinary beings are afflicted by not seeing it,

original: gang zhig mthong ba las 'phags pa rnams pa rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: gang zhig mthong ba las 'phags pa rnams pa rnam par grol lo //
translated: and ƒÅryas are liberated by seeing it.

original: ji ltar na 'di rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs na rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs na rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: How are they similar to nirvƒÅ·πáa? They are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: 'o na de kho bo la mngon sum ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na de kho bo la mngon sum ma yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúWell, if that is not directly perceptible to me,

original: de ji ltar kho bo cag gis 'di rtogs par nus she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar kho bo cag gis 'di rtogs par nus she na /
translated: How can we understand that?

original: smras pa / mos pa med pa dang dad pa med pa sdig pa'i grogs po dang 'brel pa thos pa chung ba le lo can rmongs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas de rtogs par 'gal bas des la 'di mi mthong ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mos pa med pa dang dad pa med pa sdig pa'i grogs po dang 'brel pa thos pa chung ba le lo can rmongs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas de rtogs par 'gal bas des la 'di mi mthong ste /
translated: It is said: Since it is contradictory for those who lack interest, faith, and the company of virtuous friends, who have little learning, are lazy, and are confused, to understand that, they do not see this.

original: nyon mongs pa'i go skabs su 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i go skabs su 'gyur bas /
translated: Since it is an opportunity for afflictions to arise,

original: sbyin pa dang spro ba dang thos pa mang ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten pa dad pa dang mos pa la sogs pa so sor brten par bya'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang spro ba dang thos pa mang ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten pa dad pa dang mos pa la sogs pa so sor brten par bya'o zhes bya ste /
translated: one should rely on generosity, enthusiasm, much learning, reliance on spiritual friends, faith, interest, and so on.

original: 'di dag dang ldan pas 'phags pas bstan pa'i rigs pa dang dpe yang 'dir khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag dang ldan pas 'phags pas bstan pa'i rigs pa dang dpe yang 'dir khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Those who possess these should accept the reasonings and examples taught by the ƒÅryas.

original: de ltar thabs dang bcas gang rigs pas nges par yod na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang bcas gang rigs pas nges par yod na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one ascertains that things exist through reasoning together with the method, the nature of phenomena will be directly perceived.

original: slar yang ci zhig 'dir 'phags pas bstan pa'i rigs pa gang gis chos rnams kyi chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rigs pas mngon sum du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang ci zhig 'dir 'phags pas bstan pa'i rigs pa gang gis chos rnams kyi chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rigs pas mngon sum du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, by what reasoning taught by the noble ones does the reality of phenomena become directly perceived, in accordance with nirvana?

original: 'phags pas nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pas nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that it is taught by the noble ones.

original: gang zhig dngos kun rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos kun rang bzhin ni //
translated: The reality of all things

original: rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'am so so'i dngos //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'am so so'i dngos //
translated: is not in the collection of causes and conditions, nor in each one individually.

original: kun la yod min de phyir stong //
analyzed: kun la yod min de phyir stong //
translated: Therefore, it is empty.

original: zhes pa la de la rgyu ni 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa la 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la de la rgyu ni 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa la 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, a cause is that which brings about the completion of an effect, and is not shared with other effects.

original: 'di lta ste s'a lu'i myu gus s'a lu'i sa bon no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste s'a lu'i myu gus s'a lu'i sa bon no //
translated: For example, a rice seed is the cause of a rice sprout.

original: rkyen ni thun mong ba ste /üîΩ'di lta ste s'a lu'i myu gu de nyid kyi sa la sogs pa'o //üîΩde yang ji ltar s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa'i yan lag gi dngos por gyur pa de bzhin nas kyi myu gu la sogs @284a * //
analyzed: rkyen ni thun mong ba ste / 'di lta ste s'a lu'i myu gu de nyid kyi sa la sogs pa'o // de yang ji ltar s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa'i yan lag gi dngos por gyur pa de bzhin nas kyi myu gu la sogs @284a * //
translated: A condition is shared.üîΩFor example, earth, etc. are conditions for a rice sprout.

original: pa yang ngo //
analyzed: pa yang ngo //
translated: Moreover, just as they become entities that are components of the production of a rice sprout, so too they are for a barley sprout, etc.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu sa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin la s'a lu'i sa bon gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu sa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin la s'a lu'i sa bon gyi rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel to zhes bya'o //
translated: The effect produced from the cause of the sprout is not related to the form of the earth, etc. , but is related to the form of the rice seed.

original: rgyu'i dngos po 'ba' zhig tsam du nye bar 'gro bas 'di la rkyen nyid du rnam par 'jog go //üîΩre zhig gang 'di'i rgyu dang rkyen du 'gyur na rdzogs par byed pa ni rgyu'i dngos por gnas la /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po 'ba' zhig tsam du nye bar 'gro bas 'di la rkyen nyid du rnam par 'jog go // re zhig gang 'di'i rgyu dang rkyen du 'gyur na rdzogs par byed pa ni rgyu'i dngos por gnas la /
translated: It is established as a condition because it merely approaches the state of a cause.üîΩThat which is a cause and a condition for this is established as a cause.

original: gang du rkyen ni 'di'i nges pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du rkyen ni 'di'i nges pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which is a condition for this is not a definite cause.

original: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
translated: For example, the object condition of consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi sa na rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis so zhes /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sa na rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis so zhes /
translated: In that very case, there are two causes and two conditions.

original: so ; / yul gcig la rgyu rkyen gyi sgra'i sbyor ba bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do //
analyzed: so ; / yul gcig la rgyu rkyen gyi sgra'i sbyor ba bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One used the terms cause and condition for the same object.

original: tshogs pa ni dngos po de dag ma tshang ba med par nye bar gnas pa las skye'i gzhan de ma thag pa nye bar gnas pa las ma yin pas rgyu rkyen tshogs par 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni dngos po de dag ma tshang ba med par nye bar gnas pa las skye'i gzhan de ma thag pa nye bar gnas pa las ma yin pas rgyu rkyen tshogs par 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The collection arises from the mere presence of those things without incompleteness; it does not arise from the mere presence of the antecedent conditions. Therefore, one should understand that the collection of causes and conditions is here.

original: so so'i dngos po ni de rnams tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: so so'i dngos po ni de rnams tha dad pa ste /
translated: The individual things are their differences.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ma yin pa'i so so'i dngos po'i rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ma yin pas so so'i dngos po de thams cad la 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ma yin pa'i so so'i dngos po'i rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ma yin pas so so'i dngos po de thams cad la 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin med do //
translated: The individual things that are not the collection of causes and conditions do not have the nature of the collection of causes and conditions. Therefore, all individual things do not have the nature of all effects.

original: de'i phyir des stong pas rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir des stong pas rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, because they are empty of that, they are said to be ‚Äúdevoid of intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yod na de nges par 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas su yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'dir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yod na de nges par 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas su yod par 'gyur /
translated: If any intrinsic reality of things existed here, it would definitely exist as either conditioned or unconditioned.

original: de la re zhig 'dus ma byas ni rgyu med pa bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma skyes pa la rang bzhin gyis brjod pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dus ma byas ni rgyu med pa bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma skyes pa la rang bzhin gyis brjod pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa mi rigs so //
translated: First, it is illogical for an unconditioned thing, which is not arisen by itself due to having no cause, to have a nature that is inherently suitable to be described.

original: 'dus byas la yang rang bzhin mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'dus byas la yang rang bzhin mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, a nature is untenable for conditioned things.

original: ci'i phyir na gal te 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin du gyur la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na gal te 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin du gyur la /
translated: Why? If it were the nature of conditioned things,

original: 'dus byas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba'i phyir na skye ba rgyu dang rkyen la rag las par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba'i phyir na skye ba rgyu dang rkyen la rag las par 'gyur la /
translated: then since conditioned things arise from causes and conditions, arising would depend on causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las nas skye ba ni byas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las nas skye ba ni byas pa ste /
translated: If arising depends on causes and conditions, it is a product.

original: rang bzhin du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin du mi 'thad do //
translated: It is untenable that it is a nature.

original: yang 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩrgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i dngos po rnams kho na rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du sems te / rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i dngos po rnams kho na rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you think,üîΩ‚ÄúThings that are generated from causes and conditions are natures,‚Äù

original: nges par 'di skad brjod par bya ste rgyu dang rkyen gang las rang bzhin gang zhig skye na de ci de rnams la yod pa las de skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nges par 'di skad brjod par bya ste rgyu dang rkyen gang las rang bzhin gang zhig skye na de ci de rnams la yod pa las de skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: then this must be stated: If a nature arises from causes and conditions, is it generated from those that exist in those causes and conditions or from those that do not exist in those causes and conditions?

original: gang zhig gang @284b la med par de de las mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang @284b la med par de de las mi skye ste /
translated: Whatever does not exist in something does not arise from that.

original: 'di lta ste 'jim pa las snam bu'am skud pa las bum pa zhes so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'jim pa las snam bu'am skud pa las bum pa zhes so //
translated: For example, a cloth does not arise from clay, and a pot does not arise from thread.

original: 'di ni rgyu la sogs pas la skye bar 'dod na nges par rgyu la sogs pa la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya na /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu la sogs pas la skye bar 'dod na nges par rgyu la sogs pa la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya na /
translated: If you assert that effects arise from causes and so on, you must definitely accept that causes and so on have intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ni khas blang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ni khas blang bar mi nus te /
translated: But you cannot accept that,

original: yod bzhin pa na dmigs par thal ba dang / skye ba don med pa dang / thug pa med pa'i skyon dang / rgyu med pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa na dmigs par thal ba dang / skye ba don med pa dang / thug pa med pa'i skyon dang / rgyu med pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that they would be perceived if they existed, their arising would be pointless, there would be the error of infinite regress, and it would follow that they would exist without a cause.

original: gal te yang rgyu la sogs pa la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yod na /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu la sogs pa la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yod na /
translated: Moreover, if the intrinsic reality of effects existed in causes and so on,

original: de dag la thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis yod dam cha shas kyis so //
analyzed: de dag la thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis yod dam cha shas kyis so //
translated: would they exist in them in their entirety or in part?

original: de la re zhig gal te thams cad kyis bdag tu rtog na rgyu dang rkyen rnams mang po'i phyir 'bras bu du mas 'jug la /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te thams cad kyis bdag tu rtog na rgyu dang rkyen rnams mang po'i phyir 'bras bu du mas 'jug la /
translated: First, if you imagine that they exist in them in their entirety, then because causes and conditions are many, effects would engage in many ways.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa so so la 'bras bu med la rgyu du mas 'bras bu gcig sgrub pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa so so la 'bras bu med la rgyu du mas 'bras bu gcig sgrub pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the effect does not exist in each of the causes, and many causes do not produce one effect.

original: rgyu gcig gis bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gcig gis bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And one cause would produce all effects.

original: de'i phyir gang la gnas pa de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir de ltar re zhig thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyu la sogs pa la 'bras bu mi gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la gnas pa de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir de ltar re zhig thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyu la sogs pa la 'bras bu mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, since that which endures would engage in itself, in that case the effect does not endure in the cause, etc., in any way.

original: da ni cha shas kyis kyang mi gnas te /üîΩ'bras bu gcig dum bur skye bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: da ni cha shas kyis kyang mi gnas te / 'bras bu gcig dum bur skye bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Now, it also does not endure in part.üîΩIt follows that the effect would arise in parts.

original: rgyu tha dad pa na yang rgyu du mas 'bras bu skyed par thal lo //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa na yang rgyu du mas 'bras bu skyed par thal lo //
translated: And if the causes are different, it follows that many causes would produce one effect.

original: gang yang rgyu la sogs pa la mi gnas na /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu la sogs pa la mi gnas na /
translated: If the effect does not endure in the causes, etc.,üîΩit would not arise from the causes, etc., and also it would arise from noncauses, as was explained in the first chapter.

original: de rgyu la sogs pa las mi skye la rtsa ba'i rab byed dang por yang na de rkyen la sogs pa la med kyang de rnams las 'byung na /üîΩrkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: de rgyu la sogs pa las mi skye la rtsa ba'i rab byed dang por yang na de rkyen la sogs pa la med kyang de rnams las 'byung na / rkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
translated: If it arises from causes, etc.,üîΩeven though it does not endure in them,üîΩwhy would an effect not arise

original: ci phyir mngon par 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ci phyir mngon par 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: from nonconditions as well?

original: zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu rgyu la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir de de rnams las mi skye la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu rgyu la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir de de rnams las mi skye la /
translated: Since the effect does not exist in the conditions and so on, it does not arise from them.

original: de'i tshe ma skyes pa la yod pa nyid mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma skyes pa la yod pa nyid mi rung ngo //
translated: And if it does not arise, it cannot exist.

original: gang yang de ni da ltar na des na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pas dngos po thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa rang bzhin gyis stong par grub bo //
analyzed: gang yang de ni da ltar na des na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pas dngos po thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa rang bzhin gyis stong par grub bo //
translated: Since things do not exist, all things are the same as nirvana, and it is established that they are empty of essence.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say the following:

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi grangs bzhin du 'bras bu rnams yod par kho bo cag khas mi len la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi grangs bzhin du 'bras bu rnams yod par kho bo cag khas mi len la /
translated: We do not accept that effects exist in accordance with the number of causes and conditions.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa nyid kyi skyon kho bo la med cing med pa nyid kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa nyid kyi skyon kho bo la med cing med pa nyid kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, we do not have the fault of saying that effects exist, nor can we be said to advocate that they do not exist.

original: shin tu mi 'dra ba med pa'i phyir /üîΩbum pa dang thags @285a * //
analyzed: shin tu mi 'dra ba med pa'i phyir / bum pa dang thags @285a * //
translated: Because they are not completely dissimilar.üîΩFor example, a pot and a cloth

original: mkhan lta bu s'a lu'i sa bon dang s'a lu'i myu gu la med la /
analyzed: mkhan lta bu s'a lu'i sa bon dang s'a lu'i myu gu la med la /
translated: do not exist in a rice seed and a rice sprout.

original: de skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir de ltar de ni rgyu la sogs pa la 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi bsam pa spangs te rgyu las 'bras bu skye'o zhes pa 'dis re zhig skye ba grub par rnam par 'jog go skye ba grub
analyzed: de skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir de ltar de ni rgyu la sogs pa la 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi bsam pa spangs te rgyu las 'bras bu skye'o zhes pa 'dis re zhig skye ba grub par rnam par 'jog go skye ba grub
translated: This establishes arising.

original: par gnas pas 'gag pa grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par gnas pas 'gag pa grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Since abiding is established, cessation is established.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa ni ming tsam ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa ni ming tsam ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Abiding and so on are not mere names.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang ldan pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang ldan pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa ma yin te /
translated: Things that possess arising, abiding, and destruction are not essenceless.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because they exist by way of their own characteristics.

original: smras pa / de ltar smras pa de ni gang cung zad tsam ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar smras pa de ni gang cung zad tsam ste /
translated: We reply: This is just a lot of talk.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why?

original: gang zhig dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid grub par 'dod na /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid grub par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the intrinsic character of things is established,

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: then the intrinsic character of those things

original: rgyu la sogs pa la yod pa'am med pa zhig / brtags pa gsum pa ni med la /
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa la yod pa'am med pa zhig / brtags pa gsum pa ni med la /
translated: cannot be investigated as either existent or nonexistent in the causes and so on.

original: gal te yang rgyu ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa can du yod na ;
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa can du yod na ;
translated: But if the cause exists with the potency to generate the effect,

original: de lta na yang rgyu la 'bras bu'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu la 'bras bu'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then the effect does not exist in the cause by way of its own intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po rnams ma byung ba 'byung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ma byung ba 'byung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that things arise from what has not yet arisen.

original: de lta na yang skyon de nyid las log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skyon de nyid las log pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, you have not refuted the error.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / yod pa yod phyir skye ba min //üîΩmed pa med phyir mi skye la //üîΩchos mi mthun phyir yod med min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yod pa yod phyir skye ba min // med pa med phyir mi skye la // chos mi mthun phyir yod med min //
translated: It does not arise because it exists.üîΩIt does not arise because it does not exist.üîΩIt does not arise because it is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: skye ba med pas gnas 'gag med //
analyzed: skye ba med pas gnas 'gag med //
translated: Because it does not arise, it does not endure or cease.

original: gang zhig 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: Someone might say this:

original: yod pa dang med pa'i bsam pa spangs nas rgyu las 'bras bu skye'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i bsam pa spangs nas rgyu las 'bras bu skye'o zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned the conceptions of existence and nonexistence, the effect arises from the cause.

original: 'dir skye ba grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba grub bo zhe na /
translated: In this way, arising is established.‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir na dngos por smra ba'i dngos po rgyu mtshan ni yod pa dang med pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na dngos por smra ba'i dngos po rgyu mtshan ni yod pa dang med pa'o //
translated: Why? Because for the proponents of entities, the reason is existence and nonexistence.

original: ci'i phyir de gnyis su smra ba spangs nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong par smra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gnyis su smra ba spangs nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong par smra ba bzhin no //
translated: Why? Because it is like the one who speaks of emptiness, dependent origination, and who abandons the two extremes.

original: des na gang zhig rgyu las skye'o zhes brjod na /üîΩci de yod pa skye'am /
analyzed: des na gang zhig rgyu las skye'o zhes brjod na / ci de yod pa skye'am /
translated: Therefore, if one says that something arises from a cause,üîΩis it an existent that arises?

original: 'on te med pa skye /
analyzed: 'on te med pa skye /
translated: Or is it a nonexistent that arises?

original: gal te re zhig yod na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig yod na /
translated: First, if it is existent,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu de yod pa'i dngos po'i phyir rtag tu yod bzhin pa la ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu de yod pa'i dngos po'i phyir rtag tu yod bzhin pa la ste /
translated: then at that time, because the effect is an existent thing, it is always already existent,

original: yod bzhin pa'i phyir da lta ba'i rnam par shes pa bzhin skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa'i phyir da lta ba'i rnam par shes pa bzhin skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: and like the present consciousness, it does not arise because it already exists.

original: de ltar re zhig yod pa skye bar mi 'gyur te yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig yod pa skye bar mi 'gyur te yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, first, an existent does not arise because it already exists.

original: yang na med na med bzhin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu ni de lta na yang med pa'i phyir 'bras bu rtag tu yod bzhin pa min la /
analyzed: yang na med na med bzhin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu ni de lta na yang med pa'i phyir 'bras bu rtag tu yod bzhin pa min la /
translated: Again, if it is nonexistent, then the nature of a nonexistent effect does not exist, and therefore the effect is not always already existent.

original: @285b yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin skye ba med do //
analyzed: @285b yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin skye ba med do //
translated: And because it is not already existent, like the horn of a rabbit, it does not arise.

original: de lta na yang gnyis kyi tshul gyis skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gnyis kyi tshul gyis skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you think that arising occurs in the manner of two things,

original: smras pa / chos ni mi mthun phyir yod min //
analyzed: smras pa / chos ni mi mthun phyir yod min //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Because things are incompatible, they do not exist.

original: gang zhig 'gal ba'i chos de ni mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'gal ba'i chos de ni mi mthun pa ste /
translated: Whatever is incompatible is incompatible with itself.

original: 'gal ba'i chos kyi dngos po ni chos mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos kyi dngos po ni chos mi mthun pa'o //
translated: A thing that is incompatible with itself is incompatible with itself.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba gang la de yod pa de phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dngos po la gang zhig skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba gang la de yod pa de phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dngos po la gang zhig skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Whatever is incompatible with itself does not exist.

original: skye ba yod na yod par 'gyur gyi skye ba med pa la gnas pa dang 'gag pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba yod na yod par 'gyur gyi skye ba med pa la gnas pa dang 'gag pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ste /
translated: If arising existed, existence would exist. But it is untenable that what lacks arising endures and ceases.

original: gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa med cing /
analyzed: gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa med cing /
translated: Enduring, arising, and ceasing do not exist.

original: de las gnas pa la sogs pa'i tshig don gyis stong par grub la /
analyzed: de las gnas pa la sogs pa'i tshig don gyis stong par grub la /
translated: And by implication, endurance and so on are established as being devoid of meaning.

original: gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i dngos po rnams rang gi mtshan nyid yod par gal 'gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i dngos po rnams rang gi mtshan nyid yod par gal 'gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: How could things that are devoid of endurance, arising, and ceasing exist by their own intrinsic characteristics?

original: dngos po rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rang bzhin med par grub bo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rang bzhin med par grub bo //
translated: Thus things are established as lacking intrinsic existence, just like nirvana.

original: 'dir smras pa ;
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ;
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te yang de ltar yod pa las skye ba'am med pa las skye zhes smra bar mi nus kyang de lta na yang skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig skye bo ba lang rdzi mo'i bar la grags par yod la /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar yod pa las skye ba'am med pa las skye zhes smra bar mi nus kyang de lta na yang skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig skye bo ba lang rdzi mo'i bar la grags par yod la /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is not possible to say that things arise from that which exists or from that which does not exist, still, it is well known among even cowherds that things arise.

original: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa yod pa'o zhes bya la de yod pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod do zhe na ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa yod pa'o zhes bya la de yod pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod do zhe na ;
translated: Therefore arising and so on exist, and because they exist, the intrinsic reality of things exists.‚Äù

original: smras pa / gal te bskyed pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod na de ltar 'gyur la 'on kyang med de ci'i phyir na 'dir bskyed bya cung zad yod na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te bskyed pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod na de ltar 'gyur la 'on kyang med de ci'i phyir na 'dir bskyed bya cung zad yod na /
translated: We reply: If the intrinsic reality of things such as form that are called produced existed, then that would be so. But it does not. Why not? If the produced existed in the least,

original: de skyed pas yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de skyed pas yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: it would exist because it is produced.

original: bskyed bya cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: bskyed bya cung zad kyang med la /
translated: But the produced does not exist in the least.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skye bzhin pa'i bskyed pa mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nga skyes bzhin pa'i bskyed bya nyid mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skye bzhin pa'i bskyed pa mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nga skyes bzhin pa'i bskyed bya nyid mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: It is impossible for that which is already arisen, that which is not yet arisen, and that now arising to be the object of generation that is asserted by those who maintain that which is already arisen, that which is not yet arisen, and that now arising are generated.

original: skyes pa gang zhig bskyed bya min //üîΩma skyes de yang bskyed bya min //üîΩskyes pa dang ni ma skyes pa'i //
analyzed: skyes pa gang zhig bskyed bya min // ma skyes de yang bskyed bya min // skyes pa dang ni ma skyes pa'i //
translated: That which is already arisen is not the object of generation.üîΩThat which is not yet arisen also is not the object of generation.

original: skye bzhin pa yang bskyed bya min //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang bskyed bya min //
translated: That now arising also is not the object of generation.

original: de la re zhig skyes pa ni yod bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig skyes pa ni yod bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is already arisen is not the object of generation because it already exists.

original: da ltar ba bzhin bskyed bya min te /
analyzed: da ltar ba bzhin bskyed bya min te /
translated: Like the present, it is not the object of generation.

original: skye bar mi rung ba sa so //
analyzed: skye bar mi rung ba sa so //
translated: It is not suitable to be generated.

original: yang na bskyed bya de de ltar na skyes pa ma yin pa de skye ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bskyed bya de de ltar na skyes pa ma yin pa de skye ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, if the object of generation is like that, then that which is not yet arisen is not the object of generation because it depends on arising.

original: yang na skyes pa yang bskyed byar 'gyur na /
analyzed: yang na skyes pa yang bskyed byar 'gyur na /
translated: Or, if that which is already arisen is the object of generation,

original: de'i tshe @286a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe @286a * //
translated: then at that time

original: grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur la nam yang bskyed bya ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur la nam yang bskyed bya ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: that which is already established would be established, and it would never not be the object of generation.

original: de ltar re zhig skyes pa bskyed bya min no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skyes pa bskyed bya min no //
translated: Thus, first, the produced is not produced.

original: gang ma skyes pa de dngos po ma thob pa'i phyir ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin la gang zhig ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin pa de ni nges par gzung ba'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir 'di zhes bya ba de las skye'o zhes pa'i bye brag bstan du
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de dngos po ma thob pa'i phyir ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin la gang zhig ci'i ngo bo yang ma yin pa de ni nges par gzung ba'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir 'di zhes bya ba de las skye'o zhes pa'i bye brag bstan du
translated: Since that which is not produced does not obtain an entity, it is not of any nature. That which is not of any nature does not have the nature of being apprehended. Therefore, it cannot be indicated by the expression ‚Äúthis is produced from that.‚Äù

original: med pas ma skyes pa yang bskyed bya min no //
analyzed: med pas ma skyes pa yang bskyed bya min no //
translated: Since it cannot be indicated, that which is not produced is not produced.

original: gzhan yang gang ma skyes pa de la rten med pas skye ba'i bya ba 'jug pa nyid mi srid do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang ma skyes pa de la rten med pas skye ba'i bya ba 'jug pa nyid mi srid do zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, since that which is not produced does not have a basis, it is impossible for the activity of production to occur.

original: ma skyes pa bskyed bya min no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa bskyed bya min no //
translated: That which is not produced is not produced.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: ma skyes pa nyid bskyed bya min la skyes pa thams cad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid bskyed bya min la skyes pa thams cad kyang ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced is not produced, but not all that is produced is produced.

original: 'on kyang gang gis rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa nye ba las ma skyes pa de nyid bskyed par bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gis rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa nye ba las ma skyes pa de nyid bskyed par bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: However, that which is not produced from the collection of causes and conditions is produced.

original: smras pa / de su zhig gi / rgyu dang rkyen gang gis bskyed par bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de su zhig gi / rgyu dang rkyen gang gis bskyed par bya ba'i'o //
translated: That which is to be generated by causes and conditions.

original: slar yang su zhig gis bskyed par bya na /
analyzed: slar yang su zhig gis bskyed par bya na /
translated: Again, by what are they generated?

original: gang de'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis so zhes brjod pa na phan tshun brten pa thob par 'gyur na phan tshun dag ma grub pas gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa bskyed bya min /
analyzed: gang de'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis so zhes brjod pa na phan tshun brten pa thob par 'gyur na phan tshun dag ma grub pas gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa bskyed bya min /
translated: If it is said that they are generated by those causes and conditions, then mutual dependence would be obtained, but since neither is established through mutual dependence, neither exists. Therefore that which is not yet arisen is not generated.

original: nga ni skyes bzhin pa yang bskyed bya min te /
analyzed: nga ni skyes bzhin pa yang bskyed bya min te /
translated: Nor is that which is in the process of arising generated.

original: ci'i phyir ni skye bzhin pa ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir 'dir skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba gang zhig cung zad skyes la cung zad ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ni skye bzhin pa ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir 'dir skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba gang zhig cung zad skyes la cung zad ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Why? Because that which is in the process of arising is both arisen and not yet arisen. Here, what is called ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising‚Äù is that of which a little has arisen and a little has not yet arisen.

original: gang de'i cung zad skyes pa de de bzhin du bskyed bya ma yin te /
analyzed: gang de'i cung zad skyes pa de de bzhin du bskyed bya ma yin te /
translated: That of which a little has arisen is not generated in that way.

original: bshad pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error already explained would ensue.

original: gang 'di'i ma skyes pa yang bskyed bya ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'di'i ma skyes pa yang bskyed bya ma yin te /
translated: That of which a little has not yet arisen is also not generated.

original: smos pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smos pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error already mentioned would ensue.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa zhes pa skyes pa pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa zhes pa skyes pa pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen‚Äù and ‚Äúnot arisen‚Äù means arisen and not arisen, respectively.

original: dang po'i mthar can gyi gtan tshigs su bstan pa'i phyir dngos po gcig la skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dus gcig pa mi srid do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po'i mthar can gyi gtan tshigs su bstan pa'i phyir dngos po gcig la skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dus gcig pa mi srid do zhes bya ste /
translated: The suffix -tva is used to indicate the reason. Therefore, it is said that it is impossible for a single thing to be both arisen and not arisen at the same time.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po mi srid pas bskyed bya ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po mi srid pas bskyed bya ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Since such a thing is impossible, it is not something that is produced.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar skyes pa bskyed bya ma yin la ma skyes pa yang bskyed bya ma yin zhing skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i skye bzhin pa yang bskyed bya ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar skyes pa bskyed bya ma yin la ma skyes pa yang bskyed bya ma yin zhing skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i skye bzhin pa yang bskyed bya ma yin pas /
translated: When in this way the arisen is not something that is produced, the non-arisen is not something that is produced, and that which is in the process of arising, whether arisen or non-arisen, is not something that is produced,

original: de'i tshe bskyed bya med pas 'di dag bskyed par ga la 'gyur zhes pa de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bskyed bya med pas 'di dag bskyed par ga la 'gyur zhes pa de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, since there is nothing that is produced, how could these be producers?

original: gang gi tshe bskyed pa zhes bya ba de la mi srid pa de'i tshe skye ba med do zhes bya ba grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bskyed pa zhes bya ba de la mi srid pa de'i tshe skye ba med do zhes bya ba grub bo //
translated: When that which is called ‚Äúproduction‚Äù is impossible, then at that time, ‚Äúthere is no arising‚Äù is established.

original: @286b 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: @286b 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: gal te bskyed bya mi srid kyang de lta na yang 'bras bu skyed byed kyi rgyu re zhig yod la /
analyzed: gal te bskyed bya mi srid kyang de lta na yang 'bras bu skyed byed kyi rgyu re zhig yod la /
translated: But even if the produced does not exist, still the cause that produces the effect exists.

original: bskyed bya med na skyed byed kyang mi rung ngo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bskyed bya med na skyed byed kyang mi rung ngo zhes bya ste /
translated: And if the produced does not exist, the producer is not tenable.

original: des na bskyed bya yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na bskyed bya yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the produced also exists.üîΩIn response to this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / gal te skyed byed kyi rgyu nyid yod na bskyed bya yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te skyed byed kyi rgyu nyid yod na bskyed bya yod par 'gyur la /
translated: If the cause that produces the effect exists, the produced would exist.üîΩBut it does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pas /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pas /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'bras bu yod na 'bras ldan la //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na 'bras ldan la //
translated: If the effect exists, it would possess the cause.

original: der med gyur na rgyu med mtshungs //
analyzed: der med gyur na rgyu med mtshungs //
translated: If it does not exist there, it would be causeless.

original: yod dang med pa na yang 'gal //
analyzed: yod dang med pa na yang 'gal //
translated: It is contradictory for it to exist and not exist.

original: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
translated: It is also untenable in the three times.

original: 'dir yod bzhin pa'i mnyam pa'i sa bon dang lcags sreg gi gong bu la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: 'dir yod bzhin pa'i mnyam pa'i sa bon dang lcags sreg gi gong bu la sogs pa la ;
translated: Here, the seed that exists simultaneously with the sprout and a lump of iron, etc.

original: myu gu'i rgyur rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: myu gu'i rgyur rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: are posited as the cause of the sprout.

original: mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not suitable.

original: sa bon la rnam par 'jog ste myu gu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon la rnam par 'jog ste myu gu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seed is posited as the cause of the sprout because it possesses the effect called the sprout.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Because it is not related to an effect, it is not a cause.

original: ldan pa'i sgra 'di ni rgyu'i rjod byed du 'chad na /
analyzed: ldan pa'i sgra 'di ni rgyu'i rjod byed du 'chad na /
translated: If the term endowed is explained as expressing a cause,

original: gyur na zhes kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: gyur na zhes kha bskang ngo //
translated: then the term if it existed must be supplied.

original: des na 'bras bu yod na 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu yod na 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, if the effect exists, it would be endowed with the effect.

original: 'bras bu yod na rgyur 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na rgyur 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that if the effect exists, it is a cause.

original: gzhan du gal te 'bras ldan gyi sgras khyad par du byas par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan du gal te 'bras ldan gyi sgras khyad par du byas par ma gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, if the term endowed with the effect were not used as a qualifier,

original: de'i tshe 'di su'i khyad par yin pas gzung bar ma gyur pas su zhig 'bras bu dang ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di su'i khyad par yin pas gzung bar ma gyur pas su zhig 'bras bu dang ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: then since it would not be understood whose effect it is, who would be said to be endowed with the effect?

original: de las kyang don ma tshang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las kyang don ma tshang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the meaning would be incomplete,

original: rgyu'i rjod byed la 'bras ldan gyi sgra'i don ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rjod byed la 'bras ldan gyi sgra'i don ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the term endowed with the effect would not be complete in expressing a cause.

original: yang na 'di ni rgyu med mtshungs //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rgyu med mtshungs //
translated: Or else, it would be equal to causelessness.

original: zhes brjod pa'i shugs las don gyis thob na /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa'i shugs las don gyis thob na /
translated: If the meaning is implicitly obtained from the statement,üîΩthen the meaning of the term endowed with the effect would be incomplete in expressing a cause.

original: de lta na yang 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi 'gro'o zhes pa 'di'i rgyu'i sgras brjod pa'i shugs gang zhig las don gyis thob par rigs kyi gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi 'gro'o zhes pa 'di'i rgyu'i sgras brjod pa'i shugs gang zhig las don gyis thob par rigs kyi gzhan ma yin la /
translated: But it is logical that the meaning of the term ‚Äúcause‚Äù is obtained by implication from the statement ‚ÄúOne who is not a goer does not go,‚Äù and not from anything else.
