original: rgyu'i sgra'i rnam grangs nye bar len par brjod kyi shugs kyis thob par ma bshad do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra'i rnam grangs nye bar len par brjod kyi shugs kyis thob par ma bshad do zhes bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúcause‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúappropriator,‚Äù but it is not explained that the meaning of ‚Äúappropriator‚Äù is obtained by implication.

original: de ltar yin na yang de lta na yang skyon ci yang med de bshad pa las bye brag bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang de lta na yang skyon ci yang med de bshad pa las bye brag bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Even though that is so, there is no error because the Abhidharmako≈õa declares that the specific characteristics of the five effects should be established.üîΩThe Abhidharmako≈õa declares:

original: de la lnga po da ltar ba'i 'bras bu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de la lnga po da ltar ba'i 'bras bu 'dzin cing /
translated: The five effects are effects of the present.

original: gnyis ni da ltar ba skyed par byed la da ltar ba dang 'das pa la ni gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: gnyis ni da ltar ba skyed par byed la da ltar ba dang 'das pa la ni gnyis kyis so //
translated: Two are effects of the present and two are effects of the present and past.üîΩOne is generated by the past.

original: gcig ni 'das pas bskyed do zhes chos mngon pa las rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /üîΩlhan cig 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang @287a * //
analyzed: gcig ni 'das pas bskyed do zhes chos mngon pa las rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /üîΩlhan cig 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang @287a * //
translated: The five effects are effects of the present because the five effects are effects of the present alone.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu lnga da ltar ba'i gnas skabs nyid na 'bras bu 'dzin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu lnga da ltar ba'i gnas skabs nyid na 'bras bu 'dzin te /
translated: The five causes called conjoined, omnipresent, and maturational hold their result in the present alone.

original: 'bras bu ma bzung na ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po bskyed mi nus pa'i phyir na rgyu'i dngos po la gnas so //üîΩ'bras bu yang 'ga' zhig da ltar ba nyid du skyed de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma bzung na ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po bskyed mi nus pa'i phyir na rgyu'i dngos po la gnas so // 'bras bu yang 'ga' zhig da ltar ba nyid du skyed de 'di lta ste /
translated: Because if they do not hold their result, they are unable to generate the future state of the result, they maintain the state of cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dag gi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no //üîΩ'ga' zhig da ltar ba dang 'das pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dag gi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no // 'ga' zhig da ltar ba dang 'das pa ste /
translated: Some results are generated in the present, such as the result of conscious effort and the dominant result of coemergent and homogeneous causes.

original: 'di lta ste skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Some are generated in the present and past, such as the natural result of homogeneous and omnipresent causes.

original: 'das pa'i dngos pos bskyed do zhes pa ni gsal lo //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dngos pos bskyed do zhes pa ni gsal lo //
translated: The generation of results by means of the past state is clear.

original: da ltar ba ni de ma thag tu rdzogs pa'i phyir 'bras bu bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba ni de ma thag tu rdzogs pa'i phyir 'bras bu bskyed pa'o //
translated: The present generates results because it immediately completes them.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa na de dag kyang 'das pa 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir slar yang 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa na de dag kyang 'das pa 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir slar yang 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin la /
translated: When the effect has arisen, they are past and do not generate the effect again.

original: da ltar bskyed pa'i 'bras bu slar bskyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: da ltar bskyed pa'i 'bras bu slar bskyed par mi nus so //
translated: Nor can they generate the effect that is present.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa nyid kyis 'bras bu 'byin to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa nyid kyis 'bras bu 'byin to //
translated: The cause that is a ripening cause ripens the effect by being past.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar rgyu rnams 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang skyed pa'i 'brel pa byas pas rgyu nyid la de'i tshe 'bras bu yod na de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu ni rgyu nyid du 'thad kyi med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar rgyu rnams 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang skyed pa'i 'brel pa byas pas rgyu nyid la de'i tshe 'bras bu yod na de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu ni rgyu nyid du 'thad kyi med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: When causes have performed the function of holding and generating the effect, they are causes. At that time, if the effect exists, it is tenable that the cause is related to it. But if the effect does not exist, it is not tenable that the cause is related to it.

original: gang yang rgyu rnams rgyu nyid du grub pa'i don du 'bras bu yod par khas len pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yod bzhin pa la rgyus ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu rnams rgyu nyid du grub pa'i don du 'bras bu yod par khas len pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yod bzhin pa la rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: When you accept that the effect exists in order to establish that the causes are causes, then what does the cause do to the effect that already exists?

original: gang gi don du rgyu yongs su tshol ba de'i 'bras bu yod pa nyid na rgyus dgos pa cung zad kyang med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du rgyu yongs su tshol ba de'i 'bras bu yod pa nyid na rgyus dgos pa cung zad kyang med do zhes bya'o //
translated: When the effect exists, the cause has no purpose at all.

original: yang na 'bras bu 'di'i rgyu 'di'o zhes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i don du 'bras bu yod bzhin pa'i rgyu 'dod pa de yang mi 'thad de /üîΩci'i phyir na 'dir 'bras bu yod par khas blangs pa la dgos pa med pas rgyu med pa nyid du grub par 'dod pa dang / rgyu med na 'bras bu yod pa nyid sel ba dang phan tshun brten pas bsal bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di'i rgyu 'di'i zhes mi 'thad do //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu 'di'i rgyu 'di'o zhes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i don du 'bras bu yod bzhin pa'i rgyu 'dod pa de yang mi 'thad de / ci'i phyir na 'dir 'bras bu yod par khas blangs pa la dgos pa med pas rgyu med pa nyid du grub par 'dod pa dang / rgyu med na 'bras bu yod pa nyid sel ba dang phan tshun brten pas bsal bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di'i rgyu 'di'i zhes mi 'thad do //
translated: Or, if you assert that the cause exists while the effect exists, in order to establish the meaning of ‚ÄúThis is the cause of this effect,‚Äù that is also untenable.üîΩWhy? Because here, since there is no need to assert that the effect exists, it is established that it is causeless, and if there is no cause, the existence of the effect is eliminated. Since they mutually depend, they are eliminated. Therefore it is untenable to state, ‚ÄúThis is the cause of this effect.‚Äù

original: des kyang 'bras bu 'di'i rgyu 'di'o zhes rnam par gzhag par don du 'bras bu yod bzhin pa'i rgyu 'dod pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: des kyang 'bras bu 'di'i rgyu 'di'o zhes rnam par gzhag par don du 'bras bu yod bzhin pa'i rgyu 'dod pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Also, it is illogical to assert that the cause exists while the effect exists in order to establish the meaning of ‚ÄúThis is the cause of this effect.‚Äù

original: ji srid de'i 'bras bu ma rdzogs pa de srid du dngos po 'ga' zhig rgyu'i rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur bas @287b 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i 'jig rten pa su zhig nye bar len pa dang spong ba la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji srid de'i 'bras bu ma rdzogs pa de srid du dngos po 'ga' zhig rgyu'i rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur bas @287b 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i 'jig rten pa su zhig nye bar len pa dang spong ba la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: As long as its effect is not complete, then for that long, there would be no basis for positing any entity as a cause. Therefore, what worldly person who seeks an effect would engage in adopting or rejecting?

original: 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams kyis sngar rgyu nye bar len cing rgyu ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams kyis sngar rgyu nye bar len cing rgyu ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThose who seek an effect engage in adopting the cause and rejecting what is not the cause,‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni cung zad tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni cung zad tsam ste /
translated: this is just a little bit of something.

original: de ni 'bras bu yod na rgyus dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu yod na rgyus dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: If the effect exists, the cause has no purpose whatsoever.

original: yang na de'i rgyus dgos pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: yang na de'i rgyus dgos pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe cause has a purpose,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then in that case, it does not exist.

original: skyes pa slar yang mi skye bas thug pa med pa'i skyon dang / skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skyes pa slar yang mi skye bas thug pa med pa'i skyon dang / skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
translated: Because that which has arisen does not arise again, there is the error of infinite arising, and arising would be pointless.

original: skye ltar de bzhin du 'bras bu yod pa ni rgyu 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ltar de bzhin du 'bras bu yod pa ni rgyu 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as arising is not tenable if the effect exists, in the same way, the cause is not tenable if the effect exists.

original: yang na ji skad smos pa'i skyon bsal ba'i don du med pa 'bras bu 'dod na /üîΩde lta na yang /
analyzed: yang na ji skad smos pa'i skyon bsal ba'i don du med pa 'bras bu 'dod na / de lta na yang /
translated: Or, if you assert an effect that does not exist in order to eliminate the fault stated above, then in that case:

original: der med na yang rgyu med mtshungs //üîΩzho zhes bya ba 'bras bu yod na /
analyzed: der med na yang rgyu med mtshungs // zho zhes bya ba 'bras bu yod na /
translated: Even if it does not exist there, it is the same as having no cause.

original: 'o ma ni de'i rgyu la chu ni ma yin no zhes rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o ma ni de'i rgyu la chu ni ma yin no zhes rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If the effect called ‚Äúcurds‚Äù exists, then it is logical to say that milk is its cause and water is not.

original: 'bras bu ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'bras bu ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is endowed with an effect and is not.

original: / gang du de'i 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba med /
analyzed: / gang du de'i 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba med /
translated: But when the effect called ‚Äúcurds‚Äù does not exist there,üîΩthen at that time, there is no difference between water, etc. and milk, in that neither is the cause of the effect called ‚Äúcurds.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe zho zhes bya ba 'o ma'i 'bras bu la chu la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa dang 'o ma rgyu yin pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir 'o ma la sogs pa la zho mi skye bar 'gyur te /üîΩrgyu med pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe zho zhes bya ba 'o ma'i 'bras bu la chu la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa dang 'o ma rgyu yin pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir 'o ma la sogs pa la zho mi skye bar 'gyur te / rgyu med pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, curds would not arise from milk, etc., because it would be the same as having no cause.

original: de ltar 'bras bu med na de la rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu med na de la rgyu yang med do //
translated: Thus, if the effect does not exist, its cause also does not exist.

original: yang na 'di snyam du yod pa dang med pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du yod pa dang med pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the cause of an existent or nonexistent effect exists,

original: smras pa / yod dang med pa na yang 'gal te /
analyzed: smras pa / yod dang med pa na yang 'gal te /
translated: we say: It is contradictory for it to exist or not to exist.

original: 'bras bu gcig la yod pa dang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir mi srid do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig la yod pa dang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir mi srid do zhes bya ste /
translated: Because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive, it is impossible for them to be in the same effect.

original: de lta bu'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, such an effect does not exist.

original: de med na 'bras bu yod bzhin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de med na 'bras bu yod bzhin pa ma yin la /
translated: If it does not exist, the effect does not exist.üîΩHow could a cause ever exist without depending on an effect?

original: 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i rgyu nam yang ga la zhig ces pas ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas dus gsum du 'bras bu'i rgyu 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ste rgyu med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i rgyu nam yang ga la zhig ces pas ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas dus gsum du 'bras bu'i rgyu 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ste rgyu med do //
translated: Thus, the cause of an effect is not tenable in any of the three temporal periods.

original: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
translated: It is not tenable in any of the three temporal periods.

original: zhes bya'o // de la 'bras bu yod pa'i rgyu 'dod na sngar 'bras bu la phyis ni rgyu'o zhes thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la 'bras bu yod pa'i rgyu 'dod na sngar 'bras bu la phyis ni rgyu'o zhes thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that a cause exists when its effect exists, then it would follow that the effect would exist first and the cause later.

original: slob ma dang slob dpon bzhin no //
analyzed: slob ma dang slob dpon bzhin no //
translated: This would be like a student and a teacher.üîΩIf you assert that a cause exists when its effect does not exist, then it would follow that the cause would exist first and the effect later.

original: 'bras bu med na sngar ni rgyu la phyis ni 'bras bu'o zhes thob par 'gyur te zho dang 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na sngar ni rgyu la phyis ni 'bras bu'o zhes thob par 'gyur te zho dang 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: This would be like curd and milk.

original: yod pa dang med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it both exists and does not exist,

original: da lta ba la rgyu dang 'bras @288a * //üîΩbu dag 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da lta ba la rgyu dang 'bras @288a * // bu dag 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The effect would be obtained from the cause in the present.

original: skye bzhin pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that now arising has the nature of both existing and not existing.

original: de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad rgyu mi 'thad par gzigs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad rgyu mi 'thad par gzigs nas gsungs pa /
translated: Since it is seen that in this way, in every way, the cause is untenable, it is said:

original: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //üîΩzhes so // yang na dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin // zhes so // yang na dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
translated: It is not tenable in any of the three times.

original: zhes pa'i yang gi sgra ni phyi bar blta'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i yang gi sgra ni phyi bar blta'o //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not tenable in any of the three times‚Äù should be read as ‚Äúas well.‚Äù

original: de la rgyu ni 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis na dus gsum la 'bras bu yang dus gsum mo //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis na dus gsum la 'bras bu yang dus gsum mo //
translated: In that case, since the cause is past, present, and future, the effect is also in the three times.

original: 'bras bu re re la yang dus gsum du yang rgyu mi srid do /üîΩji ltar bstan pa'i rigs pas zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu re re la yang dus gsum du yang rgyu mi srid do / ji ltar bstan pa'i rigs pas zhes gsungs pa /
translated: But it is not possible for each effect to have a cause in the three times.

original: dus gsum rnams su 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: dus gsum rnams su 'thad ma yin //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe cause is not tenable in any of the three times‚Äù is stated by the reasoning explained above.

original: zhes bya'o / de skad du yang rtsa ba'i rab byed nyi shu par /üîΩ'das pa'i 'bras bu 'das pa yi //
analyzed: zhes bya'o / de skad du yang rtsa ba'i rab byed nyi shu par / 'das pa'i 'bras bu 'das pa yi //
translated: In the twentieth chapter of Root Verses on the Middle Way, it says:üîΩThe effect of the past is not

original: rgyu dang lhan cig ma yin la //
analyzed: rgyu dang lhan cig ma yin la //
translated: Simultaneous with the cause.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa //
translated: The non-arisen and the non-arisen

original: nam yang lhan cig yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam yang lhan cig yod ma yin //
translated: Never exist simultaneously.üîΩThe non-arisen effect

original: ma skyes pa yi 'bras bu dang // ma skyes rgyu dag lhan cig min ;
analyzed: ma skyes pa yi 'bras bu dang // ma skyes rgyu dag lhan cig min ;
translated: And the non-arisen cause do not exist simultaneously.

original: /'das pa dang ni ma skyes pa //
analyzed: /'das pa dang ni ma skyes pa //
translated: The past and the non-arisen

original: nam yang lhan cig yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam yang lhan cig yod ma yin //
translated: Never exist simultaneously.üîΩThe non-arisen effect

original: ma skyes pa yi 'bras bu dang // skyes pa'i rgyu dag lhan cig min //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yi 'bras bu dang // skyes pa'i rgyu dag lhan cig min //
translated: And the arisen cause do not exist simultaneously.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: The non-arisen and the non-ceased

original: lhan cig nam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig nam yang ma yin no //
translated: Never exist simultaneously.

original: zhes gang gi chos 'di ltar dpyad na rgyu mi srid pa de'i tshe rgyu med na ;
analyzed: zhes gang gi chos 'di ltar dpyad na rgyu mi srid pa de'i tshe rgyu med na ;
translated: When the cause is analyzed in this way, it is impossible. When there is no cause,

original: des bskyed bya 'bras bu med la /
analyzed: des bskyed bya 'bras bu med la /
translated: there is no effect that is generated by it.

original: bskyed bya 'bras bu med pas skye ba med pa grub bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed bya 'bras bu med pas skye ba med pa grub bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no effect that is generated, non-arising is established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: rgyu'i grangs nye bar bstan pa yod pa'i phyir yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu'i grangs nye bar bstan pa yod pa'i phyir yod pa nyid de /
translated: Since the enumeration of the cause is demonstrated, it exists.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i rus sbal gyi spu la grangs nye bar ston pa ma yin la rgyu'i grangs nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i rus sbal gyi spu la grangs nye bar ston pa ma yin la rgyu'i grangs nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The enumeration of the cause is not demonstrated for the nonexistent hair of a turtle.

original: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung ba dang // skal mnyam mtshungs par ldan pa dang // kun du 'gro dang rnam smin rgyu //
analyzed: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung ba dang // skal mnyam mtshungs par ldan pa dang // kun du 'gro dang rnam smin rgyu //
translated: and the active cause.

original: rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
translated: Causes are asserted to be of six types.

original: ces chos mngon pa las so //
analyzed: ces chos mngon pa las so //
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharma.

original: mdo las kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo las kyang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also stated in the sutras:

original: chos gcig ni khyad par gyi skal ba can te /
analyzed: chos gcig ni khyad par gyi skal ba can te /
translated: One phenomenon is endowed with distinction:

original: gang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: proper mental attention.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gnyis kyis yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gnyis kyis yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: The correct view is generated by two causes and two conditions:

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyis tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / gzhan las rjes su mthun pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyis tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / gzhan las rjes su mthun pa'i sgra'o //
translated: proper mental attention by one‚Äôs own mind and the sound of the agreeable Dharma from another.

original: chos gsum ni mang po byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos gsum ni mang po byed pa ste /
translated: Three phenomena are the creators of many:

original: skyes bu dam pa bsten @288b pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes so /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa bsten @288b pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes so /
translated: relying on holy beings, listening to the holy Dharma, and proper mental attention.

original: smras pa / gal te rgyu yod na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te rgyu yod na /
translated: It is said: If there is a cause,

original: de'i grangs yod pa nyid la /
analyzed: de'i grangs yod pa nyid la /
translated: its number exists.

original: yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: In order to show how it does not exist, it is said:

original: gcig med par ni mang po dang // mang po med par gcig mi 'jug / de phyir rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: gcig med par ni mang po dang // mang po med par gcig mi 'jug / de phyir rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
translated: Therefore, things that are dependently arisen

original: dngos po mtshan ma med pa yin //
analyzed: dngos po mtshan ma med pa yin //
translated: are signless.

original: 'dir tha dad pa rnams su bgrang ba'i brda la 'jig rten du grangs zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'dir tha dad pa rnams su bgrang ba'i brda la 'jig rten du grangs zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Here, the conventional term ‚Äúnumber‚Äù is posited in the world for enumerating differences.

original: tha dad pa 'di rnams bgrang bar byed rtsi bar byed do zhes byas nas grangs de yang gcig dang gnyis dang mang po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di rnams bgrang bar byed rtsi bar byed do zhes byas nas grangs de yang gcig dang gnyis dang mang po la sogs pas so //
translated: Having enumerated and counted these differences, that number is one, two, many, and so on.

original: de la gang 'di'i gcig gi grangs las bgrang bya gcig tu rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: de la gang 'di'i gcig gi grangs las bgrang bya gcig tu rnam par 'jog la /
translated: In that regard, that which is posited as one object of enumeration from the number one

original: de bzhin du gnyis kyi grangs kyis gnyis kyi dngos po la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis kyi grangs kyis gnyis kyi dngos po la /
translated: and that which is posited as two objects of enumeration from the number two

original: mang po'i grangs kyis mang po'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: mang po'i grangs kyis mang po'i dngos po'o //
translated: is the nature of many from the number many.

original: de la gang zhig gcig mang po'i dngos po la mi ltos par 'ga' zhig grub par 'gyur na gcig gi grangs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la gang zhig gcig mang po'i dngos po la mi ltos par 'ga' zhig grub par 'gyur na gcig gi grangs su 'gyur la /
translated: In that regard, if something were to be established as something without depending on the nature of one or many, it would be the number one.

original: mang po la ma ltos par gcig gi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa med do //
analyzed: mang po la ma ltos par gcig gi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa med do //
translated: The nature of a single thing is not established without depending on many.

original: de la gang re zhig bdag nyid dang bco lnga'i chos skye ba de rnams chos bco lnga la ma ltos pa'i gcig gi chos ni med do //
analyzed: de la gang re zhig bdag nyid dang bco lnga'i chos skye ba de rnams chos bco lnga la ma ltos pa'i gcig gi chos ni med do //
translated: Among those, the thing that arises first, along with the fifteen qualities, does not exist as a single quality without depending on the fifteen qualities.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'di'i gzugs can gyi dngos po gcig 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'di'i gzugs can gyi dngos po gcig 'dod na /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that it is a single substantial entity with form,

original: de 'dod pa'i khams su rdzas brgyad kyi bdag nyid la /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i khams su rdzas brgyad kyi bdag nyid la /
translated: then in the desire realm, it would be by nature eight substances,

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir zhes pa'i nges pa las sgra'i rdul phra rab ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir zhes pa'i nges pa las sgra'i rdul phra rab ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the subtle particle of sound, because it is beyond the sense faculties.

original: rdzas bdun la ma ltos par rang gi ngo bo grub pa med do /
analyzed: rdzas bdun la ma ltos par rang gi ngo bo grub pa med do /
translated: It would not be established with its own nature without depending on seven substances.

original: yang na gal te gzugs khams su sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: yang na gal te gzugs khams su sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin la /
translated: Or, if in the form realm, it is by nature mind and mental factors,

original: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / zhes pa'i nges pa las thams cad bsdus na rdzas bcu gcig gi bdag nyid la ltos so //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / zhes pa'i nges pa las thams cad bsdus na rdzas bcu gcig gi bdag nyid la ltos so //
translated: then it would depend on all eleven substances, because it is certain that mind and mental factors always occur together.

original: yang na ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ste //
analyzed: yang na ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ste //
translated: Or, if it is non-associated,

original: de la yang ;
analyzed: de la yang ;
translated: Moreover,

original: de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs //
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs //
translated: the arising of those is the arising of arising, etc.

original: de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug / ces pa'i nges pa las de de ltar mang po la ltos par dngos po gcig med la /
analyzed: de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug / ces pa'i nges pa las de de ltar mang po la ltos par dngos po gcig med la /
translated: Since it is definite that they engage eight or one thing, one thing does not exist in reliance on many.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar mang po la ma ltos par dngos po gcig med pa de'i tshe /üîΩdngos po gcig pu 'grub par @289a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar mang po la ma ltos par dngos po gcig med pa de'i tshe / dngos po gcig pu 'grub par @289a * //
translated: When one thing does not exist in reliance on many in that way,üîΩthen one thing is not established.

original: mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi 'gyur na /
translated: If one thing is not established,üîΩhow could many be established?

original: gcig bsags pa ga la zhig / gcig bsags pa med na mang po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcig bsags pa ga la zhig / gcig bsags pa med na mang po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: If one thing is not established, many do not exist.

original: mang po yang med do //
analyzed: mang po yang med do //
translated: Many also do not exist.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa las /
translated: As it is said in the ƒÄrya≈õatasƒÅhasrikƒÅpraj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ:

original: dngos po gang gang rnam brtags na //
analyzed: dngos po gang gang rnam brtags na //
translated: Whatever things are imagined,

original: de dang de la gcig med la //
analyzed: de dang de la gcig med la //
translated: in those one thing does not exist.

original: gang du gcig kyang med pa na //üîΩgang du ma 'ongs yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang du gcig kyang med pa na // gang du ma 'ongs yod ma yin //
translated: Where one thing does not exist,üîΩmany also do not exist.

original: zhes so // gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po mang po la ma ltos par dngos po gcig med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhes so // gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po mang po la ma ltos par dngos po gcig med pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one thing does not exist in reliance on many in that way,

original: dngos po gcig med pa la mang po 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig med pa la mang po 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: one thing not existing, many are not tenable.

original: gang gi tshe yang dngos po gcig med par gyur na mang po mi 'thad pa de'i tshe mang po med pas de dang 'brel pa las byung ba'i gcig kyang med do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dngos po gcig med par gyur na mang po mi 'thad pa de'i tshe mang po med pas de dang 'brel pa las byung ba'i gcig kyang med do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: When one thing does not exist, many things are not tenable. Since many things do not exist, the one that arises in dependence on them also does not exist.üîΩAs it is said:

original: mang po med par gcig mi 'jug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mang po med par gcig mi 'jug / ces bya ba la /
translated: Without many, one does not occur.

original: mang po med na gcig mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mang po med na gcig mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that without many, one is not possible.

original: gang du gcig la gcig gam mang po'i dngos po med pa de la gcig gi grangs sam mang po nyid kyi grangs ga la 'jug bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang du gcig la gcig gam mang po'i dngos po med pa de la gcig gi grangs sam mang po nyid kyi grangs ga la 'jug bya ba ste /
translated: Where there is no single thing or many things, how could the number one or the number many apply?

original: des na grangs med la /
analyzed: des na grangs med la /
translated: Thus, without numbers,

original: grangs med na yang grangs srid pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis grub pa'i rgyu mi 'grub bo //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: grangs med na yang grangs srid pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis grub pa'i rgyu mi 'grub bo // 'dir smras pa /
translated: the basis for numbers is not established.

original: gal te gcig med na de la gcig gi tha snyad mi 'byung na /üîΩbum pa gcig ces pa dang gal te mang po med na de'i tshe mang po'i tha snyad med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gcig med na de la gcig gi tha snyad mi 'byung na / bum pa gcig ces pa dang gal te mang po med na de'i tshe mang po'i tha snyad med par 'gyur na /
translated: Here, someone might say, ‚ÄúIf the term one does not apply to that which is one,üîΩthen the term many would not apply to many.

original: bum pa mang po zhes so //
analyzed: bum pa mang po zhes so //
translated: For example, the terms ‚Äòone pot‚Äô and ‚Äòmany pots‚Äô would not exist.‚Äù

original: smras pa / su zhig de skad smra /
analyzed: smras pa / su zhig de skad smra /
translated: Objection: Who says this?

original: gcig med cing mang po med do zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gcig med cing mang po med do zhes bya ba /
translated: Reply: ‚ÄúOne does not exist and many do not exist.‚Äù

original: kho bos gcig dang mang po'i dngos po'i ngo bo grub pa bkag la /
analyzed: kho bos gcig dang mang po'i dngos po'i ngo bo grub pa bkag la /
translated: I have refuted the establishment of the entity of one and many.

original: gang las de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo grub pa med pa /
analyzed: gang las de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo grub pa med pa /
translated: From that, the establishment of their own entity does not exist.

original: de phyir rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: de phyir rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
translated: Therefore, things that arise in dependence

original: dngos po mtshan ma med pa yin //üîΩgang kho na de rnams kyi ngo bo ma grub pa de nyid kyis na dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po mtshan ma med pa yin // gang kho na de rnams kyi ngo bo ma grub pa de nyid kyis na dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: are without signs.üîΩSince the entity of those does not exist, things arise in dependence.

original: rang bzhin yod pa rnams skye ba don med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa rnams skye ba don med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the arising of things that exist essentially would be pointless,

original: rang bzhin ma grub pa'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nye bar thob la /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma grub pa'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nye bar thob la /
translated: things that are not established as essentially existent, such as reflections, are obtained as dependently arisen.

original: de nyid kyis na chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par grub pa'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par grub pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is established that all phenomena are signless and all phenomena are empty of essence.

original: rang bzhin med pas phan tshun du bye brag yongs su ma brtags pas mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pas phan tshun du bye brag yongs su ma brtags pas mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Since it is devoid of intrinsic nature, it is signless, since it is not examined as a particular in relation to anything else.

original: @289b dngos po thams cad bye brag med pas gcig gi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @289b dngos po thams cad bye brag med pas gcig gi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since all things are undifferentiated, it is the nature of the one.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir yang mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir yang mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: It is also signless because it is not an object of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Consciousness is the object of signs,

original: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzhan las khyad par 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du gyur pa'i rang gi dmigs pa la 'jug bzhin pas 'jug par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzhan las khyad par 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du gyur pa'i rang gi dmigs pa la 'jug bzhin pas 'jug par 'gyur grang na /
translated: since consciousness engages its object of perception by means of a particular distinction from other objects of consciousness.

original: de yang khyad par gyi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin med pas med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang khyad par gyi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin med pas med do zhes bya ste /
translated: But that is not so, since the object of perception has no intrinsic nature that is a particular distinction.

original: 'di nyid kyis na rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pas dngos po mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis na rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pas dngos po mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that things are signless because they are not objects of consciousness.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du'ang smra ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du'ang smra ste /
translated: Others explain it differently.

original: 'dir nges par tha snyad kyi don du don la mid dag 'jug la /
analyzed: 'dir nges par tha snyad kyi don du don la mid dag 'jug la /
translated: Here, the meaning of the term is definitely applied to the object.

original: de rnams kyang phan tshun du rang las gzhan pa'i ming rnam par gcad pa'i sgo nas rang gis rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: de rnams kyang phan tshun du rang las gzhan pa'i ming rnam par gcad pa'i sgo nas rang gis rtogs par byed la /
translated: Moreover, they are mutually understood by way of the exclusion of other names.

original: mang po yod kyang de dag rnam par gcad pa'i don du gcig ces bya ba'i tshig 'thad la /
analyzed: mang po yod kyang de dag rnam par gcad pa'i don du gcig ces bya ba'i tshig 'thad la /
translated: Although there are many, the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is tenable for the purpose of excluding those.

original: de yang gzhan med na 'dis ci zhig rnam par gcad par bya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang gzhan med na 'dis ci zhig rnam par gcad par bya zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, if there is no other, what is excluded by this?

original: sbyor bar mi byed par thal lo //
analyzed: sbyor bar mi byed par thal lo //
translated: It follows that it does not engage in exclusion.

original: ming gi rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i gcig gi grangs 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ming gi rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i gcig gi grangs 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The number ‚Äúone‚Äù does not exist as anything other than the nature of a name.

original: dgra de las ma grol lo zhes bya ba lta bu la sogs pa yul gzhan du brjod pa'i tha snyad las de dag 'di ltar mang po dang 'brel pa dang mang po'i rgyu mtshan gyis mang po las gzhan du gcig yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: dgra de las ma grol lo zhes bya ba lta bu la sogs pa yul gzhan du brjod pa'i tha snyad las de dag 'di ltar mang po dang 'brel pa dang mang po'i rgyu mtshan gyis mang po las gzhan du gcig yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba
translated: For example, in ‚ÄúI am not free from that enemy,‚Äù and so on, from the expression of another object, it is said that they are not related in that way, and because of the reason of many, many are not different from one.

original: la / gzhan la rag las pas rang brgyud pa ma yin la /
analyzed: la / gzhan la rag las pas rang brgyud pa ma yin la /
translated: Since it depends on another, it is not an independent continuum.

original: rang brgyud pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su ma grub ba'o //
analyzed: rang brgyud pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su ma grub ba'o //
translated: Because it is not an independent continuum, it is not fully established.

original: de bzhin du grangs cig shos kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs cig shos kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The other number should be understood in the same way.

original: gal te de ltar grangs mi 'thad na gcig dang gnyis dang mang po la sogs pa'i tha snyad ji ltar 'dogs she na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar grangs mi 'thad na gcig dang gnyis dang mang po la sogs pa'i tha snyad ji ltar 'dogs she na /
translated: If number is not tenable in this way, how can conventions such as one, two, many, and so on be posited?

original: de phyir rten cing 'brel 'byung gi / dngos po mtshan ma med pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir rten cing 'brel 'byung gi / dngos po mtshan ma med pa yin //
translated: Therefore, all things that are dependently arisen are devoid of characteristics.

original: 'di skad ces smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ces smras par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir na gcig gam mang po la rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnas pa de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad la de ltar dngos po mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir na gcig gam mang po la rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnas pa de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad la de ltar dngos po mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Because in this way one and many do not exist by their own characteristics in mutual dependence, therefore all things that are dependently arisen are devoid of characteristics.

original: ji ltar thags kyi yon tan gyi mtshan nyid pas thags nyid la ma grub kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar thags kyi yon tan gyi mtshan nyid pas thags nyid la ma grub kyang /
translated: Just as the characteristics of the qualities of cloth are not established in the cloth itself,

original: nye bar brten nas snam bu nyid du btags la /
analyzed: nye bar brten nas snam bu nyid du btags la /
translated: but cloth is imputed in dependence on them,

original: @290a * // de bzhin du don dam par gcig med kyang de la brten nas mang po'i tha snyad byed la /
analyzed: @290a * // de bzhin du don dam par gcig med kyang de la brten nas mang po'i tha snyad byed la /
translated: in the same way, although one does not exist ultimately, the convention of many is made in dependence on it.

original: mang po ma grub na yang de la brten nas gcig gi tha snyad 'dogs la /
analyzed: mang po ma grub na yang de la brten nas gcig gi tha snyad 'dogs la /
translated: If many are not established, then on the basis of that, the convention of one is designated.

original: don dam par ni mtshan ma med pas dngos po'i mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni mtshan ma med pas dngos po'i mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But in the ultimate, since there are no marks, it is called the absence of the mark of entities.

original: mtshan ma med pa nyid pas mtshan ma med la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa nyid pas mtshan ma med la /
translated: Since it is itself without marks, it is without marks.

original: dngos po nyid du tha snyad pa'i blos mtshan mar byas pas mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po nyid du tha snyad pa'i blos mtshan mar byas pas mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is marked by the mind that conventionally designates it as an entity, it is called a mark.

original: de yang yongs su ma grub pa nyid pas mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang yongs su ma grub pa nyid pas mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And since that is not fully established, it is called the absence of marks.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gal te khyod kyis de ltar grangs bkag pas rgyu med par bsgrubs na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis de ltar grangs bkag pas rgyu med par bsgrubs na /
translated: If you establish it as causeless by refuting its number in that way,

original: kho na de ltar gyur na khyod kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kho na de ltar gyur na khyod kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be tenable for you to attain dependent origination.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'dir rgyu la brten nas 'bras bu gang zhig skye brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir rgyu la brten nas 'bras bu gang zhig skye brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is like this: Here, whatever effect arises in dependence on a cause is dependent origination.

original: de yang rgyu med par bsgrubs pas gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang rgyu med par bsgrubs pas gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: And that is undermined by being established as causeless.

original: de la gnod pa yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gnod pa yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not proper to harm it.

original: de mthong bas chos mthong bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /üîΩgang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong la /
analyzed: de mthong bas chos mthong bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te / gang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said that one sees the Dharma by seeing it.üîΩThe s≈´tra says, ‚ÄúWhoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: gang gis chos mthong ba des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis chos mthong ba des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma sees the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir skyed byed kyi rgyu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir skyed byed kyi rgyu yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because dependent origination exists, a productive cause exists.

original: smras pa / rgyu la brten nas 'byung bar brtags pa ni rung gi rgyu med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu la brten nas 'byung bar brtags pa ni rung gi rgyu med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: We say: It is proper to impute arising in dependence on a cause, but not in the absence of a cause.

original: 'di ltar yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar brtags pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar brtags pa mi 'thad de /
translated: In this way, it is also untenable to impute dependent origination.

original: bdag gi phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi phyir /
translated: Because of self.

original: rten 'byung yan lag bcu gnyis gang //
analyzed: rten 'byung yan lag bcu gnyis gang //
translated: The twelve members of dependent origination

original: sdug bsngal 'bras can de ma skyes //üîΩsems gcig la yang ma yin zhing //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'bras can de ma skyes // sems gcig la yang ma yin zhing //
translated: that have suffering as their effect do not arise.üîΩThey do not exist in a single mind,

original: du ma la yang de ma yin //
analyzed: du ma la yang de ma yin //
translated: nor do they exist in many minds.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa nas rga shi'i mthar thug pa la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su gsungs la /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa nas rga shi'i mthar thug pa la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su gsungs la /
translated: The twelve factors of dependent origination are taught, from the condition of ignorance producing formations up to aging and death.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal te /
translated: And the result of this dependent origination is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ni 'di'i 'bras bu zhes bya bas sdug bsngal 'bras can la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni 'di'i 'bras bu zhes bya bas sdug bsngal 'bras can la /
translated: Since suffering is its result, it is said to have suffering as its result.

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is impermanent, it is established as suffering.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di rnams ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di rnams ni rtag pa'o //
translated: These twelve factors are permanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir @290b gnod pa'i bdag nyid can la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir @290b gnod pa'i bdag nyid can la /
translated: Since they are impermanent, they have the nature of harm.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Since they have the nature of harm, they are suffering.

original: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Thus this great mass of suffering alone arises.

original: gang zhig byas pa de mi rtag la /
analyzed: gang zhig byas pa de mi rtag la /
translated: Whatever is created is impermanent.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes ba'o ;
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes ba'o ;
translated: Whatever is impermanent is essentially non-arisen.

original: / gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de skye ba med pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: / gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de skye ba med pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Whatever is essentially non-arisen is non-arising.

original: sdug bsngal 'bras can de ma skyes //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'bras can de ma skyes //
translated: The result of suffering is not arisen.

original: zhes so // sdug bsngal 'bras bu'i phyir ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes so // sdug bsngal 'bras bu'i phyir ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the result of suffering is non-arisen.

original: su zhig skye ba med ce na /
analyzed: su zhig skye ba med ce na /
translated: Who is non-arising?

original: gsungs pa / rten 'byung yan lag bcu gnyis gang //üîΩzhes pa la ;
analyzed: gsungs pa / rten 'byung yan lag bcu gnyis gang // zhes pa la ;
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination.

original: rgyu'i yan lag kyang sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pas yongs su bzung bas stong pa nyid du so sor gnas par 'thad do //
analyzed: rgyu'i yan lag kyang sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pas yongs su bzung bas stong pa nyid du so sor gnas par 'thad do //
translated: The cause is also suffering, so it is non-arising. Therefore, it is tenable that it abides as emptiness, which is devoid of grasping.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag gang zhig sdug bsngal 'bras can yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa de yang skye ba med /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag gang zhig sdug bsngal 'bras can yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa de yang skye ba med /
translated: Because this is said to be the twelve links of dependent origination, which have suffering as their result. That is also non-arising.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad na /
translated: Because when analyzed,

original: sems gcig la yang ma yin zhing //
analyzed: sems gcig la yang ma yin zhing //
translated: it is not in a single mind,

original: du ma la yang de ma yin //
analyzed: du ma la yang de ma yin //
translated: Nor in many,

original: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag /'das pa'i srid pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag /'das pa'i srid pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang /
translated: because ignorance and formative factors are included in past existence, consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping,

original: srid pa'i yan lag rnams da ltar gyi srid pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / skye ba dang rga shi'i yan lag rnams ma 'ongs pa'i srid pas bsdus pa'i phyir sems gcig la mi skye la /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag rnams da ltar gyi srid pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / skye ba dang rga shi'i yan lag rnams ma 'ongs pa'i srid pas bsdus pa'i phyir sems gcig la mi skye la /
translated: and becoming are included in present existence, and the members of birth and old age and death are included in future existence.

original: du ma'i sems kyang dus gcig tu nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi skye'o //
analyzed: du ma'i sems kyang dus gcig tu nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi skye'o //
translated: Nor do they arise in many minds, because many minds do not occur simultaneously.

original: sems gcig la yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i srid pa rnams cig car du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems gcig la yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i srid pa rnams cig car du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they arise in a single mind, because past, future, and present existences do not occur simultaneously in a single mind.

original: sngar dang phyi ma'i yan lag dag sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du sems gcig la brten pa rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar dang phyi ma'i yan lag dag sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du sems gcig la brten pa rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is illogical for the prior and subsequent members to be simultaneous, like a seed and a sprout.

original: zhes bya la ;
analyzed: zhes bya la ;
translated: The first of these is as follows.üîΩ

original: du ma la yang de mi srid do //
analyzed: du ma la yang de mi srid do //
translated: And how could it be possible for many minds to exist simultaneously?

original: yang na 'di ltar sems te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar sems te /
translated: Or else, you might think as follows:

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sems blos gzung zhing /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sems blos gzung zhing /
translated: The mind apprehends the past and future minds,

original: da ltar ba ni yod bzhin pa'i phyir du ma'i sems la brten nas yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par 'jog go zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar ba ni yod bzhin pa'i phyir du ma'i sems la brten nas yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par 'jog go zhe na /
translated: and the present mind is based on many minds, and thus the twelve members of dependent origination are posited.

original: smras pa / @291a * //
analyzed: smras pa / @291a * //
translated: We reply:

original: gal te yang khyod kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems blos sgro btags par byas na /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems blos sgro btags par byas na /
translated: Even if you superimpose the past and future minds,

original: de lta na yang de dag gi rang gi ngo bo med pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rten nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag gi rang gi ngo bo med pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rten nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: since they do not have their own intrinsic reality, they are not suitable as the basis of dependent origination.

original: sems la ma brten par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sems la ma brten par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do //
translated: And without depending on the mind, it is not tenable to posit dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir sems du ma cig car du nye ba ma yin pas du ma'i sems la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems du ma cig car du nye ba ma yin pas du ma'i sems la mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since many minds do not occur simultaneously, it is not tenable that many minds exist.

original: gang zhig 'di snyam du yang sems na /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di snyam du yang sems na /
translated: If you think of this,

original: sems gcig la yang yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par 'jig ste /
analyzed: sems gcig la yang yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par 'jig ste /
translated: In a single thought, the twelve members are distinguished.

original: 'di lta ste rnyed pa'i dbang gis srog chags rnams srog gcod par byed pa na gang rmongs pa de ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnyed pa'i dbang gis srog chags rnams srog gcod par byed pa na gang rmongs pa de ma rig pa'o //
translated: When, under the influence of gain, people kill living beings, the delusion is ignorance.

original: gang sems pa de 'du byed do //
analyzed: gang sems pa de 'du byed do //
translated: The intention is the formative forces.

original: dngos po so sor ma rig pas rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i dbang las phung po rnams ni ming dang gzugs ming dang gzugs la rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug //
analyzed: dngos po so sor ma rig pas rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i dbang las phung po rnams ni ming dang gzugs ming dang gzugs la rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug //
translated: The aggregates, which arise simultaneously with consciousness, are name-and-form, because of the non-differentiation of the entities. The faculties, which are based on name-and-form, are the six sense-spheres.

original: skye mched drug las mngon bar grub pa ni reg pa /
analyzed: skye mched drug las mngon bar grub pa ni reg pa /
translated: The actualization of the six sense-spheres is contact.

original: reg pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba /
analyzed: reg pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba /
translated: The experience of contact is feeling.

original: gang chags pa de ni sred pa /
analyzed: gang chags pa de ni sred pa /
translated: That which is attached is craving.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun nas bkris ba ni len pa /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun nas bkris ba ni len pa /
translated: The defilement that is associated with that is grasping.

original: des kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las mi srid pa /
analyzed: des kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las mi srid pa /
translated: The karma that is projected by that is becoming.

original: chos de rnams kyi gsal bar snang ba ni skye ba /
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi gsal bar snang ba ni skye ba /
translated: The manifestation of those factors is birth.

original: yongs su smin pa ni rgas pa /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni rgas pa /
translated: Maturation is aging.

original: 'jig pa ni 'chi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'chi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction‚Äù is death.

original: 'di dag ming bsgrags pa tsam gsungs pa ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di dag ming bsgrags pa tsam gsungs pa ni bden te /
translated: It is true that the Lord has taught the mere names of these members.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa skad cig ma gcig la byas kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa skad cig ma gcig la byas kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin la /
translated: But he has not taught that ignorance, etc., are momentary entities, nor has he taught that they are related as cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdependent origination‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúcause and effect.‚Äù

original: de rnams lhan cig tu 'byung ba ma grub bo //
analyzed: de rnams lhan cig tu 'byung ba ma grub bo //
translated: But it is not established that these members occur simultaneously.

original: mar me dang 'od ba zhin du grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: mar me dang 'od ba zhin du grub bo zhe na /
translated: But it is established that they are like a lamp and its light.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not,

original: de la yang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the same problem arises in that case.

original: gang gi tshe sems gcig la yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba du ma mi srid pa de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med do zhes grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems gcig la yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba du ma mi srid pa de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med do zhes grub bo //
translated: Since it is not possible for many dependent originations to occur in a single mind, therefore it is established that dependent origination is not produced.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gal te yang sems gcig gam du ma rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di rnams mi srid na /
analyzed: gal te yang sems gcig gam du ma rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di rnams mi srid na /
translated: If it is not possible for these dependent originations to occur in a single mind or in many minds,

original: de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag brgyud ma rnams kyis rgyu brgyud ma nye bar gsungs la /
analyzed: de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag brgyud ma rnams kyis rgyu brgyud ma nye bar gsungs la /
translated: The Lord has taught the twelve members of dependent origination as the causal process.

original: @291b yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la rgyu brgyud mar nye bar ma bstan pas /
analyzed: @291b yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la rgyu brgyud mar nye bar ma bstan pas /
translated: He has not taught the causal process of a barren woman‚Äôs son, who does not exist.

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod do zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, dependent origination exists.

original: 'di ltar rga shi'i rgyu skye bar gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rga shi'i rgyu skye bar gsungs la /
translated: Thus, he has taught that the cause of aging and death is birth.

original: skye ba'i srid pa la ji srid du 'du byed rnams kyi ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa la ji srid du 'du byed rnams kyi ma rig pa'o //
translated: He has taught that the cause of the birth existence is the karmic predispositions in the store consciousness, and that the cause of the karmic predispositions is ignorance.

original: ma rig pa de yang glo bur ba nyid dgag pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa de yang glo bur ba nyid dgag pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: In order to refute the idea that ignorance is adventitious, the Lord has said:

original: dge slong dag ma rig pa yang rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas 'byung khungs dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rig pa yang rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas 'byung khungs dang bcas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, ignorance has a cause, it is not without a cause.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of ignorance should be said to be incorrect mental attention.‚Äù

original: de la gal te ma rig pa med na 'di'i rgyu nye bar ston par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te ma rig pa med na 'di'i rgyu nye bar ston par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If ignorance did not exist, its cause would not be revealed,

original: med pa'ang nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba'i rgyu nye bar mi ston la ma rig pa'i rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa nye bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: med pa'ang nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba'i rgyu nye bar mi ston la ma rig pa'i rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa nye bar bstan pas so //
translated: because a nonexistent cause does not reveal a nonexistent effect, as in the case of the garland of sky flowers.

original: de yang phyin ci log bzhi'i rang bzhin brtag pa bdag sdug pa bde ba'i dbye bas ma rig pa'i rgyu'i dngos por khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log bzhi'i rang bzhin brtag pa bdag sdug pa bde ba'i dbye bas ma rig pa'i rgyu'i dngos por khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the cause of ignorance should be understood as the four errors, which have the nature of the four misconceptions of self, purity, permanence, and happiness.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log bzhin las byung ba'i ma rig pa yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log bzhin las byung ba'i ma rig pa yod la /
translated: Therefore, ignorance arises from the four errors.

original: ji ltar ma rig pa phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba yod pa bzhin du 'di ltar ma rig pa las byung ba'i 'du byed kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba yod pa bzhin du 'di ltar ma rig pa las byung ba'i 'du byed kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as ignorance arises from the four errors, so also formations arise from ignorance.

original: ji srid du skye ba las byung ba'i rga shi'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du skye ba las byung ba'i rga shi'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And so on up to: just as birth arises from becoming, so also aging and death arise from birth.

original: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag srid pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag srid pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the link of dependent origination exists, dependent origination exists.

original: de la ma rig pa'i dbang du byas nas smos pa /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i dbang du byas nas smos pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said from the perspective of ignorance:

original: gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod na /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod na /
translated: If dependent origination exists,

original: de las byung ba ma rig pa yod la /
analyzed: de las byung ba ma rig pa yod la /
translated: then ignorance would arise from it.

original: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ma grub na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ma grub na /
translated: But when dependent origination itself is not established,

original: de'i tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa ma rig pa 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa ma rig pa 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could ignorance, which is a link of dependent origination, arise?

original: gzhan yang 'dir ma rig pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir ma rig pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung na /
translated: Moreover, if ignorance arises from improper mental activity,

original: phyin ci log las 'byung bar brjod par bya la /
analyzed: phyin ci log las 'byung bar brjod par bya la /
translated: it should be said to arise from error.

original: de las gal te phyin ci log yod na de'i tshe de las byung ba'i ma rig pa yang yod na /
analyzed: de las gal te phyin ci log yod na de'i tshe de las byung ba'i ma rig pa yang yod na /
translated: But if error exists, then ignorance that arises from it would also exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bsgrubs pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bsgrubs pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But it does not exist. To prove that, it is said:

original: mi rtag rtag min bdag med dang // bdag min sdug dang mi sdug min //
analyzed: mi rtag rtag min bdag med dang // bdag min sdug dang mi sdug min //
translated: not a self, not a non-self,

original: sdug bsngal bde ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bde ba ma yin zhing //
translated: not happy, not unhappy,üîΩand not pure, not impure.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log rnams med //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log rnams med //
translated: Therefore, there are no errors.üîΩIn this regard, the error of taking the impermanent to be permanent is an error.

original: @292a * // de la mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa phyin ci log / ci slar yang de mi rtag pa'i dngos po las phyin ci log pa rtag pa khong du chud pa med na /
analyzed: @292a * // de la mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa phyin ci log / ci slar yang de mi rtag pa'i dngos po las phyin ci log pa rtag pa khong du chud pa med na /
translated: But if one does not understand permanence, which is the opposite of the impermanent,

original: yang ji ltar mi rtag pa las phyin ci log rtag pa yin /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mi rtag pa las phyin ci log rtag pa yin /
translated: how can permanence be the opposite of the impermanent?

original: phyin ci log pas na phyin ci log ste log rtogs so //üîΩgang gi tshe mi rtag pa de rtag par mi 'gyur zhing mi rtag pa yang phyin ci log ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log pas na phyin ci log ste log rtogs so // gang gi tshe mi rtag pa de rtag par mi 'gyur zhing mi rtag pa yang phyin ci log ma yin no //
translated: It is an error because it is an error.üîΩWhen the impermanent is not permanent, the impermanent is not an error.

original: mi rtag pa'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa las phyin ci log rtag pa nyid du thob nas phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa las phyin ci log rtag pa nyid du thob nas phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The impermanent does not become an error by attaining permanence, which is the opposite of the impermanent.

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid kyi dngos po de gang gi tshe ji ltar gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid du logs su bzhag nas rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid kyi dngos po de gang gi tshe ji ltar gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid du logs su bzhag nas rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when that impermanent thing is posited as permanent, having been set aside from the impermanence that it is,

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas phyin ci log ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas phyin ci log ces bya'o //
translated: then it is said to be a mistaken apprehension, because it is a mistaken conception.

original: slar yang ci zhig phyin ci log 'dis phyin ci log tu 'dzin /
analyzed: slar yang ci zhig phyin ci log 'dis phyin ci log tu 'dzin /
translated: Again, what is it that this mistaken conception mistakes?

original: smras pa / rtag par ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rtag par ro //
translated: He says: permanence.

original: slar yang de'i tshe ji ltar 'dis rtag par 'dzin /
analyzed: slar yang de'i tshe ji ltar 'dis rtag par 'dzin /
translated: Again, how does it mistake that at that time?

original: rnam par shes pa de'i rnam par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i rnam par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates a consciousness of that.

original: gal te de lta na 'di ltar de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di ltar de'i tshe /
translated: If that is so, then at that time,

original: de'i rnam par shes pa de mi rtag pa'i dngos po la ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa de mi rtag pa'i dngos po la ma yin te /
translated: that consciousness does not have an impermanent thing as its object,

original: de de'i rnam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i rnam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise in the aspect of that.

original: des na rnam par shes pa de yang mi rtag pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa de yang mi rtag pa la ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, that consciousness does not have an impermanent thing as its object,

original: yod pa la rtag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pas /
analyzed: yod pa la rtag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pas /
translated: because it apprehends an existent thing as permanent.üîΩHow is the apprehension of permanence a mistaken conception?

original: rtag par 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log / smras pa ;
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log / smras pa ;
translated: He says:

original: dngos po mi rtag par gnas pa la rtag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pas phyin ci log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag par gnas pa la rtag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pas phyin ci log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúerroneous‚Äù because it apprehends a thing that is impermanent as permanent.

original: slar yang dngos po mi rtag pa'i rnam par gnas so zhes de ji ltar de ltar rtogs /üîΩgang la gang las gang gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa des na /
analyzed: slar yang dngos po mi rtag pa'i rnam par gnas so zhes de ji ltar de ltar rtogs / gang la gang las gang gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa des na /
translated: But how can you conceive that a thing that is impermanent by nature is permanent?

original: rnam par shes pa la grags pa'i rnam pa de las dngos po rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la grags pa'i rnam pa de las dngos po rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: The thing is posited as having the aspect of that consciousness which is generated from it.

original: sngon po dang ser po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said to be blue or yellow.

original: rtag pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gzhan gyi rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gzhan gyi rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But the consciousness of permanence does not have the aspect of another.

original: de'i tshe mi rtag pa'i rnam pa na de'i rnam par shes pas dngos po gang zhig 'dzin par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi rtag pa'i rnam pa na de'i rnam par shes pas dngos po gang zhig 'dzin par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can the consciousness of impermanence apprehend a thing at that time?

original: gzhan zhig la de'i mi rtag pa byas nas dngos po mi rtag go zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan zhig la de'i mi rtag pa byas nas dngos po mi rtag go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the thing is impermanent because it is made impermanent by another,

original: 'di ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de nyid de'i tshe de'i mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid de'i tshe de'i mi rtag pa'o //
translated: It is not impermanent because of another.

original: gzhan zhig na de'i rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa'i phyir mi snang ba nyid la /
analyzed: gzhan zhig na de'i rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa'i phyir mi snang ba nyid la /
translated: But it is not tenable to say that it is the aspect of that, because it does not appear due to the non-arising of consciousness of that.

original: de ni de'i rnam pa'o zhes 'thad pa ma yin la phyin ci log la 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i rnam pa'o zhes 'thad pa ma yin la phyin ci log la 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be the apprehension of the opposite.

original: de'i phyir @292b rtag pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir @292b rtag pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the aspect of permanence is not the opposite.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes byas nas phyin ci log nyid med de /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes byas nas phyin ci log nyid med de /
translated: It is not the opposite by saying ‚Äúpermanent and impermanent.‚Äù

original: de ltar nam yang bdag med pa dang bdag la min zhing /
analyzed: de ltar nam yang bdag med pa dang bdag la min zhing /
translated: It is not the opposite of selflessness and self,

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la yang ma yin la /
translated: nor is it the opposite of the pleasant and unpleasant,üîΩnor is it the opposite of happiness and suffering.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la yang min no zhes rgyas par bshad par bya'o //üîΩdes na de ltar phyin ci log med la gang gi tshe phyin ci log mi srid pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la yang min no zhes rgyas par bshad par bya'o // des na de ltar phyin ci log med la gang gi tshe phyin ci log mi srid pa de'i tshe /
translated: This should be explained in detail.üîΩThus, when there is no opposite, the four opposites are impossible.

original: de med phyin ci log bzhi las //
analyzed: de med phyin ci log bzhi las //
translated: When the four opposites are impossible,

original: skyes pa'i ma rig mi srid la //
analyzed: skyes pa'i ma rig mi srid la //
translated: ignorance that arises from them is impossible.

original: de med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing //
analyzed: de med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing //
translated: When that does not exist, formations do not occur,

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: and the same applies to the rest.

original: de la gang zhig smos pa'i yan lag brgyud ma rnams kyis rgyu brgyud mar bstan pa yod pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod do zhes pa tshul 'dis 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang zhig smos pa'i yan lag brgyud ma rnams kyis rgyu brgyud mar bstan pa yod pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod do zhes pa tshul 'dis 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable to say that dependent origination exists because of the existence of the causal process indicated by the members that are mentioned.

original: gang zhig phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba ma rig pa nyid la phyin ci log med na med do zhes bstan la /
analyzed: gang zhig phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba ma rig pa nyid la phyin ci log med na med do zhes bstan la /
translated: It is taught that ignorance itself, which arises from the four errors, does not exist if the errors do not exist.

original: de nyid kyis 'du byed la sogs pa'i yan lag dgag pa grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'du byed la sogs pa'i yan lag dgag pa grub bo //
translated: This also establishes the refutation of the members of the chain of dependent origination, such as the karmic predispositions.

original: gang du ma rig pa med par 'du byed rnams mi 'byung la de bzhin du rnam par shes pa med pas ming dang gzugs bkag pa ste /
analyzed: gang du ma rig pa med par 'du byed rnams mi 'byung la de bzhin du rnam par shes pa med pas ming dang gzugs bkag pa ste /
translated: Where ignorance does not exist, the karmic predispositions do not occur. Similarly, name and form are refuted because consciousness does not exist.

original: ji srid du skye ba med pas rga shi med do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid du skye ba med pas rga shi med do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to the point where, since there is no birth, there is no aging and death.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med na /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med na /
translated: Thus, if dependent origination does not exist,

original: de dag gis rgyu brgyud mar bstan pa las /
analyzed: de dag gis rgyu brgyud mar bstan pa las /
translated: the causal process indicated by the members that are mentioned does not exist.

original: de'i yan lag brgyud ma ga la zhig des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med do zhes grub bo //
analyzed: de'i yan lag brgyud ma ga la zhig des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med do zhes grub bo //
translated: How could it have any parts? Therefore, it is established that dependent origination is not produced.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gal te na yang phyin ci log las byung ba'i ma rig pa phyin ci log med pas med do zhes smras na /
analyzed: gal te na yang phyin ci log las byung ba'i ma rig pa phyin ci log med pas med do zhes smras na /
translated: Even though you say that ignorance, which arises from error, does not exist because error does not exist,

original: de lta na yang 'dir re zhig kho nar 'di dag med do zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dir re zhig kho nar 'di dag med do zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: still, you cannot establish that these do not exist.

original: 'du byed skyed pas na de'i rgyu'i dngos por bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed rnams kyang ma rig pa'i 'bras bur bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed skyed pas na de'i rgyu'i dngos por bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed rnams kyang ma rig pa'i 'bras bur bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is taught that ignorance is the cause of the formative forces, and it is taught that the formative forces are the effect of ignorance.
