original: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /üîΩma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i gang zag 'di dag ni bsod nams kyi 'du byed kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa / ma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i gang zag 'di dag ni bsod nams kyi 'du byed kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said:üîΩThese persons who are governed by ignorance form meritorious,

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyang mngon bar 'du byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyang mngon bar 'du byed do //
translated: nonmeritorious, and unshakable actions.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed kyang mngon bar 'du byed do zhes so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed kyang mngon bar 'du byed do zhes so //
translated: One also manifestly forms non-revealing karma.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag yod la /
translated: Therefore, ignorance and formations exist.

original: de yod na gzhan rten cing 'brel @293a * //
analyzed: de yod na gzhan rten cing 'brel @293a * //
translated: If they exist, the other members of dependent origination are established.

original: par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams grub pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis grub bo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams grub pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis grub bo zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, it is said that the twelve members of dependent origination are established.

original: gal te ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gi rang bzhin grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gi rang bzhin grub par gyur na /
translated: If the nature of ignorance and formations were established,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis yod la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis yod la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: the twelve members of dependent origination would exist, but they do not exist.

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to establish that they do not exist, it is said:

original: ma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
analyzed: ma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
translated: Ignorance and formations do not occur without it.

original: de med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing //
analyzed: de med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing //
translated: Without it, formations do not occur.

original: de dag phan tshun rgyu can te //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun rgyu can te //
translated: They are mutually causal.

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang ma grub bo //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang ma grub bo //
translated: They are also not established by nature.

original: gal te ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi rgyur rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di ltar 'du byed med pa'i phyir de med la rgyu gang zhig rgyu nyid du 'bras bu dang 'brel pa byas pa las yin gyi 'brel pa med na rgyu nyid nam yang ma yinüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi rgyur rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di ltar 'du byed med pa'i phyir de med la rgyu gang zhig rgyu nyid du 'bras bu dang 'brel pa byas pa las yin gyi 'brel pa med na rgyu nyid nam yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If ignorance is posited as the cause of formation, then since formation does not exist, it does not exist. A cause is a cause only in relation to an effect. If it is not related to an effect, it is never a cause.

original: yang na 'bras bu nye bar ma bzung bar 'ga' zhig rgyu nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu nye bar ma bzung bar 'ga' zhig rgyu nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Or, if something were a cause without grasping an effect,

original: de lta na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rgyur mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rgyur mi 'gyur la /
translated: then something would not be a cause of something.üîΩTherefore, if an effect does not exist, the positing of a cause does not exist.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i rnam par gzhag pa 'bras bu med na ma yin la rgyu yang ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i rnam par gzhag pa 'bras bu med na ma yin la rgyu yang ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Ignorance is the cause of formation.

original: ma rig pa ni 'du byed med na rgyur mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'du byed med na rgyur mi 'gyur la /
translated: If formation does not exist, ignorance would not be a cause.

original: rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because this is the context of the relationship between cause and effect,

original: rgyu'i sgra med kyang rgyu nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu rgyu'i sgras ma gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra med kyang rgyu nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu rgyu'i sgras ma gsungs so //
translated: even though the term cause does not exist, it is understood to be a cause. Therefore the effect is not stated by the term cause.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu la ma ltos par 'ga' zhig rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa 'du byed med na mi 'byung ba bzhin 'bras bu yang rgyu la ma ltos na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu la ma ltos par 'ga' zhig rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa 'du byed med na mi 'byung ba bzhin 'bras bu yang rgyu la ma ltos na /
translated: Likewise, without depending on the cause, the effect is impossible,

original: rgyu med pa las mi srid do zhes bya ba ni /üîΩde med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las mi srid do zhes bya ba ni / de med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing /
translated: because it would be uncaused.

original: ma rig pa med na 'du byed mi 'thad de rgyu med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa med na 'du byed mi 'thad de rgyu med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If ignorance did not exist, formations would not be tenable, because it would follow that they would be uncaused.

original: gang yang 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ma ltos par grub pa med la /
analyzed: gang yang 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ma ltos par grub pa med la /
translated: Moreover, causes and effects do not exist without depending on each other.

original: de'i phyir de dag phan tshun rgyu can dang / ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag phan tshun rgyu can dang / ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, they are not established as having a nature of mutual possession, nor do they exist inherently.

original: pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin nam ring po dang thung du bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin nam ring po dang thung du bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med do //
translated: Like the far and near, or the long and short, causes and effects do not exist inherently because they are mutually dependent.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ngo bo nyid kyis grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ngo bo nyid kyis grub par gyur na /
translated: If causes and effects were established inherently,

original: de ni 'bras bu la mi ltos par rgyur 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu la mi ltos par rgyur 'gyur na /
translated: If it were a cause without depending on an effect,

original: de las kyang rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las kyang rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be a cause without a cause.

original: rgyu ni gang las @293b 'bras bu'i 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid pas rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni gang las @293b 'bras bu'i 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid pas rgyu'o //
translated: A cause is a cause because it is the cause of the occurrence of an effect.

original: de med na rgyu med pa nyid rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na rgyu med pa nyid rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: If that did not exist, then a cause without a cause would be a cause.

original: rgyu med pa nyid rgyur 'thad pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bas /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid rgyur 'thad pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bas /
translated: But it is not tenable that a cause without a cause is a cause.

original: des na nges par 'bras bu la ltos la /
analyzed: des na nges par 'bras bu la ltos la /
translated: Therefore, it definitely depends on an effect.

original: 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir rang nyid ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir rang nyid ma grub bo //
translated: Because it depends on an effect, it is not established on its own.

original: de bzhin du gal te 'bras bu ngo bos grub par gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te 'bras bu ngo bos grub par gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if an effect were to exist essentially,

original: de ni rgyu la mi ltos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni rgyu la mi ltos par 'gyur la /
translated: then it would not depend on a cause.

original: de yang rgyu la mi ltos na /
analyzed: de yang rgyu la mi ltos na /
translated: Moreover, if it did not depend on a cause,

original: de ni nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu la ltos /
analyzed: de ni nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu la ltos /
translated: then it would be like a sky flower. Therefore, it depends on a cause.

original: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ma grub bo zhes gnas so //
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ma grub bo zhes gnas so //
translated: Because it depends on a cause, it is not established on its own.

original: de ni 'di ltar ji skad du gsungs pa'i rigs pas ;
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar ji skad du gsungs pa'i rigs pas ;
translated: This is so because of the reasoning that has been presented.üîΩAs it has been said:

original: gang zhig rang nyid rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gang zhig rang nyid rang bzhin gyis //
translated: That which is itself essentially

original: ma grub des gzhan ji ltar bskyed //
analyzed: ma grub des gzhan ji ltar bskyed //
translated: How could that which is not established establish another?

original: de'i phyir gzhan las grub pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan las grub pa yi //
translated: Therefore, conditions that are established from another

original: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
translated: Do not produce other things.

original: gang yang de'i tshe 'bras bu la ma ltos par rang gi ngo bo mi 'grub la /
analyzed: gang yang de'i tshe 'bras bu la ma ltos par rang gi ngo bo mi 'grub la /
translated: Moreover, at that time, without depending on the effect, its nature is not established.

original: de ji ltar rang nyid grub pa med par 'bras bu skyed par byed /
analyzed: de ji ltar rang nyid grub pa med par 'bras bu skyed par byed /
translated: How could that which is not established by itself produce an effect?

original: gal te skyed na mo gsham gyi bu mo yang bu skyed par 'gyur la /üîΩde'i phyir gzhan las grub pa yi //
analyzed: gal te skyed na mo gsham gyi bu mo yang bu skyed par 'gyur la / de'i phyir gzhan las grub pa yi //
translated: If it did, then the daughter of a barren woman would also produce a son.üîΩTherefore, conditions that are established from another

original: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
translated: Do not produce other things.

original: rang las tha dad pa gzhan du gyur pa ni 'bras bu la de la ltos nas grub pa'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis rang las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu 'du byed la sogs pa'i skyed byed ma yin no //
analyzed: rang las tha dad pa gzhan du gyur pa ni 'bras bu la de la ltos nas grub pa'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis rang las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu 'du byed la sogs pa'i skyed byed ma yin no //
translated: That which is different from itself, that is, other, is not the producer of an effect that is different from itself, such as ignorance that is established in dependence on that.

original: phan tshun mi ltos par grub par yod par gyur na /
analyzed: phan tshun mi ltos par grub par yod par gyur na /
translated: If they existed as established without mutual dependence,

original: rgyu las gzhan pa 'bras bu las gzhan pa rgyu'i zhes 'thad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu las gzhan pa 'bras bu las gzhan pa rgyu'i zhes 'thad par 'gyur la /
translated: then it would be tenable to say that that which is different from the cause is the cause of that which is different from the effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ma ltos par grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ma ltos par grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has been established that cause and effect are not established in mutual dependence.

original: des na ma rig pa las 'du byed rnams gzhan nyid du ma grub pas 'du byed rnams la ma ltos par ma rig pa gzhan nyid du grub par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na ma rig pa las 'du byed rnams gzhan nyid du ma grub pas 'du byed rnams la ma ltos par ma rig pa gzhan nyid du grub par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since formations are not established as other than ignorance, it cannot be said that ignorance is established as other than formations.

original: de ltar 'du byed la sogs pa las ma rig pa la sogs pa gzhan nyid du ma grub na /
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed la sogs pa las ma rig pa la sogs pa gzhan nyid du ma grub na /
translated: Thus, if ignorance is not established as other than formations and so on,

original: ma rig pa la brten nas byung ba'i 'du byed rnams gzhan nyid du grub bo zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: ma rig pa la brten nas byung ba'i 'du byed rnams gzhan nyid du grub bo zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: it cannot be posited that formations and so on arise in dependence on ignorance.

original: gang zhig de ltar /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúSince it is said,

original: de'i phyir gzhan las grub pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan las grub pa yi //
translated: ‚ÄòTherefore, that which is established as other

original: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
translated: Is not a condition that generates it,‚Äô

original: des na 'dir ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed la /
analyzed: des na 'dir ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed la /
translated: here, in dependence on ignorance, formations arise.

original: 'du byed la @294a * //
analyzed: 'du byed la @294a * //
translated: In dependence on formations,

original: ltos nas ma rig pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag pas re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig nyid ma yin no zhes smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos nas ma rig pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag pas re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig nyid ma yin no zhes smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is posited as ignorance in dependence, it is said that cause and effect are not identical.

original: de nyid kyis de nyid skyed pa med do zhes byas nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de nyid skyed pa med do zhes byas nas /
translated: Since it is not produced by itself,

original: phan tshun ltos pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag grub par gyur la /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag grub par gyur la /
translated: cause and effect are established through mutual dependence.

original: phan tshun ltos pas rang gi ngo bo grub pa med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pas rang gi ngo bo grub pa med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are not established by their own nature through mutual dependence, it is said that cause and effect are not different.

original: de nyid kyis na gcig pa dang gzhan pa dag med pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar smra ba dang bral ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba grub pa yongs su skye'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gcig pa dang gzhan pa dag med pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar smra ba dang bral ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba grub pa yongs su skye'o //
translated: Since they are neither identical nor different, the middle way free from the extremes of eternalism and nihilism is established.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: brten nas byung ba gang dang gang //
analyzed: brten nas byung ba gang dang gang //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence

original: re zhig de nyid des mi bskyed //
analyzed: re zhig de nyid des mi bskyed //
translated: is not produced by that itself.

original: gzhan las kyang min de yi phyir //üîΩrtag min chad pa yang ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang min de yi phyir // rtag min chad pa yang ma yin //
translated: Nor is it produced from another.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore it is neither eternal nor annihilated.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin med par yang shin tu gsal bar khong du chud par byas par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin med par yang shin tu gsal bar khong du chud par byas par 'gyur ro ;
translated: One will also come to understand very clearly that dependent origination is essenceless.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: gcig nyid gzhan nyid dang bral ba //
analyzed: gcig nyid gzhan nyid dang bral ba //
translated: Free from identity and difference,

original: 'gro ba sgra brnyan lta bu ste //üîΩ'pho dang 'jig pa bral ba yi //üîΩrtogs ldan khyod la mi smod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgra brnyan lta bu ste // 'pho dang 'jig pa bral ba yi // rtogs ldan khyod la mi smod do //
translated: The world is like an echo.üîΩYou who are endowed with realization, I do not criticize you,

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩgal te yang de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ltos pa can du grub par rnam par bzhag la ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // gal te yang de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ltos pa can du grub par rnam par bzhag la ;
translated: For you are free from transmigration and destruction.üîΩEven though cause and effect are presented as mutually dependent,üîΩone might still ask, ‚ÄúEven if they are established as mutually dependent, like a son and his mother, they would still exist.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang phan tshun ltos pa can du grub pas de dag kyang bu dang pa bzhin du grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang phan tshun ltos pa can du grub pas de dag kyang bu dang pa bzhin du grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The response to that is:

original: gsungs pa / pha ni bu min bu pha min //üîΩde dag phan tshun med min zhing //
analyzed: gsungs pa / pha ni bu min bu pha min // de dag phan tshun med min zhing //
translated: The father is not the son, the son is not the father.üîΩThey do not exist without each other,

original: de gnyis cig car yang med ltar //
analyzed: de gnyis cig car yang med ltar //
translated: And neither exists at the same time.

original: de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis so //üîΩpha nyid bu ma yin te ;
analyzed: de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis so // pha nyid bu ma yin te ;
translated: So it is with the twelve factors.üîΩThe father himself is not the son.

original: pha zhes bya ba skyed byed la /
analyzed: pha zhes bya ba skyed byed la /
translated: The father is the one who gives birth.

original: de ji ltar bskyed byar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar bskyed byar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be the producer?

original: bu yang pha min te /
analyzed: bu yang pha min te /
translated: And the son is not the father.

original: bu ni bskyed bya la /
analyzed: bu ni bskyed bya la /
translated: The son is what is produced.

original: de ji ltar skyed byed du 'gyur //
analyzed: de ji ltar skyed byed du 'gyur //
translated: How could it be the producer?

original: de ltar re zhig pha nyid bu ma yin la bu nyid pha ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig pha nyid bu ma yin la bu nyid pha ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the father is not the son, and the son is not the father.

original: tha mi dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de gnyis phan tshun med pa min te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de gnyis phan tshun med pa min te /
translated: But they are not mutually absent, because they are not different.

original: bu med na pha 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bu med na pha 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: If the son does not exist, the father is not tenable.

original: skyed par byed pa'i las kyis pha nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir /üîΩbu med na ci zhig skyed par byed pas pha nyid du 'gyur /üîΩpha yang bu med na mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i las kyis pha nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir / bu med na ci zhig skyed par byed pas pha nyid du 'gyur / pha yang bu med na mi 'grub pas /
translated: Because the father is tenable by the action of producing the son.üîΩIf the son does not exist, what is produced? By what is the father tenable?

original: pha med na bu yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bas /üîΩde gnyis phan tshun med min zhing //
analyzed: pha med na bu yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bas / de gnyis phan tshun med min zhing //
translated: And if the father does not exist, the son is not tenable.üîΩThus, they are not mutually absent.

original: de gnyis cig car yang @294b med ltar te /
analyzed: de gnyis cig car yang @294b med ltar te /
translated: And they are not simultaneous.

original: de gnyis cig car na ba lang gi rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa bzhin pas bskyed bya skyed byed med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis cig car na ba lang gi rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa bzhin pas bskyed bya skyed byed med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were simultaneous, like the right and left horns of a cow, there would be no producer and no produced.

original: ji ltar pha dang bu dag ma grub pa de bzhin du yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang ma grub ste /üîΩma rig pa nyid 'du byed ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar pha dang bu dag ma grub pa de bzhin du yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang ma grub ste / ma rig pa nyid 'du byed ma yin la /
translated: Just as father and son are not established, so too the twelve factors of dependent origination are not established.üîΩIgnorance itself is not conditioning factors.

original: 'du byed nyid ma rig pa ma yin zhing /üîΩde gnyis phan tshun med min zhing /
analyzed: 'du byed nyid ma rig pa ma yin zhing / de gnyis phan tshun med min zhing /
translated: Conditioning factors themselves are not ignorance.üîΩThose two are not mutually absent.

original: de gnyis cig car yang ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis cig car yang ma yin //
translated: Those two are not simultaneous.

original: zhes bya bas thams cad la mtshungs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas thams cad la mtshungs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that all should be applied in the same way.

original: gal te ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rang gi ngo bo ma grub na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rang gi ngo bo ma grub na /
translated: If ignorance and conditioning factors are not established by their own nature,

original: de ni ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed rnams skye ba mi 'thad de /üîΩmed bzhin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la brten nas /
analyzed: de ni ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed rnams skye ba mi 'thad de / med bzhin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la brten nas /
translated: it is untenable that conditioning factors arise in dependence on ignorance.üîΩIt is said that like a barren woman‚Äôs son,

original: de'i bu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i bu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: who does not exist, the arising of her son does not occur in dependence on her.

original: gal te ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rang gi ngo bo grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rang gi ngo bo grub par gyur na /
translated: If ignorance and conditioning factors were established by their own nature,

original: de ni 'di dag da lta ba bzhin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di dag da lta ba bzhin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they would not be dependently arisen, just as they are now.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la yang brten nas 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la yang brten nas 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
translated: It does not arise in dependence on the son of a barren woman.

original: ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that in dependence on ignorance, formations arise.

original: des na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the son of a barren woman, it is not the meaning of dependent arising.

original: 'o na gnyi ga yang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mnyam la /
analyzed: 'o na gnyi ga yang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mnyam la /
translated: Now, both are the same in not being essentially arisen.

original: de lta na yang phyin ci log la ltos nas ma rig pa la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba yod la /
analyzed: de lta na yang phyin ci log la ltos nas ma rig pa la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba yod la /
translated: Nevertheless, in dependence on ignorance and so on, there is arising in the context of error.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la phyin ci log la yang de la brten nas skye bar mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la phyin ci log la yang de la brten nas skye bar mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in the case of the son of a barren woman, one does not conceive of arising in the context of error.

original: yang ci'i phyir gnyi ga yang mtshungs par rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa la gcig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mthong la cig shos ni ma yin 'di ni 'jig rten pa kho na la dri bar bya'i /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gnyi ga yang mtshungs par rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa la gcig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mthong la cig shos ni ma yin 'di ni 'jig rten pa kho na la dri bar bya'i /
translated: Why is it that, although both are the same in not being essentially arisen, one is seen to be dependently arisen and the other is not? This should be asked of the world itself.

original: kho bo la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo la ni ma yin no //
translated: It should not be asked of me.

original: de nyid kyis na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'jig rten gyi phyin ci log las so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'jig rten gyi phyin ci log las so //
translated: Therefore, dependent origination is from the world‚Äôs error.

original: gang dag rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mnyam pa kha cig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mthong la cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mnyam pa kha cig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mthong la cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who are equal in not being inherently produced see dependent origination, but others do not.

original: rigs pas ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du chos thams cad yongs su ma brtags la /
analyzed: rigs pas ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du chos thams cad yongs su ma brtags la /
translated: By reasoning, all phenomena are not examined like the son of a barren woman.

original: cung zad rtog par byed pas na /
analyzed: cung zad rtog par byed pas na /
translated: Since they are examined a little,

original: phyin ci log tu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: they are posited as erroneous.

original: 'di ltar rab @295a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab @295a * //
translated: Thus,

original: rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skra la yongs su rtog pa mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skra la yongs su rtog pa mi 'thad pas /
translated: since it is not tenable that those with cataracts examine real hair,

original: ji ltar rab rib med pa rnams kyis brtags pa las phyin ci log tu mthong ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib med pa rnams kyis brtags pa las phyin ci log tu mthong ba zhes brjod do //
translated: it is said that those without cataracts see correctly, in contrast to those with cataracts.

original: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sman pa chen po ltar rang bzhin med pa skye bo rnams la ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sman pa chen po ltar rang bzhin med pa skye bo rnams la ston par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the Lord Buddha, like a great physician, teaches people who do not understand that things lack intrinsic nature.

original: gang zhig de'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pa la don du rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid las bzlog par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pa la don du rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid las bzlog par mdzad do //
translated: He turns them away from the mistaken characteristics of conceptual thought, which conceives of the existence of an object that does not exist as its cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa las yongs su bzlog nas yang chos rnams kyi chos nyid ji lta ba de lta bu la gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las yongs su bzlog nas yang chos rnams kyi chos nyid ji lta ba de lta bu la gnas so //
translated: Having turned them away from conceptual thought, he then causes them to abide in the suchness of phenomena just as it is.

original: de la gnas nas yang dag pa ma yin par sgro mi 'dogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la rnam par grol ba zhes brjod do /üîΩ// /'di ltar de phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gnas nas yang dag pa ma yin par sgro mi 'dogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la rnam par grol ba zhes brjod do / // /'di ltar de phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Having caused them to abide in that, he causes them to attain nirvana, which is called ‚Äúliberation‚Äù because it is the non-superimposition of the unreal.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gi rang bzhin med la /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gi rang bzhin med la /
translated: Because of this, ignorance and formations do not exist.üîΩIf these two do not exist, then consciousness and the rest will not arise.üîΩIf they do not arise, then the world will be empty.

original: gal te de ltar 'di gnyis rang bzhin med la rang bzhin med pa dag yod na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'di gnyis rang bzhin med la rang bzhin med pa dag yod na /
translated: If the world is empty, then the world will not arise and will not cease.

original: ji ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung //üîΩji ltar 'di dag rang bzhin med pa dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de ltar slob dpon gyis dpes gsal bar mdzad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung //üîΩji ltar 'di dag rang bzhin med pa dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de ltar slob dpon gyis dpes gsal bar mdzad pas gsungs pa /
translated: If the world does not arise and does not cease, then what purpose will the noble path serve?üîΩIf the noble path does not exist, then who will attain nirvana?üîΩIf nirvana does not exist, then who will attain it?üîΩIf the world is empty, then the world will not arise and will not cease.üîΩIf the world does not arise and does not cease, then what purpose will the noble path serve?üîΩIf the noble path does not exist, then who will attain nirvana?üîΩIf nirvana does not exist, then who will attain it?üîΩIf the world is empty, then the world will not arise and will not cease.üîΩIf the world does not arise and does not cease, then what purpose will the noble path serve?üîΩIf the noble path does not exist, then who will attain nirvana?üîΩIf nirvana does not exist, then who will attain it?üîΩIf the world is empty, then the world will not arise and will not cease.üîΩIf the world does not arise and does not cease, then what purpose will the noble path serve?üîΩIf the noble path does not exist, then who will attain nirvana?üîΩIf nirvana does not exist, then who will attain it?

original: ji ltar rmi lam yul brten pa'i //üîΩbde sdug med bzhin de yul yang//
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam yul brten pa'i // bde sdug med bzhin de yul yang//
translated: Just as in a dream, there is no pleasure or painüîΩthat is based on objects,

original: brten nas gang skyes med de bzhin //
analyzed: brten nas gang skyes med de bzhin //
translated: so too, whatever arises in dependence on objects

original: brten pa nyid kyis de yod min //
analyzed: brten pa nyid kyis de yod min //
translated: does not exist through its own nature.

original: ji ltar gang kho na las rmi lam du nyams su myong bzhin pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag rmi lam du dngos po nye bar thob pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa de skyed pa'i rjes su mthun pa las brten nas byung ngo zhes rmi lam nyidüîΩdu rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: ji ltar gang kho na las rmi lam du nyams su myong bzhin pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag rmi lam du dngos po nye bar thob pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa de skyed pa'i rjes su mthun pa las brten nas byung ngo zhes rmi lam nyid du rnam par 'jog la /
translated: Just as in a dream, when one experiences pleasure and pain, one posits the dream on the basis of the objects of the dream, such as forms and sounds, which are concordant with the arising of pleasure and pain.

original: de las skyes pa la rang bzhin yang med la rmi lam yang sad pa na de bzhin du nyams su myong ba bden pa nyid du mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa la rang bzhin yang med la rmi lam yang sad pa na de bzhin du nyams su myong ba bden pa nyid du mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But those objects that arise in the dream do not exist through their own nature, and when one awakens, one does not conceive of the experience of the dream as real.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin te /
translated: Not only pleasure and pain are essenceless.

original: rmi lam gyi yul yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi yul yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung la /
translated: The objects of the dream arise in dependence on the dream itself.

original: yul de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: yul de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: And that object is also without intrinsic nature because it is dependently arisen.

original: ji ltar rmi lam gyi yul dang de la brten nas gang zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal nye bar skye ba de dang de ni gnyi ga brdzun la /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam gyi yul dang de la brten nas gang zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal nye bar skye ba de dang de ni gnyi ga brdzun la /
translated: Just as in a dream, the object and the pleasure or pain that arises in dependence on it are both false.

original: de bzhin du sad pa na yang ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu @295b gang las 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'bras bu skye ba dag med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa na yang ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu @295b gang las 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'bras bu skye ba dag med de /
translated: In the same way, when one is awake, the effect called ‚Äúformations‚Äù does not arise from a cause called ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: rmi lam nye bar thob pa'i yul bzhin du de'i rgyu ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam nye bar thob pa'i yul bzhin du de'i rgyu ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, like an object obtained in a dream, its cause is called ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: gang dang de gnyis rtag tu mngon par 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dang de gnyis rtag tu mngon par 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: Because those two are always connected.

original: gang gi sgra yin de'i sgra nye bar 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi sgra yin de'i sgra nye bar 'jog par byed de /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the word ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: de ltar yang rmi lam du nye bar thob pa'i dpes rgyu ma rig pa zhes bya ba med la /
analyzed: de ltar yang rmi lam du nye bar thob pa'i dpes rgyu ma rig pa zhes bya ba med la /
translated: Thus, like an object obtained in a dream, the cause is called ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dpes gang de'i 'bras bu 'du byed ces bya ba de nyid kyang ma rig pa zhes bya ba rgyu yod pa ma yin pa la brten nas skye bas de yang de bzhin du
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dpes gang de'i 'bras bu 'du byed ces bya ba de nyid kyang ma rig pa zhes bya ba rgyu yod pa ma yin pa la brten nas skye bas de yang de bzhin du
translated: Likewise, the example of the pleasure and pain experienced in a dream is related to the statement that the effect of that, called ‚Äúembodiment,‚Äù also arises in dependence on a cause called ‚Äúignorance,‚Äù which does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di dang 'brel to //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di dang 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, that also does not exist in reality.

original: de 'di ltar rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin /
analyzed: de 'di ltar rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin /
translated: Just as the dependent origination of the pleasure and pain experienced in a dream

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yul yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin pas ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag phyin ci ma log par grub pa med do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yul yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin pas ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag phyin ci ma log par grub pa med do zhes gnas so //
translated: is not the cause of pleasure and pain, the cause of pleasure and pain, objects, also arise dependently. Therefore ignorance and formation are not established without error.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: rmi lam gyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnam shes las /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnam shes las /
translated: The objects of form, sound, and so on in a dream are not established as existing by way of their own nature.

original: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin stobs can du yod bzhin pa yin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med la bde ba dang sdug bsngal bdag nyams su myong bzhin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dag rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i phyir
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin stobs can du yod bzhin pa yin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med la bde ba dang sdug bsngal bdag nyams su myong bzhin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dag rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i phyir
translated: Since external reality exists as a powerful entity, dependent origination does not exist. Since the intrinsic identity of the experience of pleasure and pain exists as dependent origination,

original: / ji skad du gsungs pa'i rigs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin med pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: / ji skad du gsungs pa'i rigs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin med pa mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable that dependent origination does not exist as it is described by reasoning.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub pa la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub pa la /
translated: Since the intrinsic identity of cause and effect is not established,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du grub pa las so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du grub pa las so zhes bya ste /
translated: dependent origination does not exist and dependent origination is established by intrinsic identity.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du sgrub pa na rmi lam gyi dpe 'thad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du sgrub pa na rmi lam gyi dpe 'thad de /
translated: When establishing mere consciousness, the example of a dream is tenable.

original: rmi lam na rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i yul med la /
analyzed: rmi lam na rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i yul med la /
translated: In a dream there is no object that is different from consciousness.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And mere awareness exists.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang 'di skad du smras te rnam par shes pa las phyi rol gyi rang bzhin stobs can du yod bzhin pa ma yin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba de ni re zhig mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du smras te rnam par shes pa las phyi rol gyi rang bzhin stobs can du yod bzhin pa ma yin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba de ni re zhig mi rigs te /
translated: This statement that external objects do not exist as powerful things separate from consciousness, and therefore dependent origination does not exist, is illogical.

original: gal te rmi lam yul dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin /üîΩrten cing @296a * //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam yul dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin / rten cing @296a * //
translated: If the dependent origination of dreams together with its object does not exist,

original: 'brel bar 'byung ba med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin rang gi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa skyed par mi byed la /üîΩ'dis sad pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du skyed par byed pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten nas /
analyzed: 'brel bar 'byung ba med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin rang gi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa skyed par mi byed la / 'dis sad pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du skyed par byed pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten nas /
translated: then because dependent origination does not exist, like the son of a barren woman, it does not generate aspects in its own consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yul la rnam par shes pa dmigs so zhes nges so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yul la rnam par shes pa dmigs so zhes nges so //
translated: But because it generates them like the waking state, it is ascertained that consciousness observes an object that is a different dependent origination from consciousness, in dependence on sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang phyi rol gyi yul la rnam par shes pas dmigs pa ma grub pas de ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang phyi rol gyi yul la rnam par shes pas dmigs pa ma grub pas de ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Even in the waking state, since the consciousness does not establish the object, that is not tenable.

original: mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not untenable,

original: 'jig rten pa phyi rol gyi yul la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phyi rol nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa phyi rol gyi yul la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phyi rol nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the world does apprehend external objects, and because the Lord has taught that there are external objects.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: dge slong dag gzugs ni phyi rol gyi skye mched de /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs ni phyi rol gyi skye mched de /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, form is an external sense base,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: which is derived from the four great elements.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa ni rmongs pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang dgongs pa can nyid pas drang don yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni rmongs pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang dgongs pa can nyid pas drang don yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: The world is confused, and the Lord‚Äôs statement is interpretable in meaning, so there is no fault.

original: smras pa / ji ltar na yang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam shes kyis yongs su dpyad par bya ba mngon sum du dmigs bzhin pa la med do zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar na yang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam shes kyis yongs su dpyad par bya ba mngon sum du dmigs bzhin pa la med do zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Objection: But how can you say that blue, yellow, and so on, which are directly observed and analyzed by the eye consciousness and so on, do not exist?

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams dpyad na /üîΩrang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab bzhin nam /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams dpyad na / rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab bzhin nam /
translated: When blue and so on are analyzed,üîΩbecause their intrinsic reality is not observed, the consciousness of blue and so on is not suitable to be the observer of blue and so on, just like the subtle particles of blue and so on.

original: 'dus pa la dmigs pa po nyid du mi rung bas rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa yod par mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus pa la dmigs pa po nyid du mi rung bas rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa yod par mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore blue and so on that are different from the aspects of consciousness are not established as existent.

original: smras pa / gal te 'jig rten pa la dmigs bzhin pa yang rigs pas dpyad na med do zhes byas nas med do zhes brjod na de lta na 'di ltar rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes nges par byos shig / rnam parüîΩshes pa de yang rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa yul bzhin du /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te 'jig rten pa la dmigs bzhin pa yang rigs pas dpyad na med do zhes byas nas med do zhes brjod na de lta na 'di ltar rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes nges par byos shig / rnam par shes pa de yang rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa yul bzhin du /
translated: It is not produced from another, because it does not exist,üîΩlike the horns of an ass.

original: yod pa yod phyir skye ba min //
analyzed: yod pa yod phyir skye ba min //
translated: It is not produced from both itself and another, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the son of a barren woman.

original: med pa med phyir mi skye la //
analyzed: med pa med phyir mi skye la //
translated: It is not produced without cause, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the horns of a rabbit.

original: chos mi mthun phyir yod med min //
analyzed: chos mi mthun phyir yod med min //
translated: It is not produced from the four extremes, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.

original: skye ba med pas gnas 'gag @296b med ;
analyzed: skye ba med pas gnas 'gag @296b med ;
translated: It is not produced from the four intervals, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four directions, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four times, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four elements, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four truths, because it is inconsistent,

original: / ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa'i rtag pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos med min //
analyzed: / ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa'i rtag pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos med min //
translated: like the child of a childless woman.

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: It is not produced from the four noble lineages, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four meditative bases of supernatural power, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four formless states, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four concentrations, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four immeasurables, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four formless states, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four formless states, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.üîΩIt is not produced from the four formless states, because it is inconsistent,üîΩlike the child of a childless woman.

original: de phyir dngos dang dngos med dang // dngos dang dngos med min pas kyang //
analyzed: de phyir dngos dang dngos med dang // dngos dang dngos med min pas kyang //
translated: It is not produced from the four formless

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chad par 'gyur ba'i dpyad pa las kyang ma grub bo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chad par 'gyur ba'i dpyad pa las kyang ma grub bo //
translated: Thus, it is not established by the analysis of the consequences such as ‚Äúit would follow that the self is many.‚Äù

original: gang zhig rigs pas dpyad na mi 'thad pa de la 'jig rten pa la rmongs pa'i phyir med pa la sgro btags la /
analyzed: gang zhig rigs pas dpyad na mi 'thad pa de la 'jig rten pa la rmongs pa'i phyir med pa la sgro btags la /
translated: That which is untenable when analyzed by reasoning is imputed to exist by the world due to delusion,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyang de yod do zhes ston pa drang ba'i don du'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyang de yod do zhes ston pa drang ba'i don du'o zhes bya'o //
translated: and the buddhas teach that it exists as a provisional meaning.üîΩTherefore, you should accept that the five aggregates are not established as suchness, just like external objects.

original: phung po lnga rnams kyang phyi rol gyi dmigs pa bzhin du de kho nar ma grub par khas blang bar byos shig / des na rnam par shes pa ni yod pa nyid dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa ni med pa nyid gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams kyang phyi rol gyi dmigs pa bzhin du de kho nar ma grub par khas blang bar byos shig / des na rnam par shes pa ni yod pa nyid dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa ni med pa nyid gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, you should abandon the assertion that consciousness exists and external objects do not exist.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma grub par gyur pas rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub par khas blangs pa bzhin yul yang ma grub par khas blangs par byos shig dang skyon ci yang med do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma grub par gyur pas rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub par khas blangs pa bzhin yul yang ma grub par khas blangs par byos shig dang skyon ci yang med do //
translated: Since the nature of all is not established, you should accept that just as consciousness is not established by its own nature, objects are also not established. There is no fault at all.

original: rnam par shes pa dang yul dag mtshungs par rang gi ngo bo ma grub la /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub kyang yod la yul gyi rang gi ngo bo ma grub pas med do zhes bya ba 'di de kho na nyid du ma yin zhing 'jig rten pa la yang ma yin pas 'di skad du smra ba ni rigs
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang yul dag mtshungs par rang gi ngo bo ma grub la / rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub kyang yod la yul gyi rang gi ngo bo ma grub pas med do zhes bya ba 'di de kho na nyid du ma yin zhing 'jig rten pa la yang ma yin pas 'di skad du smra ba ni rigs
translated: The consciousness and the object are not established as their own nature in the same way.üîΩIt is not the case that the consciousness is established as its own nature but the object is not established as its own nature.

original: pa smra bar rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: pa smra bar rung ba ma yin no //
translated: To say this is not reality and it is not the case in the world. Therefore it is not reasonable to say this.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'jig rten pas mthong ba de ltar zhog shig / mthong ba yang phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa yang nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'jig rten pas mthong ba de ltar zhog shig / mthong ba yang phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa yang nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, let it be as it is seen in the world. And seeing is the perception of consciousness from the object, such as blue, that is external.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang zhog la phyi rol gyi don yang zhog shig dang / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob las tha dad pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang zhog la phyi rol gyi don yang zhog shig dang / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob las tha dad pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, let consciousness be and let external objects be. What is the point of separating them from worldly convention?

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i phyir rol la dmigs pas dgag pa'i don du rmi lam gyi dpe ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i phyir rol la dmigs pas dgag pa'i don du rmi lam gyi dpe ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the example of a dream is not for the purpose of refuting external objects that are different from consciousness.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga char yang rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga char yang rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
translated: However, it is for the purpose of establishing that the five aggregates, such as form, are essenceless.

original: ji ltar sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di nyid phyin ci log gi rgyu can gyi ma rig pa'i rkyen las /
analyzed: ji ltar sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di nyid phyin ci log gi rgyu can gyi ma rig pa'i rkyen las /
translated: Just as in the waking state, these things that exist are conditioned by ignorance, which is the cause of error.

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang / de'i rnam par shes pa yod pa can sna tshogs pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yang nyams @297a * //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang / de'i rnam par shes pa yod pa can sna tshogs pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yang nyams @297a * //
translated: The collection of the eye faculty and so on, and the consciousness that possesses the experience of various forms, sounds, and so on,

original: su myong ba la 'jug pas byis pa rnams 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan la /
analyzed: su myong ba la 'jug pas byis pa rnams 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan la /
translated: are the basis for the conception of the childish, who think, ‚ÄúThis is true.‚Äù

original: 'phags pas brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can du yongs su chod la /
analyzed: 'phags pas brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can du yongs su chod la /
translated: The noble ones ascertain that they are false and deceptive.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam gnyid kyis kun nas dkrugs pa'i sems sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rkyen gyis mig la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / de'i rnam par shes pa yod pa can sna tshogs pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul nyams su myong ba la 'jug pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam gnyid kyis kun nas dkrugs pa'i sems sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rkyen gyis mig la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / de'i rnam par shes pa yod pa can sna tshogs pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul nyams su myong ba la 'jug pas /
translated: Likewise, the mind that is disturbed by sleep in a dream, the eye faculty and so on, and the consciousness that possesses the eye faculty and so on, experience various objects such as forms and sounds.

original: rmi lam gyi nang na gnas pa rnams 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang na gnas pa rnams 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan la /
translated: The reason for the conception that ‚Äúthis is true‚Äù for those who abide in a dream

original: sad pa rnams kyis brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can nyid du yongs su chod la /
analyzed: sad pa rnams kyis brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can nyid du yongs su chod la /
translated: is ascertained by those who are awake as being false and deceptive.

original: sad pa'i skye bo tha snyad pa rnams la snang ngo //
analyzed: sad pa'i skye bo tha snyad pa rnams la snang ngo //
translated: It appears to conventional beings who are awake.

original: ji srid 'dir rmi lam mthong ba las sad par ma gyur pa de srid du de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: ji srid 'dir rmi lam mthong ba las sad par ma gyur pa de srid du de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
translated: As long as one has not awakened from seeing a dream, one sees forms with the eye faculty that has that nature.

original: ji srid mig ma tshang ba dang bsgribs par ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid mig ma tshang ba dang bsgribs par ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: This is as long as the eye is not impaired or obstructed.

original: de gzhan du rna bas sgra thos pa nas /
analyzed: de gzhan du rna bas sgra thos pa nas /
translated: When the ear hears sounds and so on,

original: ji srid med kyis chos rnams shes pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang byed la /
analyzed: ji srid med kyis chos rnams shes pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang byed la /
translated: As long as one is asleep, one knows phenomena, one performs virtuous and nonvirtuous actions,

original: gang dag rmi lam nyid du 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa ji lta bar /üîΩma rig pa'i gnyid kyi nang na gnas pas bsdus pa'i nye bar spyod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyid la /
analyzed: gang dag rmi lam nyid du 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa ji lta bar / ma rig pa'i gnyid kyi nang na gnas pas bsdus pa'i nye bar spyod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyid la /
translated: and one experiences the results of those actions, just as in a dream.

original: ma rig pa'i gnyid log pa las langs pa phung po lhag ma med pa la gnas pa'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'i 'phags pa rnams nye bar longs mi spyod de /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnyid log pa las langs pa phung po lhag ma med pa la gnas pa'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'i 'phags pa rnams nye bar longs mi spyod de /
translated: But when one awakens from the sleep of ignorance, the noble ones who abide in the nirvana that is without remainder do not experience the results of actions that are included in the sleep of ignorance.

original: phyin ci log gis bskyed ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po shin tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gis bskyed ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po shin tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the things that are produced by error are completely pacified.

original: de bzhin du sad pa la yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa la yang ste /
translated: It is the same for those who are awake.

original: gnyid log log pa'i bdag nyid las langs pa rnams /
analyzed: gnyid log log pa'i bdag nyid las langs pa rnams /
translated: Those who have arisen from the sleep of ignorance

original: rmi lam gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las shin tu 'das pas /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las shin tu 'das pas /
translated: completely transcend the things that are the nature of a dream.

original: des byas pa'i las 'bras bu myong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: des byas pa'i las 'bras bu myong bar mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, they do not experience the results of actions that are produced by that.

original: dge slong dag ltung bar byed pa'i chos kun tu spyod pa skyes kyang rmi lam gyi cha shas sad pas ltung ba chung ngu tsam du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs la ltung ba med par bzhag pas /
analyzed: dge slong dag ltung bar byed pa'i chos kun tu spyod pa skyes kyang rmi lam gyi cha shas sad pas ltung ba chung ngu tsam du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs la ltung ba med par bzhag pas /
translated: Monks, the Blessed One did not say that even a small downfall occurs when a monk engages in a downfall-causing act in a dream, but he did say that it is a downfall.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos pos byas pa'i las kyis 'di'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po la rnam pa thams @297b cad du mi myong ba'i phyir dang / de de bzhin du sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa rmi lam du rnam pa thams cad du mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos pos byas pa'i las kyis 'di'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po la rnam pa thams @297b cad du mi myong ba'i phyir dang / de de bzhin du sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa rmi lam du rnam pa thams cad du mi srid do //
translated: Because the action that is done by the nature of that person is never experienced by that person‚Äôs nature, and because a consciousness that is connected to the nature of one who is awake in the same way is never possible in a dream.

original: gzhan du na der byas pa'i las kyis sad pa na yang 'bras bu nyams su myong ba sus zlog par byed /
analyzed: gzhan du na der byas pa'i las kyis sad pa na yang 'bras bu nyams su myong ba sus zlog par byed /
translated: If it were possible, who could prevent the experience of the result of the action done in a dream when one is awake?

original: de ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni dbang po drug dang yul drug las te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni dbang po drug dang yul drug las te /
translated: Because the six collections of consciousness arise from the six sense faculties and the six objects.

original: dbang po yul dag med na med pa lta bu de la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po yul dag med na med pa lta bu de la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If the sense faculty and the object do not exist, then the consciousness of the eye, etc. is not tenable.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa la bag chags sna tshogs pa yongs su smin pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par mi rung ste /üîΩgnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pas de shin tu blun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa la bag chags sna tshogs pa yongs su smin pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par mi rung ste / gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pas de shin tu blun pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mental consciousness itself is not tenable as the various latent impressions of blue, yellow, etc. because it is extremely dull due to being associated with sleep.

original: gnyid dang bral nas sad par thal lo //
analyzed: gnyid dang bral nas sad par thal lo //
translated: If it were free from sleep, it would follow that it is the state of being awake.

original: dam pa'i chos klog pa dang / kha ton dang / shin tu phra ba'i don la sems pa la sogs pa yang sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos pos bsgrub par nus pas de la nye bar dmigs la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos klog pa dang / kha ton dang / shin tu phra ba'i don la sems pa la sogs pa yang sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos pos bsgrub par nus pas de la nye bar dmigs la /
translated: Reading the holy Dharma, reciting it, reflecting on its very subtle meaning, etc. are accomplished by the state of being awake, so they are observed in that.

original: gnyid kyis bslad pa'i rnam par shes pa la ji skad du smos pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyid kyis bslad pa'i rnam par shes pa la ji skad du smos pa mi 'thad do //
translated: What was said is not tenable in the consciousness affected by sleep.

original: 'o na de ltar gyur na bdag nyid kyi dngos po gnyis pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na de ltar gyur na bdag nyid kyi dngos po gnyis pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Well, if that is the case, then a second self would be obtained.

original: sus 'di la gnyis pa'o zhes yongs su brtag par nus /
analyzed: sus 'di la gnyis pa'o zhes yongs su brtag par nus /
translated: Who can conceive of a second nature in this?

original: gal te sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po la de mi ldan te /
analyzed: gal te sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po la de mi ldan te /
translated: If it is not endowed with that nature in the waking state,

original: sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i gnas skabs na /
translated: then at the time when the nature of the waking state exists,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that nature is not perceived.üîΩOr, if it is not perceived as having that nature even in the dream state, then at that time, who can posit a second nature in it?

original: yang na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su yang de ltar de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir de'i tshe su zhig de la bdag nyid kyi dngos po gnyis pa zhes 'jog /'dir re zhig bdag nyid la chags pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis brdzun pa'i rang bzhinüîΩdu brjod par nus kyi /
analyzed: yang na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su yang de ltar de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir de'i tshe su zhig de la bdag nyid kyi dngos po gnyis pa zhes 'jog /'dir re zhig bdag nyid la chags pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis brdzun pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par nus kyi /
translated: Here, one can say that the nature of the dream is false on the grounds of attachment to the dream itself,

original: 'di la gnyis pa dang gsum pa zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis pa dang gsum pa zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: but one cannot posit a second or third nature in it.

original: 'o na de lta na yang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa lta bu na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na yang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa lta bu na /
translated: But if that is so, then when one attains nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder,

original: rmi lam rmi ba las sad pa na dran pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba las sad pa na dran pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the memory of the dream will not arise when one awakens from the dream.

original: gal te rmi lam las sad pa mya ngan las 'das pa lta bur rnam pa thams cad rnam par shes pa ldog par 'gyur na de ni de ltar 'gyur gyi //üîΩ'dir sad pa na rnam @298a * //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam las sad pa mya ngan las 'das pa lta bur rnam pa thams cad rnam par shes pa ldog par 'gyur na de ni de ltar 'gyur gyi // 'dir sad pa na rnam @298a * //
translated: If, like one who has awakened from a dream, consciousness were to cease completely, then that would be so.

original: par shes pa'i kun du spyod pa yod pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: par shes pa'i kun du spyod pa yod pas zhes bya ste /
translated: But here, when one awakens, the operation of consciousness is still present.

original: rmi lam du nyams su myong ba sad pa'i rnam par shes pa la mi dran pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam du nyams su myong ba sad pa'i rnam par shes pa la mi dran pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one does not remember the consciousness of the dream experience when one awakens.

original: rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i phyir dran pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i phyir dran pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But it is not tenable that one remembers the dream experience.

original: de ltar na sngar gyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba phyi ma'i dran pa'i rnam par shes pas nyams su ma myong bas dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sngar gyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba phyi ma'i dran pa'i rnam par shes pas nyams su ma myong bas dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness of the previous experience is not experienced by the subsequent remembering consciousness, so it is not remembered.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because cause and effect are posited as a single continuum,

original: des na dran pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: des na dran pa yod do zhe na /
translated: therefore it is remembered.

original: 'dir yang sad pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa dag rgyun gzhan ma yin par rgyu dang 'bras bus 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang sad pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa dag rgyun gzhan ma yin par rgyu dang 'bras bus 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here also, the consciousnesses of the waking and dream states are not different continua because they are related as cause and effect.

original: slar yang bden pa 'khrul pa bden pa'i rgyu nyid du ji ltar shes /
analyzed: slar yang bden pa 'khrul pa bden pa'i rgyu nyid du ji ltar shes /
translated: Again, how could you know that a mistaken object is the cause of a true consciousness?

original: ji ltar sgra ni sgra brnyan gyi la sgra brnyan yang rang gi rnam par shes pa'i ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra ni sgra brnyan gyi la sgra brnyan yang rang gi rnam par shes pa'i ste /
translated: Just as a sound is the cause of an echo, and an echo is the cause of a consciousness,üîΩwhat is the point of this effort to prove that an error is the cause of an error?

original: khyod la 'khrul pa la 'bad pa 'dis don ci zhig / gal te 'di dag rigs pas dpyad pas bdag nyid yod pa mi spong na /
analyzed: khyod la 'khrul pa la 'bad pa 'dis don ci zhig / gal te 'di dag rigs pas dpyad pas bdag nyid yod pa mi spong na /
translated: If you do not reject the existence of things through analysis with reasoning,

original: su zhig 'dir rang bzhin med par khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig 'dir rang bzhin med par khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: then who will understand that things are essenceless?

original: gang kho na la de dag rigs pas mi 'thad pa de nyid kyis na de la brdzun par 'thad do //
analyzed: gang kho na la de dag rigs pas mi 'thad pa de nyid kyis na de la brdzun par 'thad do //
translated: Just because those things are not tenable through reasoning, they are tenable as false.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pas mthong ba kho na 'di dag rnam par gzhag par gyis shig /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pas mthong ba kho na 'di dag rnam par gzhag par gyis shig /
translated: Therefore, you should posit things just as they are seen by the world.

original: 'jig rten pas rmi lam du yul dang dus dang gnas skabs khyad par mi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyang nye bar dmigs la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas rmi lam du yul dang dus dang gnas skabs khyad par mi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyang nye bar dmigs la /
translated: The world observes things that are not tenable through reasoning, such as dreams, which are not true with respect to place, time, and situation.

original: mi bden pa nye bar dmigs pa des bden par 'dod pa'i sad pa'i bdag nyid dngos po la chags pa 'phags pas sel bar mdzad do //
analyzed: mi bden pa nye bar dmigs pa des bden par 'dod pa'i sad pa'i bdag nyid dngos po la chags pa 'phags pas sel bar mdzad do //
translated: The noble ones eliminate the attachment to the real nature of things, which is the waking state, by observing the unreal nature of things.

original: ji ltar gang zhig bdag nyid kyi dngos po de dmigs so zhes gang zhig 'dir dpyad pa na de sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang mtshungs la /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zhig bdag nyid kyi dngos po de dmigs so zhes gang zhig 'dir dpyad pa na de sad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang mtshungs la /
translated: When one analyzes what is observed, the nature of things is the same as the nature of things in the waking state.

original: bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di yang smos pa'i brtag pas mi 'thad na /üîΩji ltar 'jig rten pas dmigs phyin ci log las so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di yang smos pa'i brtag pas mi 'thad na / ji ltar 'jig rten pas dmigs phyin ci log las so //
translated: Since the nature of things is not tenable even in the context of the analysis of the proponents of intrinsic nature,üîΩhow could the observation of things by ordinary beings arise from non-error?

original: 'o na phyin ci log kyang skye ba med na de ji ltar 'jig rten pas nye bar dmigs /
analyzed: 'o na phyin ci log kyang skye ba med na de ji ltar 'jig rten pas nye bar dmigs /
translated: If even error does not arise, how could it be observed by ordinary beings?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten pas mthong ba tshad mar byas nas bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pas mthong ba tshad mar byas nas bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di yod do //
translated: We say: Taking the perception of ordinary beings as valid, this nature of things exists.

original: 'jig rten pas mthong ba de yang dpyad na ma grub po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas mthong ba de yang dpyad na ma grub po zhes bya ste /
translated: But when the perception of ordinary beings is analyzed, it is not established.

original: ji ltar de tshad mar byed /
analyzed: ji ltar de tshad mar byed /
translated: How could it be valid?

original: smras pa / ji skad @298b smos pa'i brtag pa ma byas pa'i 'jig rten pa'i mthong ba tshad mar byas pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ji skad @298b smos pa'i brtag pa ma byas pa'i 'jig rten pa'i mthong ba tshad mar byas pa'o //
translated: Objection: The world‚Äôs unanalyzed seeing is valid cognition.

original: gal te de ltar na ni 'di thams cad la de bzhin kho nar rjes su gnas pas byos shig / des na 'jig rten pas ji ltar mthong ba dngos por yod 'ga' zhig la bden par mngon par 'dod pa /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ni 'di thams cad la de bzhin kho nar rjes su gnas pas byos shig / des na 'jig rten pas ji ltar mthong ba dngos por yod 'ga' zhig la bden par mngon par 'dod pa /
translated: If that is so, then since all things exist in just this way, you should accept them.

original: 'khrul pa bsal ba la dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'khrul pa bsal ba la dgos pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Then what need is there to remove the world‚Äôs confusion about what it sees?

original: 'jig rten pa'i rmi lam sad pa'i bdag nyid lta bu'i mig la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ji ltar nye bar dmigs la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rmi lam sad pa'i bdag nyid lta bu'i mig la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ji ltar nye bar dmigs la /
translated: Just as in the world, the nature of eyes and so on is perceived in dreams and upon awakening,

original: brdzun pa nyid du rnam par gnas la dran pas na bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan pa yang ma yin zhing tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun pa nyid du rnam par gnas la dran pas na bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan pa yang ma yin zhing tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and just as they are remembered as false, they are not different from the nature of things.

original: phyin ci log las nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log las nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are perceived due to error.

original: des na 'jig rten las ji lta ba de lta bur grags pa'i dpes sad pa'i dngos po nye bar dmigs pa rnams la de chags pa mi skye ba'i don du 'phags pas brdzun pa nyid du gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten las ji lta ba de lta bur grags pa'i dpes sad pa'i dngos po nye bar dmigs pa rnams la de chags pa mi skye ba'i don du 'phags pas brdzun pa nyid du gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the noble ones clearly state that things perceived by those who are awakened by examples that are renowned in the world as false. The purpose of this is to prevent attachment to those things from arising.

original: dngos po la chags pa sngon du 'gro ba las 'khor ba la nges par dngos po la chags pa zad pa las mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya'o /
analyzed: dngos po la chags pa sngon du 'gro ba las 'khor ba la nges par dngos po la chags pa zad pa las mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya'o /
translated: Since attachment to things precedes cyclic existence, it is said that one attains nirvana through the exhaustion of attachment to things.

original: de'i phyir rmi lam du rmis pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzhin dang rgyu yul bzhin du ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rang bzhin med par grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam du rmis pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzhin dang rgyu yul bzhin du ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rang bzhin med par grub po //
translated: Therefore, like the pleasure and pain experienced in a dream, ignorance and compositional activity are established as lacking intrinsic existence, like the cause and object of the dream.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te dngos rnams rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gal te dngos rnams rang bzhin gyis //
translated: If things do not exist through their essence,üîΩThen inferior, equal, and superior,

original: med na dman mnyam khyad 'phags dang // sna tshogs nyid ni mi 'grub cing //
analyzed: med na dman mnyam khyad 'phags dang // sna tshogs nyid ni mi 'grub cing //
translated: And diversity itself are not established.

original: rgyu las kyang ni dngos grub min //
analyzed: rgyu las kyang ni dngos grub min //
translated: And also, things are not established from causes.

original: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pa dang / rmi lam gyi dpes kyang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pa dang / rmi lam gyi dpes kyang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The reasonings stated above and the example of a dream also prove that things lack intrinsic existence.

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med na /
translated: If things lack intrinsic existence,

original: de'i tshe dngos po med par smra ba khyod la dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par 'phags pa nyid mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po med par smra ba khyod la dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par 'phags pa nyid mi 'thob bo //
translated: then you who advocate essencelessness would not attain inferiority, equality, or superiority.

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i me tog la dman pa dang mnyan pa dang khyad par can la dmigs la /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i me tog la dman pa dang mnyan pa dang khyad par can la dmigs la /
translated: Inferior, equal, and superior observations of space-flowers, which do not exist, are observed.

original: dngos po rnams kyis 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs dang / skye rgyud dang / rus dang / na tshod dang / gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa rnams khyad par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa dang bar ma'i dbye bas gnas pa rnams so sor dman pa dang mnyan pa dang khyad par can yin la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs dang / skye rgyud dang / rus dang / na tshod dang / gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa rnams khyad par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa dang bar ma'i dbye bas gnas pa rnams so sor dman pa dang mnyan pa dang khyad par can yin la /
translated: But things such as the world, birth, caste, family, clan, age, form, and so on, which are observed, are inferior, equal, and superior, being distinguished as superior, not superior, and middling.

original: @299a * // phyi rol gyi yang khang bzangs dang rgyan dang mal stan dang bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i nye bar mkho ba rnams la ltos nas dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can nyid la /
analyzed: @299a * // phyi rol gyi yang khang bzangs dang rgyan dang mal stan dang bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i nye bar mkho ba rnams la ltos nas dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can nyid la /
