translated: In terms of external things, such as houses, ornaments, beds, food, drink, and so on, inferior, equal, and superior are established in dependence on each other.

original: de yang 'di dag thams cad rang rang gi dngos por dngos po rnams grub par 'gyur 'thad la /
analyzed: de yang 'di dag thams cad rang rang gi dngos por dngos po rnams grub par 'gyur 'thad la /
translated: Moreover, all of these are established as things in their own natures.

original: ma skyes pa ro gcig pa la sna tshogs pa nyid du 'grub pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ro gcig pa la sna tshogs pa nyid du 'grub pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they were not produced and were of one taste, it would not be tenable that they are established as various.

original: ji skad smos pa'i 'gro ba la sogs pa phan tshun sna tshogs pa yang 'jig rten du yod la /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i 'gro ba la sogs pa phan tshun sna tshogs pa yang 'jig rten du yod la /
translated: The various things of the world, such as migrating beings, are mutually various.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med bzhin pa sna tshogs pa nyid du ni mi 'thad la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med bzhin pa sna tshogs pa nyid du ni mi 'thad la /
translated: But it is not tenable that they are various without their own characteristics.

original: dngos po rang bzhin med par smra ba rnams dngos po rgyu las skye ba yang mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin med par smra ba rnams dngos po rgyu las skye ba yang mi 'thob ste /
translated: Those who propound that things lack intrinsic existence do not obtain that things are produced from causes.

original: rang bzhin med par smra bas dngos po ri bong gi rva dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par smra bas dngos po ri bong gi rva dang mtshungs so //
translated: For those who propound that things lack intrinsic existence, things are similar to the horns of a rabbit.

original: de la gal te 'du byed la sogs pa'i dngos po rang bzhin med par gyur na /
analyzed: de la gal te 'du byed la sogs pa'i dngos po rang bzhin med par gyur na /
translated: In response to that, if things such as compositional activity were essenceless,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin rgyu las skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin rgyu las skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: they would not arise from causes, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'di dag kyang rgyu las skye ba yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang rgyu las skye ba yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: But since they do arise from causes, therefore things have an essence.

original: 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩIf an essence existed, things that are dependently arisenüîΩwould not exist.

original: rang bzhin grub na rten 'byung gi / dngos po med 'gyur ma brten na //
analyzed: rang bzhin grub na rten 'byung gi / dngos po med 'gyur ma brten na //
translated: Without a basis,

original: gang la rang bzhin med par 'gyur //üîΩdngos po yod dang dngos med kyang //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin med par 'gyur // dngos po yod dang dngos med kyang //
translated: what would be essenceless?

original: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par smra ba'i phyogs la dman pa la sogs pa med par thal ba'i skyon gyis 'jigs pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub par khas blangs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par smra ba'i phyogs la dman pa la sogs pa med par thal ba'i skyon gyis 'jigs pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub par khas blangs so zhe na /
translated: If you fear the error of the consequence of the nonexistence of inferior and so on in the position that things are essenceless, then you must accept that things have an essence.üîΩBut then, although you accept things,

original: 'o na khyod kyi dngos po khas blangs kyang dngos po rnams 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi dngos po khas blangs kyang dngos po rnams 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: not only things

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par grub pa yang khyod kyis thob par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par grub pa yang khyod kyis thob par mi 'gyur la /
translated: You will not attain the special achievement that you desire,

original: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad med pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad med pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and you will attain the nonexistence of all presentations.

original: ji ltar byas na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te nges par dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub par gyur na de ni rang bzhin gyis grub par gyur pas de dag rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nges par dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub par gyur na de ni rang bzhin gyis grub par gyur pas de dag rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of things were definitely established, then since it would be established by its very nature, they would not arise in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: yod bzhin pa'i dngos po nyid la dngos por rnam par gzhag par rung gi med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa'i dngos po nyid la dngos por rnam par gzhag par rung gi med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is suitable to present an existent thing as a thing, but not an nonexistent one.

original: yod bzhin pa slar yang brten nas skye bar yang mi rigs la /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa slar yang brten nas skye bar yang mi rigs la /
translated: It is also not reasonable for an existent thing to arise again in dependence.

original: de las dngos po thams cad brten nas ma byung ba @299b thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las dngos po thams cad brten nas ma byung ba @299b thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, it follows that no things would arise in dependence.

original: brten nas 'byung ba med par gyur na /
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba med par gyur na /
translated: If dependent arising did not exist,

original: dngos po rnams kyi dman pa la sogs pa'i khyad par mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi dman pa la sogs pa'i khyad par mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
translated: the distinctions of inferiority and so on of things would not occur.

original: dngos por smra ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos por smra ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to speak of things.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: In this regard, someone might say,

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis mi bskyed de ;
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis mi bskyed de ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe intrinsic character of things is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: dus gsum du rang gi mtshan nyid gnas pa'i phyir dang / gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu'i phyir yang dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas gnas skabs nyid skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: dus gsum du rang gi mtshan nyid gnas pa'i phyir dang / gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu'i phyir yang dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas gnas skabs nyid skyed do zhe na /
translated: Because it endures in the three temporal periods, and because it is the effect of a state, the assemblage of causes and conditions of things produces just a state.‚Äù

original: de la ltos nas smras pa /
analyzed: de la ltos nas smras pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: ma brten par yang gang la ste gal te dngos po rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dus gsum du yang gnas par gyur na de ni ma brten par byung ba la rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ma brten par yang gang la ste gal te dngos po rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dus gsum du yang gnas par gyur na de ni ma brten par byung ba la rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: If things existed through their intrinsic character in the three temporal periods without depending on anything, then it would be untenable for them to arise without depending on anything.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la yang rang gi mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la yang rang gi mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur la /
translated: Even the son of a barren woman would have intrinsic character.

original: de'i phyir ma brten par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma brten par yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they do not arise without depending on anything.

original: ma brten par yang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: ma brten par yang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med do //
translated: Things do not have intrinsic character without depending on anything.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas blangs na ji ltar khas blangs pa'i rang bzhin med par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas blangs na ji ltar khas blangs pa'i rang bzhin med par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that things have an essence, then they could not become essenceless in any way.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma so sor 'jig pa gnas pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la de yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong bas gnas pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin med par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma so sor 'jig pa gnas pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la de yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong bas gnas pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin med par gzhag go //
translated: Since it is seen that compounded phenomena, which are momentary and disintegrate individually, change into something else, they are posited as essenceless because of having the nature of not enduring.

original: de la gal te de dag rang bzhin yod na gnas pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la gal te de dag rang bzhin yod na gnas pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: In that regard, if they had an essence, they would not have the nature of not enduring.

original: 'du byed rnams 'jig pa med pa thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams 'jig pa med pa thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Compounded phenomena would not be seen to disintegrate.

original: ngo bo nyid grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin yod bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin yod bzhin pa'o //
translated: Since they would have an essence, they would exist.

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mi srid do //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mi srid do //
translated: And it would not be possible for that which exists to change into something else.

original: 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid du gnas bzhin pa'i 'o ma gzhan du gyur pas zho'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mi srid pa'am /
analyzed: 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid du gnas bzhin pa'i 'o ma gzhan du gyur pas zho'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mi srid pa'am /
translated: It is not possible for milk to become the nature of yogurt while remaining in the state of milk.

original: gzhon nu yang gzhon nu'i gnas skabs nyid du gnas bzhin pa rgas pa'i gnas skabs gzhan thob nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu yang gzhon nu'i gnas skabs nyid du gnas bzhin pa rgas pa'i gnas skabs gzhan thob nas /
translated: A youth remains in the state of youth and then attains another state, that of aging.

original: 'di las gzhan du gyur par rnam par 'jog par byed la /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan du gyur par rnam par 'jog par byed la /
translated: It is posited as different from this.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is illogical.

original: 'di gnas skabs gzhan thob pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di gnas skabs gzhan thob pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is it for a thing to attain another state?

original: gal te 'o ma la ni de mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te 'o ma la ni de mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable for milk to be transformed into curd.

original: 'o ma'i gnas skabs dang 'gal ba'i zho'i gnas skabs su de ji ltar 'o @300a * //
analyzed: 'o ma'i gnas skabs dang 'gal ba'i zho'i gnas skabs su de ji ltar 'o @300a * //
translated: How could it be curd when it is in the state of milk?

original: ma ni gnas skabs nyid du gnas la /
analyzed: ma ni gnas skabs nyid du gnas la /
translated: Milk remains in the state of milk.

original: de med na 'o ma'i rnam par gzhag pa med pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na 'o ma'i rnam par gzhag pa med pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If it were not, it would not be milk.

original: de las kyang 'o ma dang zho'i gnas skabs dag gcig tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir 'o ma la zho'i dngos po med la /
analyzed: de las kyang 'o ma dang zho'i gnas skabs dag gcig tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir 'o ma la zho'i dngos po med la /
translated: Moreover, since the states of milk and curd are not the same, milk does not have the state of curd.

original: dngos po med na 'di la zho'i dngos po ga la zhig ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med na 'di la zho'i dngos po ga la zhig ces bya'o //
translated: If it does not have that state, how could milk be curd?

original: de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs par gyur na 'dis dngos po rnams yongs su 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs par gyur na 'dis dngos po rnams yongs su 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir la /
translated: Thus, if you accept that things have their own intrinsic characteristics, then it is impossible for things to transform.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba med par gyur na rang bzhin med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba med par gyur na rang bzhin med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not change into something else, it would not be essenceless.

original: 'o ma rang gi mtshan nyid las yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i dngos por gyur na /
analyzed: 'o ma rang gi mtshan nyid las yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i dngos por gyur na /
translated: If milk were to exist as a thing that does not change from its own characteristic,

original: ji skad du bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas brtag par yod par thal lo //
analyzed: ji skad du bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas brtag par yod par thal lo //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that it would be perceptible by the reasoning that establishes it.

original: dngos po 'ba' zhig tsam khas blangs par gyur na rang bzhin med pa med pa'i 'jig pa yang thob par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po 'ba' zhig tsam khas blangs par gyur na rang bzhin med pa med pa'i 'jig pa yang thob par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: If one were to accept that it is merely a thing, then it would not be the case that one would not also obtain the annihilation that is the nonexistence of essencelessness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yod bzhin pa la rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag gi med pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yod bzhin pa la rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag gi med pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is while its own characteristic exists that it is posited as having essence; it is not when it does not exist.

original: dngos po nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de dang 'gal ba dngos po med pa mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de dang 'gal ba dngos po med pa mi 'thad pas so //
translated: This is because it is not tenable that a thing be both the negation of that which is posited as a thing and a thing itself.

original: dngos po las bzlog pas na dngos po med pa ste 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po las bzlog pas na dngos po med pa ste 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is the opposite of a thing, it is called a nonthing, that is, an annihilation.

original: rnam par 'jig pa med par 'gyur gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa med par 'gyur gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin la /
translated: It would be without cessation, but not without essence.

original: zhig pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, because disintegration does not exist as an intrinsic identity,

original: de la 'di ltar ji skad du smos pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir dngos por smra bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar ji skad du smos pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir dngos por smra bar mi rigs so //
translated: therefore, because of the faults already mentioned, it is not reasonable to advocate substantialism.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te yang khyod kyis dngos por smra ba bkag kyang de lta na dngos po ma bkag go zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis dngos por smra ba bkag kyang de lta na dngos po ma bkag go zhes bya ste /
translated: Even though you have refuted substantialism, still, you have not refuted the existence of things.

original: de ni re zhig yod la /
analyzed: de ni re zhig yod la /
translated: That is, first, it exists.

original: gang de'i rang bzhin la de las cig shos ma mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rnam par gzhag pa thob po //
analyzed: gang de'i rang bzhin la de las cig shos ma mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rnam par gzhag pa thob po //
translated: And, because its intrinsic reality is not seen as something else, it is established as intrinsic reality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: me'i dngos po de'i gang zhig dro ba la /
analyzed: me'i dngos po de'i gang zhig dro ba la /
translated: that which is the thing fire is hot.

original: de la de las gzhan pa ma mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin zhes rnam par 'jog la dngos po 'ba' zhig pa grub pas rang bzhin grub pa dang gzhan gyi dngos po grub pa dang dngos po med pa grub pas mi rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la de las gzhan pa ma mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin zhes rnam par 'jog la dngos po 'ba' zhig pa grub pas rang bzhin grub pa dang gzhan gyi dngos po grub pa dang dngos po med pa grub pas mi rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not seen as something else, it is established as intrinsic reality. Since only the thing is established, it is not unreasonable to establish intrinsic reality, the establishment of the other thing, and the establishment of nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar gsher pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chu rang bzhin gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsher pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chu rang bzhin gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes rnam par 'jog la /
translated: Thus, water, which has the nature of wetness, is posited as ‚Äúanother thing‚Äù in dependence on another nature.

original: de yang dngos po zhig @300b pa la dngos po med pa zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: de yang dngos po zhig @300b pa la dngos po med pa zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: And that is posited as ‚Äúnonthing‚Äù when the thing is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa las rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa las rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since things exist, own-nature, other-nature, and nonthing exist.

original: smras pa / gal te dngos po nyid yod na rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te dngos po nyid yod na rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If things existed, own-nature, other-nature, and nonthing would exist.

original: rang bzhin dang bral ba la dngos po 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral ba la dngos po 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable that a thing exists that is devoid of essence.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that even the horns of a rabbit would be a thing.

original: de'i phyir med la gang gi tshe med pa de'i tshe de la /
analyzed: de'i phyir med la gang gi tshe med pa de'i tshe de la /
translated: Therefore, when it does not exist,

original: med la rang dngos gzhan dngos sam //
analyzed: med la rang dngos gzhan dngos sam //
translated: how could own-nature and other-natureüîΩexist for a nonthing?

original: dngos med 'gyur pa ga la zhig / des na rang dngos gzhan dngos dang // dngos med phyin ci log pa yin //
analyzed: dngos med 'gyur pa ga la zhig / des na rang dngos gzhan dngos dang // dngos med phyin ci log pa yin //
translated: and non-thing are misconceptions.

original: med pa ni yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i ri bong gi rva bzhin du rang bzhin med la /
analyzed: med pa ni yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i ri bong gi rva bzhin du rang bzhin med la /
translated: That which does not exist is essenceless like the horn of a donkey, which does not exist.

original: rang gi dngos po nyid kyang dngos po gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po nyid kyang dngos po gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes rnam par 'jog la /
translated: One‚Äôs own thing is posited as another‚Äôs thing in dependence on some other thing.

original: rang gi dngos po med na gzhan gyi dngos po yang med do /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po med na gzhan gyi dngos po yang med do /
translated: If one‚Äôs own thing does not exist, another‚Äôs thing also does not exist.

original: rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag med na yang su zhig dang bral nas dngos po med par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag med na yang su zhig dang bral nas dngos po med par 'gyur /
translated: If one‚Äôs own thing and another‚Äôs thing do not exist, then who would be devoid of what and become a non-thing?

original: 'o na rang gi dngos po la sogs pa dag med na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi dngos po la sogs pa dag med na /
translated: If one‚Äôs own thing and so on do not exist,

original: 'di ltar khams gsum pa'i tha snyad rnams ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum pa'i tha snyad rnams ji ltar zhe na /
translated: then how could the conventions of the three realms exist?

original: smras pa / ci mi bden pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'gegs sam /
analyzed: smras pa / ci mi bden pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'gegs sam /
translated: We ask, do you refute the conventions of the world because they are not real?

original: kho bo 'di skad du yang smras te /
analyzed: kho bo 'di skad du yang smras te /
translated: We also say this:

original: gang de ltar dngos po la sogs pa dpyad na mi srid la /
analyzed: gang de ltar dngos po la sogs pa dpyad na mi srid la /
translated: If one analyzes things and so on in this way, it is impossible.

original: 'jig rten pa yang des tha snyad byed la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang des tha snyad byed la /
translated: The world also uses those terms.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po dang / rang gi dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yang des na phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po dang / rang gi dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yang des na phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: And the non-existent is also the non-existent in that way.

original: 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log tsam la ltos nas gang yang de dag grub pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log tsam la ltos nas gang yang de dag grub pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The point is that, in dependence on the mere error of the world, they are established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gal te dngos po stong gyur na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po stong gyur na //
translated: If things were empty,

original: 'gag pa med cing skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gag pa med cing skye mi 'gyur //
translated: There would be no cessation and no arising.

original: gal te dngos po stong pa ste //
analyzed: gal te dngos po stong pa ste //
translated: If things were empty,

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: They would not exist.

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin mi skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin mi skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because they would not exist, like the horn of a donkey, they would not arise.

original: 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And they would not cease.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dngos po'i skye ba dang 'gag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dngos po'i skye ba dang 'gag pa gsungs te /
translated: The Lord also taught the arising and cessation of things.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po stong pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they have arising and cessation, things are not empty.

original: yang na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Or, one might think as follows:

original: de grub na @301a * //
analyzed: de grub na @301a * //
translated: If that is established,

original: rang bzhin yod pa nyid la /
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa nyid la /
translated: But if they exist essentially,

original: rang bzhin de yang med pa las stong pa nyid do zhe na /üîΩ'o na de lta bu yang /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang med pa las stong pa nyid do zhe na / 'o na de lta bu yang /
translated: then emptiness of essence would not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong na yang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong na yang /
translated: But if they are empty of essence,

original: gang la 'gag cing gang la skye //
analyzed: gang la 'gag cing gang la skye //
translated: then how could they arise or cease?üîΩIf they are empty of essence, then how could they arise or cease?

original: gang gi ngo bo med na de na ri bong gi rva ltar 'gag pa dang skye ba yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo med na de na ri bong gi rva ltar 'gag pa dang skye ba yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If they are empty of essence, then like the horn of a rabbit, they could not arise or cease.

original: dngos po rnams skye ba dang 'gag pa yang yod pas 'di dag gi rang bzhin yod do zhes bya la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye ba dang 'gag pa yang yod pas 'di dag gi rang bzhin yod do zhes bya la /
translated: But since things do arise and cease, their essence exists.

original: de grub na rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de grub na rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And if that is established, then their own nature and other nature would also exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: If arising and ceasing existed,

original: de ni de dang ldan pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni de dang ldan pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub par 'gyur la /
translated: then the essence of things that possess them would be established.

original: de dag kyang med de /
analyzed: de dag kyang med de /
translated: But they do not exist.

original: ji ltar byas na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na /
translated: How could they exist?

original: 'dir skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis su brtag pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis su brtag pa 'di ni /
translated: Here, this analysis of arising and ceasing into two

original: dngos po la brten nas brtag par nus kyi gzhan du ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po la brten nas brtag par nus kyi gzhan du ma yin la /
translated: It is possible to investigate in dependence on things, but not otherwise.

original: de dag de'i tshe skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dngos por 'jug par gyur na /
analyzed: de dag de'i tshe skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dngos por 'jug par gyur na /
translated: If they were to engage in the state of being arisen and ceased at that time,

original: cig car ram tha dad par 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: cig car ram tha dad par 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: they would engage either simultaneously or sequentially.

original: gnyi gar yang 'jug par mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyi gar yang 'jug par mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But it is impossible for them to engage in either way. To demonstrate this, he said:

original: dngos dang dngos med cig car med //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med cig car med //
translated: Things and nonthings are not simultaneous.

original: dngos po med na dngos med min //
analyzed: dngos po med na dngos med min //
translated: If there is no thing, there is no nonthing.

original: rtag par dngos po dngos med kyang //
analyzed: rtag par dngos po dngos med kyang //
translated: Permanently, things and nonthings

original: dngos med las gzhan dngos mi srid //
analyzed: dngos med las gzhan dngos mi srid //
translated: Also, a nonthing is not possible apart from a thing.

original: srid pas na dngos po ste skye'i /
analyzed: srid pas na dngos po ste skye'i /
translated: Since it is possible, a thing arises.

original: dngos po med pa ste 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ste 'jig pa'o //
translated: A nonthing ceases.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Things and nonthings are things and nonthings.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Since things and nonthings do not exist, things and nonthings are not things and nonthings.

original: re zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag cig car te dus gcig nyid du med de /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag cig car te dus gcig nyid du med de /
translated: First, things and nonthings are not simultaneous, that is, they do not exist at the same time.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir med pas dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu skye ba dang 'chi ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir med pas dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu skye ba dang 'chi ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ste /
translated: Because of mutual contradiction, it is not tenable that arising and death occur simultaneously in one thing.

original: de ltar re zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag cig car med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag cig car med pa'o //
translated: Thus, first, things and nonthings do not occur simultaneously.

original: da ni rim gyis kyang yang dag pa ji lta bar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med pas de bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rim gyis kyang yang dag pa ji lta bar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med pas de bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to establish that things and nonthings do not occur sequentially, he says:

original: dngos po med na dngos med min //üîΩrtag tu dngos po dngos med kyang //
analyzed: dngos po med na dngos med min // rtag tu dngos po dngos med kyang //
translated: If there is no thing, there is no nonthing.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Constantly, there is neither a thing nor a nonthing.

original: gal te dngos po las gzhan du dngos po med pa 'jug na de'i tshe 'jig pa dang bral ba'i nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang skye ba 'jug par @301b 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po las gzhan du dngos po med pa 'jug na de'i tshe 'jig pa dang bral ba'i nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang skye ba 'jug par @301b 'gyur te /
translated: If a nonthing were to occur as other than a thing, then arising would occur even in space and so on, which are devoid of destruction.

original: de ni mi 'jug go / de'i phyir dngos po med na dngos po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi 'jug go / de'i phyir dngos po med na dngos po med pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not occur. Therefore, if there is no thing, there is no nonthing.

original: gzhan yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan nyid la de yang nam yang dngos po las 'phrul nas gang la 'di med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan nyid la de yang nam yang dngos po las 'phrul nas gang la 'di med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that it does not exist in anything.

original: de ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid las grol ba'i phyir yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid las grol ba'i phyir yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: And because it is free from the characteristic of an entity, it is not existent.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid las phyin ci log tu gyur pa 'di la skye ba yang bzod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid las phyin ci log tu gyur pa 'di la skye ba yang bzod pa ma yin te /
translated: The arising of this, which is the opposite of the characteristic of an entity, is not tenable.

original: de ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the opposite of the characteristic of an entity.

original: de ltar re zhig dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, if an entity does not exist, a nonentity also does not exist.

original: ji ltar yang dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang mi 'thad na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang mi 'thad na /
translated: If an entity does not exist, how could a nonentity be tenable?

original: de ltar rtag par dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang med na med do zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de ltar rtag par dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang med na med do zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel to //
translated: Thus, if both an entity and a nonentity are permanent, then this statement, ‚ÄúIt does not exist,‚Äù is connected.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: An entity and a nonentity are called ‚Äúthe existence of an entity‚Äù and ‚Äúthe nonexistence of an entity.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa la brjod do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la brjod do //
translated: It is said to be impermanent.

original: dngos po med pa de yang rtag tu dngos po med na med la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa de yang rtag tu dngos po med na med la /
translated: If that non-thing is always a non-thing, it does not exist.

original: gal te yod na skye ba med par yang rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na skye ba med par yang rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, then even that which is not arisen would be destroyed.

original: de las kyang 'dus ma byas kyang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las kyang 'dus ma byas kyang 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, it would be unconditioned.

original: ma skyes pa yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that which is not arisen would die.

original: de ni 'di ltar dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang med la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang med la /
translated: As such, if a non-thing does not exist, a non-thing does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po med pa dag de ltar dpyad bzhin pas cig car ram tha dad par grub pa med pas de'i tshe de dag gi rang bzhin ma grub na dngos po 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po med pa dag de ltar dpyad bzhin pas cig car ram tha dad par grub pa med pas de'i tshe de dag gi rang bzhin ma grub na dngos po 'jug pa med do //
translated: When non-things are thus analyzed, they are not established simultaneously or separately. Therefore, if their nature is not established, things do not engage.

original: yang na gal te dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu 'jug par mi 'gyur yang /
analyzed: yang na gal te dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu 'jug par mi 'gyur yang /
translated: Moreover, if things and non-things do not engage,

original: de lta na yang re zhig de'i rten dngos po yod la /
analyzed: de lta na yang re zhig de'i rten dngos po yod la /
translated: in that case, their basis, a thing, exists.

original: de yod pas brten pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pas brten pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since that exists, the thing and non-thing that depend on it would also occur.

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe dngos po yang skye ba med na med do zhes brjod pa de'i tshe dngos po med pa las dngos po mi srid do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe dngos po yang skye ba med na med do zhes brjod pa de'i tshe dngos po med pa las dngos po mi srid do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Objection: When you say that since things do not arise, they do not exist, then at that time you say that things are impossible from the nonexistence of things.

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa las gzhan du ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa las gzhan du ste /
translated: But that is not so, since things are impermanent, that is, things have the characteristic of nonexistence.

original: de med par dngos po srid dngos po yod pa nyid la de yang med do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par dngos po srid dngos po yod pa nyid la de yang med do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not exist, then things would be possible, and you would say that things exist and also do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po med na de'i tshe de la brten pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ga la 'byung /üîΩde dag med na dngos po'i mtshan nyid las grol bas dngos po med @302a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po med na de'i tshe de la brten pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ga la 'byung / de dag med na dngos po'i mtshan nyid las grol bas dngos po med @302a * //
translated: When things do not exist, how could arising and disintegration that depend on them occur?üîΩSince they do not exist, things are free from the characteristics of things.

original: do zhes grub bo /
analyzed: do zhes grub bo /
translated: Therefore it is established that things do not exist.

original: // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid med na dngos po med la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid med na dngos po med la /
translated: If things do not have the characteristics of things, they do not exist.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba'i dngos po med pa re zhig yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba'i dngos po med pa re zhig yod la /
translated: In that case, the nonexistence of things that is the opposite of the characteristics of things exists.

original: de yod na dngos po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na dngos po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that exists, then things would also occur.

original: smras pa / gal te de dang 'gal ba'i dngos po med pa yod na dngos po yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te de dang 'gal ba'i dngos po med pa yod na dngos po yod par 'gyur la /
translated: Objection: If the nonexistence of a thing that is contrary to that existed, then a thing would exist.

original: de yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But that does not exist. To explain this, he said:

original: dngos po med na dngos med min //
analyzed: dngos po med na dngos med min //
translated: If a thing does not exist, a nonthing does not exist.

original: rang las min zhing gzhan las min //
analyzed: rang las min zhing gzhan las min //
translated: It does not arise from itself, nor from another.

original: de phyir dngos po dngos med cing //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po dngos med cing //
translated: Therefore, a thing does not exist, nor does a nonthing exist.

original: dngos po med pas de dag med //
analyzed: dngos po med pas de dag med //
translated: Since a thing does not exist, a nonthing does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe mi rtag pa dang bral ba'i dngos po bral ba'i dngos po med do zhes brjod la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi rtag pa dang bral ba'i dngos po bral ba'i dngos po med do zhes brjod la /
translated: When a thing that is devoid of impermanence is said to be a thing that is devoid of nonthing,

original: de'i tshe dngos po med na de las bzlog pa'i dngos med ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po med na de las bzlog pa'i dngos med ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: at that time, if a thing does not exist, how could a nonthing that is the opposite of that occur?

original: de'i phyir dngos med kyang med de //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos med kyang med de //
translated: Therefore, a nonthing also does not exist.

original: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad dngos med kyang med do //
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad dngos med kyang med do //
translated: By the reasoning stated, not only does a nonthing not exist, but also a thing does not exist.

original: gzhan yang rigs pa 'dis dngos po dngos po med pas dngos po med pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs pa 'dis dngos po dngos po med pas dngos po med pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, by this reasoning, since a thing does not exist, a nonthing also does not exist. To explain this, he said:

original: rang las min zhing gzhan las min //üîΩde phyir dngos po dngos med cing //
analyzed: rang las min zhing gzhan las min // de phyir dngos po dngos med cing //
translated: It is not from itself, nor from another,üîΩNor from both, nor without cause.

original: zhes so // gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na rang las skye ba'am gzhan las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes so // gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na rang las skye ba'am gzhan las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If any thing existed, it would arise from itself, from another, from both, or without cause.

original: de la rang gi bdag nyid ni re zhig skyes bzhin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la skye ba med de /
analyzed: de la rang gi bdag nyid ni re zhig skyes bzhin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la skye ba med de /
translated: First, arising does not exist for the nature of an entity that is in the process of arising.

original: rang zhes bya ba byung ba'i rnam par byed pa'i mtha' can so so'i rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa yod pa thob pa 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i dngos po la brjod do ;
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba byung ba'i rnam par byed pa'i mtha' can so so'i rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa yod pa thob pa 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i dngos po la brjod do ;
translated: The term ‚Äúitself‚Äù is a nominal suffix that indicates the individual nature of an entity that has come into existence, that has attained existence, and that is fit to produce an effect.

original: ; skyed pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ; skyed pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù is also the perception of existence.

original: gang kho na'i dngos po 'di rang ngo zhes grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la brjod la /
analyzed: gang kho na'i dngos po 'di rang ngo zhes grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la brjod la /
translated: The very entity that is established as ‚Äúthis very thing itself‚Äù is said to have the nature of an entity.

original: de nyid 'di ni skyed pa'o zhes skyed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa 'gal te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di ni skyed pa'o zhes skyed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa 'gal te /
translated: It is contradictory for that very thing to have the activity of arising, as in ‚Äúthis very thing arises.‚Äù

original: 'di'i dngos po gcig nyid la de gal te rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin du grub na 'di de dang 'gal ba'i skye bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: 'di'i dngos po gcig nyid la de gal te rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin du grub na 'di de dang 'gal ba'i skye bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par ji ltar 'thad /
translated: If that one thing is established as the nature of completion, then how could it be tenable to describe it as the nature of arising, which is incompatible with that?

original: yang na skyed bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du brjod na ji ltar grub pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par nus /
analyzed: yang na skyed bzhin pa'i rang bzhin du brjod na ji ltar grub pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par nus /
translated: Or, if it is described as the nature of arising, then how could it be described as the nature of completion?

original: de'i phyir gal te de bzhin zhes brjod na skyed do zhes brjod par mi bya la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de bzhin zhes brjod na skyed do zhes brjod par mi bya la /
translated: Therefore, if it is said to be that way, then it should not be said that it is produced.

original: yang na skyed pa zhes brjod na de la rang zhes @302b rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na skyed pa zhes brjod na de la rang zhes @302b rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Or, if it is said that it is produced, then it should not be posited as that.

original: dngos por gyur pa gcig ni rang la ltos nas gcig la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ste des na rang las ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa gcig ni rang la ltos nas gcig la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ste des na rang las ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable for one thing to be the nature of cause and effect in dependence on itself. Therefore it is not from itself.

original: gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po gzhan nye ba la ltos pa'i phyir la de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma rdzogs pa'i phyir de la ltos nas 'ga' yang gzhan nyid du yod pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po gzhan nye ba la ltos pa'i phyir la de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma rdzogs pa'i phyir de la ltos nas 'ga' yang gzhan nyid du yod pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: Otherwise, it is posited as other because it depends on the presence of another thing, and because the thing called its effect is not complete, it is said that in dependence on that, nothing exists as other.

original: rgyu'i gzhan nyid med pa nyid kyis na gzhan las kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu'i gzhan nyid med pa nyid kyis na gzhan las kyang skye ba med do //
translated: Since there is no otherness of cause, there is no arising from another.

original: skye ba med par 'gyur bas dngos po yang med do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: skye ba med par 'gyur bas dngos po yang med do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Since there would be no arising, there would be no thing.

original: de phyir dngos po dngos med cing //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po dngos med cing //
translated: Therefore, there is neither thing nor nonthing.

original: zhes so // gang gi tshe rigs pa 'dis dngos po yang dngos po med pas de'i tshe de med na dngos po med pa'i dngos med kyang med do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // gang gi tshe rigs pa 'dis dngos po yang dngos po med pas de'i tshe de med na dngos po med pa'i dngos med kyang med do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Since, by this reasoning, a thing is not a nonthing, then if that is not so, a nonthing that is not a thing also does not exist.

original: dngos med med pas de dag med //
analyzed: dngos med med pas de dag med //
translated: Since there is no nonthing, those do not exist.

original: ces so // de las gang zhig smos pa ni gal te dngos po med na yang re zhig dngos po med pa yod pas dngos po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ces so // de las gang zhig smos pa ni gal te dngos po med na yang re zhig dngos po med pa yod pas dngos po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if things do not exist, then since nonthings exist, things would arise.üîΩBut when things become nonthings, nonthings do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po yang dngos po med par gyur bas dngos po med pa yang med la /üîΩde'i tshe yod pa dang med pa nyid du smra bar khas mi len pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa dag yongs su spangs nas ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po yang dngos po med par gyur bas dngos po med pa yang med la / de'i tshe yod pa dang med pa nyid du smra bar khas mi len pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa dag yongs su spangs nas ;
translated: Since one does not assert the existence or nonexistence of things,

original: dbu ma'i rtogs pa phyin ci ma log par bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtogs pa phyin ci ma log par bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should explain the unerring realization of the middle way by completely abandoning the existence and nonexistence of things.

original: gang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dngos po tsam zhig la /
analyzed: gang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dngos po tsam zhig la /
translated: Moreover, some say that dependent origination is mere things,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa khas blangs pas sgro 'dogs la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa khas blangs pas sgro 'dogs la /
translated: but since they assert the existence of objects and apprehenders, they superimpose.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pas dbu ma'i rtogs par brjod la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pas dbu ma'i rtogs par brjod la /
translated: Since there are no objects and apprehenders, they say that this is the realization of the middle way.

original: gzhan dbang dngos po tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa nyid du lta ba yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang dngos po tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa nyid du lta ba yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since the relative exists as mere things, the view of nonexistence is an incorrect apprehension.

original: kun brtags gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid med pas yod pa nyid du lta ba yang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid med pas yod pa nyid du lta ba yang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the imagined does not exist as subject and object, the view of existence is an incorrect apprehension.

original: dngos po med pa khas blangs pa de dag gis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid yongs su spong bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa khas blangs pa de dag gis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid yongs su spong bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: Those who accept nonexistence cannot avoid the views of existence and nonexistence.

original: gzhan dbang dngos tsam khas blangs par gyur pa de dag gi yod par lta ba kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang dngos tsam khas blangs par gyur pa de dag gi yod par lta ba kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: Those who accept the relative as mere things have no fault in the view of existence.

original: kun du brtags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi srid par khas blangs par gyur na /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi srid par khas blangs par gyur na /
translated: Those who accept the imagined as impossible subject and object

original: de dag kyang med par lta ba @303a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang med par lta ba @303a * //
translated: have no fault in the view of nonexistence.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'o zhes bya ba de rnams kyis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du lta ba gang la spangs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'o zhes bya ba de rnams kyis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du lta ba gang la spangs zhes bya ste /
translated: What views of existence and nonexistence are to be abandoned by those who say this?

original: nges par 'di rnams 'khor ba nyid las mi ldog go //
analyzed: nges par 'di rnams 'khor ba nyid las mi ldog go //
translated: Therefore, these things are definitely not turned away from cyclic existence.

original: dngos po 'ba' zhig khas blangs na yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du smra ba las ma 'das la rtag pa dang chad par smra ba yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'ba' zhig khas blangs na yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du smra ba las ma 'das la rtag pa dang chad par smra ba yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one accepts only things, one does not go beyond the positions of existence and nonexistence, and one also comes to advocate eternalism and nihilism.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: dngos po yod na rtag pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po yod na rtag pa nyid //
translated: If things exist, they are eternal.

original: med na'ang nges par chad pa la //
analyzed: med na'ang nges par chad pa la //
translated: If they do not exist, they are definitely annihilated.

original: dngos por gyur na'ang de gnyis te //
analyzed: dngos por gyur na'ang de gnyis te //
translated: If they become things, they are both.

original: des na dngos po khas mi blang //
analyzed: des na dngos po khas mi blang //
translated: Therefore, do not accept things.

original: dngos po khas blangs par gyur na de'i rang bzhin yod bzhin pas slar yang gzhan du gyur pa mi srid pas dus thams cad du yod par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dngos po khas blangs par gyur na de'i rang bzhin yod bzhin pas slar yang gzhan du gyur pa mi srid pas dus thams cad du yod par 'gyur bas /
translated: If one accepts things, then because their intrinsic reality exists, it is impossible for them to become something else again, and therefore they would exist at all times.

original: dngos po de rtag par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po de rtag par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must accept that those things are eternal.

original: gal te rtag par khas blangs na de'i tshe ther zug thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rtag par khas blangs na de'i tshe ther zug thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If one accepts that they are eternal, then they would be permanent.

original: dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would endure at all times.

original: yang na gal te 'jig par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po med par khas blangs par gyur pas 'di ni med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gal te 'jig par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po med par khas blangs par gyur pas 'di ni med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it were to be destroyed, then since it would be accepted that it is a nonthing, it would obtain nonexistence.

original: de las kyang sngar byung la da ni med do zhes pa'i don khas blangs par gyur pas chad par lta ba thob ste /
analyzed: de las kyang sngar byung la da ni med do zhes pa'i don khas blangs par gyur pas chad par lta ba thob ste /
translated: And since it would be accepted that it previously arose but now does not exist, it would obtain the view of annihilation.

original: zhig pa ni slar yang mi 'jug pas so //
analyzed: zhig pa ni slar yang mi 'jug pas so //
translated: This is because destruction does not reoccur.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa las mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba rigs pas thob la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa las mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba rigs pas thob la /
translated: The view grasping the extremes is obtained from grasping the extremes of permanence and annihilation.

original: rigs pa'i stobs las 'ongs pas spang byar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i stobs las 'ongs pas spang byar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not to be abandoned because it comes from the power of reasoning,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is correct view.

original: de las mtha' gnyis spangs nas zhugs pa'i lan 'di yang phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las mtha' gnyis spangs nas zhugs pa'i lan 'di yang phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: And the response that engages in abandoning the two extremes would be erroneous.

original: gang gi tshe rigs pas dpyad na dngos po rnam pa thams cad du med na de'i tshe de'i yul rtag pa dang chad par yongs su brtags pas yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin no zhes 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rigs pas dpyad na dngos po rnam pa thams cad du med na de'i tshe de'i yul rtag pa dang chad par yongs su brtags pas yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin no zhes 'thad do //
translated: When one analyzes with reasoning, if things do not exist in any way, then at that time it is tenable to say that the views of eternalism and nihilism that take that as their object are not the correct view.

original: gang yang yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin pa de ni nges par spang bar bya la /
analyzed: gang yang yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin pa de ni nges par spang bar bya la /
translated: And that which is not the correct view must definitely be abandoned.

original: de spong ba'i thabs kyang rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de spong ba'i thabs kyang rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: And the method for abandoning that is not accepting intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po bkag pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dir thar par 'dod pa rnams kyis khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po bkag pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dir thar par 'dod pa rnams kyis khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore those who desire liberation should not accept the statement, ‚ÄúOne does not go to nirvana by refuting things.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩbdag dang bdag gi pa'i rnam pa ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba la /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / bdag dang bdag gi pa'i rnam pa ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba la /
translated: Here the opponent says:üîΩThe aspects of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù are the view of the transitory collection.

original: gang gi tshe @303b bdag nyid du dmigs pa de nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar yongs su brtags pa las mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba skyed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe @303b bdag nyid du dmigs pa de nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar yongs su brtags pa las mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba skyed la /
translated: When one observes ‚ÄúI,‚Äù one generates the view grasping an extreme from the imputation of the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de yang spang bya la chos tsam ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i lta bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang spang bya la chos tsam ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i lta bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the mere object of abandonment is not observed in the views of eternalism and nihilism.

original: des na gal te yang phung po rnams mya ngan las 'das nas slar mi 'jug na /
analyzed: des na gal te yang phung po rnams mya ngan las 'das nas slar mi 'jug na /
translated: Therefore, even if the aggregates do not reenter after nirvana,

original: de lta na yang lta ba de ni chad par lta ba ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang lta ba de ni chad par lta ba ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: still, that view is not the view of nihilism.

original: 'o na 'jig tshogs su lta ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs la /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig tshogs su lta ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs la /
translated: The afflicted view of the self observes the five appropriated aggregates as the self and entities connected to the self.

original: de lta na yang mu stegs byed kyis brtags pa'i bdag gi rnam par dmigs bzhin pa na de'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams la yang bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs pas 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta na yang mu stegs byed kyis brtags pa'i bdag gi rnam par dmigs bzhin pa na de'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams la yang bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs pas 'jug go //
translated: Even though it observes the self imputed by tƒ´rthikas, it engages the aggregates through the power of observing the self.

original: 'o na 'di yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'o na 'di yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But this view of the transitory collection observes the five appropriated aggregates.

original: khyad par ni 'di dag ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di dag ste /
translated: There is a difference between the two.

original: gang du de dag la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs nas yongs su 'dzin cing de las kyang mthar 'dzin par lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de nyid la rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pas dmigs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang du de dag la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs nas yongs su 'dzin cing de las kyang mthar 'dzin par lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de nyid la rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pas dmigs so zhes bya'o //
translated: Wherever they are observed as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù they are appropriated and grasped.  And from that, the five appropriated aggregates are observed in the aspect of eternalism and nihilism by the view of grasping extremes.

original: gal te yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs so zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gal te yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs so zhes bya ba /
translated: If the view of the transitory collection observes the five appropriated aggregates,

original: de ltar na yang 'di de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'di de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs la /
translated: then it does not observe their nature.

original: 'on kyang de dag las bdag tu sgro btags nas dmigs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag las bdag tu sgro btags nas dmigs te /
translated: However, it observes them after superimposing the self on them.

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sgro btags pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sgro btags pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúsuperimposing the five appropriated aggregates.‚Äù

original: dge slong ngam bram ze gang cung zad bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba las yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di nyid mthong ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: dge slong ngam bram ze gang cung zad bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba las yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di nyid mthong ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMonks and brahmins, whoever sees the self after observing it sees only the five appropriated aggregates.‚Äù

original: de las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu nyid ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu nyid ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning is that a self that is a different internal agent is not established.

original: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs su lta bas bdag kho na la dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs su lta bas bdag kho na la dmigs so //
translated: Therefore, the view of the transitory collection focuses on just the self.

original: gang yang bdag gi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang bdag gi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, because it is under the influence of the self,

original: 'du byed rnams la bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bdag gi ba'i rnam par dmigs la /
translated: formations are observed in the aspect of being mine.

original: de'i phyir mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pas 'jug bzhin pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pas 'jug bzhin pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the view of grasping extremes engages in the aspects of permanence and annihilation,

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba la dmigs kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba la dmigs kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: it focuses on the self and mine, not on anything else.

original: de nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: kun dga' bo @304a * //
analyzed: kun dga' bo @304a * //
translated: ƒÄnanda,

original: bdag yod do zhe na pha rol po'i rtag pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: bdag yod do zhe na pha rol po'i rtag pa zhes bya la /
translated: if one says ‚Äúthe self exists,‚Äù that is the eternalist position of the opponent.

original: bdag med do zhe na pha rol po'i chad par ro zhes so //
analyzed: bdag med do zhe na pha rol po'i chad par ro zhes so //
translated: If one says ‚Äúthe self does not exist,‚Äù that is the annihilationist position of the opponent.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te 'ga' zhig chos tsam la rtag pa zhes rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig chos tsam la rtag pa zhes rtogs na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf one understands that mere phenomena are permanent,

original: ci de ni rtag par lta bar 'gyur ram 'on te ma yin //
analyzed: ci de ni rtag par lta bar 'gyur ram 'on te ma yin //
translated: is that the view of permanence or not?‚Äù

original: gal te re zhig rtag par lta bar de 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig rtag par lta bar de 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the view of the transitory aggregates is the view of permanence,

original: de mi rung ste /
analyzed: de mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba chos tsam la dmigs shing gang la mthar 'dzin par lta ba 'jug pa ni med la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba chos tsam la dmigs shing gang la mthar 'dzin par lta ba 'jug pa ni med la /
translated: The view of the transitory aggregates focuses on mere phenomena, and the view of grasping an extreme does not occur in relation to that.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba spangs nas gzhan rtag pa'i rnam par 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba spangs nas gzhan rtag pa'i rnam par 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the view of grasping an extreme does not occur in the aspect of permanence after abandoning the view of grasping an extreme.

original: lta ba nyid med na yang rtag pas chos tsam mthong ba kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba nyid med na yang rtag pas chos tsam mthong ba kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no view, then seeing mere phenomena as permanent would not be a misdeed.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba'i tshig las rtag pa nyid du lta ba phyin ci log pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba'i tshig las rtag pa nyid du lta ba phyin ci log pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the view of permanence is a misconception because the statement ‚ÄúAll conditioned states are impermanent‚Äù is a misconception,

original: gal te der 'dzin pa phyin ci log na /
analyzed: gal te der 'dzin pa phyin ci log na /
translated: then if grasping that is a misconception,

original: ji ltar 'di nyon mongs pa'i dmigs par 'gyur /üîΩji srid du 'dod chags pa de srid du sdug pa'i rnam par dmigs par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyon mongs pa'i dmigs par 'gyur / ji srid du 'dod chags pa de srid du sdug pa'i rnam par dmigs par byed /
translated: how could it be the focal object of affliction?üîΩAs long as there is attachment, one focuses on the aspect of beauty.

original: zhe sdang mi sdug pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang mi sdug pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: One focuses on the aspect of ugliness through aversion.

original: nga rgyal khengs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal khengs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: One focuses on the aspect of haughtiness through pride.

original: mi shes pa'i rnam par ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i rnam par ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: One focuses on the aspect of ignorance through ignorance.

original: yid gnyis kyi rnam par ni the tshom mo //
analyzed: yid gnyis kyi rnam par ni the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt is a form of indecision.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni bdag dang bdag gi bar 'jug pa'o //üîΩlta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni dman pa la mchog gi rnam par ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni bdag dang bdag gi bar 'jug pa'o // lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni dman pa la mchog gi rnam par ro //
translated: The afflicted view of the self engages the self and things pertaining to the self.üîΩThe overesteeming of (1) morality and (2) spiritual practices engages inferior things as superior.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rgyu med pa dang lam ma yin pa la rgyu dang lam gyi rnam par 'jug pa'o zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rgyu med pa dang lam ma yin pa la rgyu dang lam gyi rnam par 'jug pa'o zhes bya bas so //
translated: The overesteeming of (3) a bad view engages causes that are not causes and paths that are not paths as causes and paths.

original: re zhig de dag rtag pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig de dag rtag pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so zhes bya ste /
translated: They are not perceived as having the aspect of permanence.

original: su zhig de'i rnam par dmigs pa yod /üîΩyang na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i zhes yongs su rtog na de lta na 'di ltar bdag gi ba'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i chos tsam la dmigs pa yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o zhes yongs su shes so //
analyzed: su zhig de'i rnam par dmigs pa yod / yang na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i zhes yongs su rtog na de lta na 'di ltar bdag gi ba'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i chos tsam la dmigs pa yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o zhes yongs su shes so //
translated: Who perceives them as having that aspect?üîΩOr, if one imagines that they are the object of the afflicted view of the extreme, then one understands that the afflicted view of the extreme engages mere phenomena that do not have the aspect of the self as the self.

original: gal te yang de ni de ltar na de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos tsam yang chad pa'i phyir chad par lta ba ste /
analyzed: gal te yang de ni de ltar na de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos tsam yang chad pa'i phyir chad par lta ba ste /
translated: If one imagines that the afflicted view of the extreme engages the self, then at that time, because mere phenomena that are nirvana are annihilated, one has the afflicted view of annihilation.

original: ci ltar mthar 'dzin par lta bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar mthar 'dzin par lta bar mi 'gyur /
translated: How could it not be a view that grasps an extreme?

original: gzhan yang de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i chos tsam la de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas log par rtogs pa las nyon mongs @304b pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i chos tsam la de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas log par rtogs pa las nyon mongs @304b pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the afflictions arise from wrong understanding, which is the superimposition of the aspect of one thing onto another thing that is not that.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po rang bzhin med pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po rang bzhin med pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, things that are dependently arisen are essenceless, that is, they are not essentially arisen.

original: de dag la rang bzhin du gang zhig khong du chud pa de ni gtso bo phyin ci log gi bdag po ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag la rang bzhin du gang zhig khong du chud pa de ni gtso bo phyin ci log gi bdag po ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The understanding of that as having essence is called the fundamental misknowledge, which is the lord of all afflictions.

original: gzhan du na gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod bzhin pa'i ngo bor gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod bzhin pa'i ngo bor gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, if the essence of things existed,

original: de nges par de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nges par de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: it would definitely be perceived by the ƒÅryas‚Äô wisdom that perceives things as they really are.

original: dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'phags pa'i lam la mi srid la /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'phags pa'i lam la mi srid la /
translated: But it is impossible for the ƒÅryas‚Äô path to have the aspect of perceiving the intrinsic character of things.

original: bcu drug las gzhan dri med rnam pa med //
analyzed: bcu drug las gzhan dri med rnam pa med //
translated: The stainless has no aspects other than the sixteen.

original: ces bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: ces bstan bcos las so //
translated: So it says in the treatise.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pas kun du brtags pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pas kun du brtags pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes so //
translated: Therefore, things imagined by ignorance do not exist in reality.

original: de ltar dngos po'i rnam par 'jug pas de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma shes par 'jug go zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po'i rnam par 'jug pas de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma shes par 'jug go zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, because of the engagement of things, one engages without knowing reality, not knowing reality.

original: ma rig pas kun du brtags pa'i dngos po la 'dod chags kyis sdug pa'i rnam par dmigs la /üîΩzhe sdang gis mi sdug pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: ma rig pas kun du brtags pa'i dngos po la 'dod chags kyis sdug pa'i rnam par dmigs la / zhe sdang gis mi sdug pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: In things imagined by ignorance, attachment focuses on the aspect of beauty.üîΩHatred focuses on the aspect of ugliness.

original: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: Pride focuses on the aspect of inflation.

original: the tshom gyis yid gnyis su'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyis yid gnyis su'o //
translated: Doubt focuses on the aspect of uncertainty.

original: 'jig tshogs kyis bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyis bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par ro //
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates focuses on the aspect of self and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: mthar 'dzin gyis rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin gyis rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: The view grasping an extreme focuses on the aspect of eternalism and nihilism.

original: log par lta bas med pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: log par lta bas med pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: Wrong view focuses on the aspect of nonexistence.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas dman pa la mchog gi rnam par ro //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas dman pa la mchog gi rnam par ro //
translated: The view holding a view to be paramount focuses on the aspect of superiority.

original: lam gyi rnam pas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o zhes de ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pas yongs su brtag pa'i phyin ci log gi dngos po nyid la de dag zhen pas sgro btags nas 'jug la /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o zhes de ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pas yongs su brtag pa'i phyin ci log gi dngos po nyid la de dag zhen pas sgro btags nas 'jug la /
translated: Thus, all the afflictions are engaged by superimposition through attachment to the very things that are erroneous due to the postulation of ignorance.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: And for that very reason,

original: rmongs med cig shos skye ba med //
analyzed: rmongs med cig shos skye ba med //
translated: the other one does not arise without delusion.

original: ces bya bas ma rig pa'i rgyu can du nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ces bya bas ma rig pa'i rgyu can du nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, all the afflictions are presented as having ignorance as their cause.

original: rmongs pa spangs pa las thams cad ma lus par spong gi gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa spangs pa las thams cad ma lus par spong gi gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: All of them are abandoned without remainder through the abandonment of delusion, not otherwise,

original: de dag ma rig pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ma rig pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are connected with ignorance.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa lhas /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa lhas /
translated: As ƒÄryadeva says,

original: ma rig kun du gnas pa ni //
analyzed: ma rig kun du gnas pa ni //
translated: Delusion is the root of all afflictions.

original: ji ltar las la lus dbang gis //üîΩde phyir @305a * //üîΩkun kyang rmongs pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar las la lus dbang gis // de phyir @305a * // kun kyang rmongs pa yis //
translated: Just as the body faculty is the basis of all actions,üîΩso delusion is the basis of all afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pas de 'dir bsnun no //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas de 'dir bsnun no // zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, all of them are struck here by delusion.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gsungs pa /
translated: And also, the BhagavƒÅn said this:

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di nyid la bdag ces yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mdo de yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang lhan cig tu gzhi gcig la dmigs par 'thad do zhes shin tu nges par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di nyid la bdag ces yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mdo de yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang lhan cig tu gzhi gcig la dmigs par 'thad do zhes shin tu nges par sgrub pa'o //
translated: This sutra passage also very clearly establishes that the view of the transitory collection and the view grasping at the extreme of permanence focus on the same basis.

original: de las kyang 'di shin tu 'thad pas dngos por yod na yang des na gnyis ka khas blang ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de las kyang 'di shin tu 'thad pas dngos por yod na yang des na gnyis ka khas blang ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Since this is very reasonable, if things do exist, then both of these views would be accepted.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te dngos po yod kyang de lta na yang de'i rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag med pas ther zug pa dang rgyun chad par lta bar thal ba ma yin pa ji ltar zhan /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod kyang de lta na yang de'i rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag med pas ther zug pa dang rgyun chad par lta bar thal ba ma yin pa ji ltar zhan /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if things exist, since their permanence and impermanence do not exist, how could it follow that the views of eternalism and nihilism are untenable?‚ÄùüîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: gsungs pa / rgyun gyi phyir na 'di yod de //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rgyun gyi phyir na 'di yod de //
translated: Because of a continuum, this exists.üîΩAfter giving rise to a cause, the thing ceases.

original: rgyu byin nas ni dngos po 'gag / sngar bzhin 'di yang ma grub cing rgyun chad par thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu byin nas ni dngos po 'gag / sngar bzhin 'di yang ma grub cing rgyun chad par thal bar 'gyur /
translated: This is also not established as before, and it follows that there is annihilation.
