original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jug pa las dus gsum du 'dus byas rnams kyi skad cig ma'i nye bar len pa rab tu 'byung ba las rgyun zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jug pa las dus gsum du 'dus byas rnams kyi skad cig ma'i nye bar len pa rab tu 'byung ba las rgyun zhes brjod do //
translated: The relation of cause and effect is applied to the stream of conditioned factors, which is the arising of the moments of conditioned factors in the three times.

original: 'di ltar s'a lu'i sa bon gyi myu gu dang sdong bu dang ldum bu rnams brgyud mar rab tu 'byung ba ni sa bon gyi rgyun no //
analyzed: 'di ltar s'a lu'i sa bon gyi myu gu dang sdong bu dang ldum bu rnams brgyud mar rab tu 'byung ba ni sa bon gyi rgyun no //
translated: Thus, the stream of the seed is the arising of the sprout, stem, and leaves of the rice plant in succession.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de yang sa bon gyi rgyus 'jug la /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de yang sa bon gyi rgyus 'jug la /
translated: And that stream of the sprout, etc. is set in motion by the cause, the seed.

original: sa bon gyi rgyu can gyi myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de las kyang sa bon dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu mthar 'jug go //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyu can gyi myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de las kyang sa bon dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu mthar 'jug go //
translated: And from that stream of the sprout, etc. which has the seed as its cause, the effect which is similar to the seed finally arises.

original: 'bras bu de yang sa bon gyi rgyu can du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang sa bon gyi rgyu can du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: And that effect is established as having the seed as its cause.

original: ji ltar byas na 'dir sa bon 'gags la /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na 'dir sa bon 'gags la /
translated: How is it that the seed ceases here?

original: 'di'i bdag nyid kyi rgyun las 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir dngos kyi 'bras bu'i rgyu myu gu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i bdag nyid kyi rgyun las 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir dngos kyi 'bras bu'i rgyu myu gu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because a similar effect is produced from the continuity of its own self, the seed ceases after giving its effect, the sprout.

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pas khyad par du byas pa'i myu gu skyed pa'i rgyu'i dngos por yongs su bsgrub pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pas khyad par du byas pa'i myu gu skyed pa'i rgyu'i dngos por yongs su bsgrub pas /
translated: The sprout is established as the cause that produces the effect, qualified by the potency to produce the effect.

original: rgyu byin nas 'gags zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu byin nas 'gags zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the seed ceases after giving rise to the sprout.

original: de bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa nas me tog gi mthar thug pa rnams rang gi rgyu las thob pa'i rgyus sa bon dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu rim gyis rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa nas me tog gi mthar thug pa rnams rang gi rgyu las thob pa'i rgyus sa bon dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu rim gyis rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the same way, from the sprout up to the flower, each stage is produced from its own cause and gradually perfects the effect that is similar to the seed.

original: 'bras bu de yang sa bon rgyur byas pa nyid las nye bar @305b skye'o ;
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang sa bon rgyur byas pa nyid las nye bar @305b skye'o ;
translated: That effect is produced in dependence on the seed as its cause.

original: / gal te sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pas mi 'jug na mthar yang de'i rigs can gyi 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya la /
analyzed: / gal te sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pas mi 'jug na mthar yang de'i rigs can gyi 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya la /
translated: If the continuity of the seed and sprout were not engaged in producing the effect by means of potency, then in the end, an effect of that type would not occur.

original: des na mthar yang 'byung bzhin pa'i 'bras bu sa bon gyi rgyu can nyid do zhes rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: des na mthar yang 'byung bzhin pa'i 'bras bu sa bon gyi rgyu can nyid do zhes rnam par 'jog la /
translated: Therefore, in the end, the result that is occurring is the cause of the seed.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩBecause the continuum arises from the seed,

original: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las kyang ni 'bras bu 'byung //
analyzed: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las kyang ni 'bras bu 'byung //
translated: and the result arises from the continuum,

original: de'i phyir sa bon sngon 'gro'i 'bras //üîΩrtag min chad pa yang ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon sngon 'gro'i 'bras // rtag min chad pa yang ma yin //
translated: therefore the result is preceded by the seed.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: It is not permanent, nor is it annihilated.

original: de la sa bon ni 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi rgyur khong du chud par 'gag par 'gyur grang la //
analyzed: de la sa bon ni 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi rgyur khong du chud par 'gag par 'gyur grang la //
translated: In that regard, the seed is understood to be the cause of the continuum of the sprout, which is capable of producing the result.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun kyang mi 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun kyang mi 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If the continuum of the sprout, etc. were to cease,

original: de'i tshe chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, it would be the view of annihilation.

original: yang na myu gu la sogs pa 'jug kyang sa bon rang gi ngo bos gnas na de ni rtag par lta ba ste /
analyzed: yang na myu gu la sogs pa 'jug kyang sa bon rang gi ngo bos gnas na de ni rtag par lta ba ste /
translated: Or, even if the sprout, etc. were to occur, if the seed remained by its own nature, that would be the view of permanence.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya bas des na rgyun yod la rgyun can gyi rgyu'i skad cig ma rnams kyang 'bras bu'i don du rgyu byin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi ngo bos mi gnas pa'i phyir yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal ba med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya bas des na rgyun yod la rgyun can gyi rgyu'i skad cig ma rnams kyang 'bras bu'i don du rgyu byin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi ngo bos mi gnas pa'i phyir yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal ba med do zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the continuum exists and the momentary causes that are the members of the continuum function as causes for the sake of the effect, and since they do not endure by their own intrinsic reality, it is said that the consequence of the views of eternalism and nihilism do not apply.

original: 'dir yang slob dpon gyis skyon brjod /
analyzed: 'dir yang slob dpon gyis skyon brjod /
translated: Here the master responds with a critique:

original: sngar bzhin 'di yang mi 'grub cing //üîΩrgyun chad par yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sngar bzhin 'di yang mi 'grub cing // rgyun chad par yang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Just as before, this is not established,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the consequence of annihilation also follows.

original: 'dir 'di skad du rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad du rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Here it is said: In order to abandon the errors of eternalism and nihilism,

original: de ni sngar bzhin du ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ni sngar bzhin du ma grub ste /
translated: this is not established just as before.

original: ji ltar byas na yod pa nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dir rtogs na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na yod pa nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dir rtogs na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow could the engagement of cause and effect occur if it exists?‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'jug pa mi srid pa yang sngar bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'jug pa mi srid pa yang sngar bstan te /
translated: The impossibility of the engagement of cause and effect was previously explained.

original: 'bras bu yin na 'bras ldan la //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin na 'bras ldan la //
translated: If it is an effect, it is endowed with an effect.

original: der med gyur na rgyu med mtshungs //
analyzed: der med gyur na rgyu med mtshungs //
translated: If it does not exist there, it is the same as causeless.

original: yod dang med pa na yang 'gal //
analyzed: yod dang med pa na yang 'gal //
translated: Existence and nonexistence are contradictory.

original: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang 'thad ma yin //
translated: It is not tenable in any of the three times.

original: ma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
analyzed: ma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
translated: Ignorance does not occur without formations.

original: de med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing //
analyzed: de med 'du byed mi 'byung zhing //
translated: Without that, formations do not occur.

original: de dag phan tshun rgyu can de //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun rgyu can de //
translated: They are mutually causes.

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang ma grub po //üîΩgang yang / gang zhig rang nyid rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang ma grub po // gang yang / gang zhig rang nyid rang bzhin gyis //
translated: They are not established by their intrinsic nature.üîΩAnd:

original: ma grub des gzhan ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: ma grub des gzhan ji ltar skyed //
translated: How could that which is not established by its intrinsic nature give rise to another?

original: de phyir gzhan las grub pa yis //
analyzed: de phyir gzhan las grub pa yis //
translated: Therefore, that which is established from another

original: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan dag ni skyed byed min //
translated: is not a condition that gives rise to another.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ma grub na /
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ma grub na /
translated: Thus, if causes and effects are not established,

original: rgyu na ga la zhig rgyu @306a * //
analyzed: rgyu na ga la zhig rgyu @306a * //
translated: how could a cause be a cause?üîΩHow could a result be a result?

original: byin pa ga la zhig ces pa dang / rgyu 'gags nas slar mi skye bas //
analyzed: byin pa ga la zhig ces pa dang / rgyu 'gags nas slar mi skye bas //
translated: And: Since a cause that has ceased does not arise again,

original: rgyu rgyun chad par thal bar brtag pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu rgyun chad par thal bar brtag pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: it is illogical to think that the continuum of the cause is severed.

original: de ltar yang dngos por khas blangs na rtag pa dang chad pa'i lta bar thal lo zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar yang dngos por khas blangs na rtag pa dang chad pa'i lta bar thal lo zhes gnas so //
translated: Thus, if one asserts that things exist, one falls into the views of eternalism and nihilism.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bas rtag pa dang chad par khas mi len na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bas rtag pa dang chad par khas mi len na /
translated: If you do not accept that things are permanent or annihilated because of the fallacy of eternalism or nihilism,

original: 'di ltar dngos po las skye ba dang 'gag pa yang med par thal la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po las skye ba dang 'gag pa yang med par thal la /
translated: then it follows that things do not arise or cease from themselves.

original: de med na yang dag 'di dag skye ba dang 'jig par bstan pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de med na yang dag 'di dag skye ba dang 'jig par bstan pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: If that is so, then the Transcendent Lord‚Äôs teaching of the path to nirvana, which teaches that these things arise and are destroyed,üîΩwould be meaningless.üîΩThe Transcendent Lord has said:

original: mi rtag dang ldan 'dus byas rnams //üîΩskye dang 'jig pa'i chos can te //
analyzed: mi rtag dang ldan 'dus byas rnams // skye dang 'jig pa'i chos can te //
translated: Compounded phenomena, which are impermanent,üîΩHave the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: skye zhing gang la 'jig 'gyur ba //
analyzed: skye zhing gang la 'jig 'gyur ba //
translated: Those things that arise and cease

original: de dag nyer zhi bde ba'o //
analyzed: de dag nyer zhi bde ba'o //
translated: Are at peace‚Äîthat is bliss.

original: zhes pas / de 'gag pa dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag med pa'i stong pa dag nye bar bstan pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩskye 'jig bstan phyir myang 'das kyi //
analyzed: zhes pas / de 'gag pa dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag med pa'i stong pa dag nye bar bstan pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / skye 'jig bstan phyir myang 'das kyi //
translated: Thus, it is untenable to teach that nirvana is the cessation of arising, enduring, and disintegrating and that nirvana is empty of arising, enduring, and disintegrating.üîΩTo teach that nirvana is empty

original: lam bstan ma yin stong nyid phyir //
analyzed: lam bstan ma yin stong nyid phyir //
translated: Would not be to teach the path to nirvana.

original: zhes pa'o // yang na 'di'i don ni gzhan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang na 'di'i don ni gzhan te /
translated: Or, the meaning of the passage is different.

original: gal te 'di snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think this,

original: dngos po yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye 'jig med par 'gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa med par thal lo zhes pa'i skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: dngos po yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye 'jig med par 'gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa med par thal lo zhes pa'i skyon 'di med de /
translated: then the error would ensue that since existent things do not exist, arising and ceasing would not exist, and the path to nirvana would not be taught.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa yod bzhin pa ma yin pa la bstan pa 'thad cing /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa yod bzhin pa ma yin pa la bstan pa 'thad cing /
translated: But this error does not arise, because it is tenable to teach that arising and ceasing do not exist.

original: gang las skye 'jig bstan pa las mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩskye 'jig bstan phyir myang 'das kyi //
analyzed: gang las skye 'jig bstan pa las mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / skye 'jig bstan phyir myang 'das kyi //
translated: The Bhagavat has said that nirvana is attained from the teaching of arising and ceasing, but the teaching of the path to nirvana is not established.üîΩTo teach this, he says:

original: lam bstan ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: lam bstan ma yin zhes so //
translated: Nirvana is not taught for the sake of teaching arising and ceasing.üîΩAgain, why is it that liberation does not exist from the teaching of arising and ceasing? To teach this, he says:

original: slar yang ci'i phyir na skye 'jig bstan pa las thar pa med ces nye bar bstan par mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan par yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang ci'i phyir na skye 'jig bstan pa las thar pa med ces nye bar bstan par mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan par yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The teaching of the path to nirvana is also untenable.

original: stong nyid phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of emptiness.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag stong na ji ltar dag bstan pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag stong na ji ltar dag bstan pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan par 'gyur /
translated: If arising and cessation are empty, how can the path to nirvana be taught?

original: slar yang nye bar @306b dmigs bzhin pa skye bo thams cad la grags pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ji ltar stong pa nyid /
analyzed: slar yang nye bar @306b dmigs bzhin pa skye bo thams cad la grags pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ji ltar stong pa nyid /
translated: Again, arising and cessation, which are well known to all people, are empty.

original: ji ltar nye bar ma dmigs pa de dag kyang stong pa nyid la de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩ'di dag phan tshun bzlog pa ru //
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar ma dmigs pa de dag kyang stong pa nyid la de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / 'di dag phan tshun bzlog pa ru //
translated: In order to teach that, he says:üîΩThey are seen as mutually reversed

original: mthong ba phyin ci log las yin bden te /
analyzed: mthong ba phyin ci log las yin bden te /
translated: from error.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because arising and cessation are empty.

original: de dag stong pa nyid yin kyang gang 'jig rten pas mthong ba phyin ci log pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag stong pa nyid yin kyang gang 'jig rten pas mthong ba phyin ci log pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Although they are empty, they are engaged by the error of what is seen by the world.

original: de dag 'di ltar ji ltar rtogs shen /
analyzed: de dag 'di ltar ji ltar rtogs shen /
translated: How are they understood in this way?

original: phan tshun bzlog pa las te /
analyzed: phan tshun bzlog pa las te /
translated: From mutual reversal.

original: phyin ci log pas na phan tshun bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log pas na phan tshun bzlog pa ste /
translated: Because of error, there is mutual reversal.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba thob pa'o //
translated: There is attainment of the opposite.

original: gal te skye ba dang 'jig pa dag rang gi ngo bos yod na 'di dag phan tshun byas pas gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang 'jig pa dag rang gi ngo bos yod na 'di dag phan tshun byas pas gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: dependent, since they would be other in virtue of being mutually established.

original: skye ba las gzhan pa ma skyes pa la 'jig pa med la /
analyzed: skye ba las gzhan pa ma skyes pa la 'jig pa med la /
translated: Apart from arising, there is no nonarising, and so there is no destruction.üîΩEven at the time of arising, it would not be tenable for destruction, which isüîΩincompatible with the time of arising, to exist. And without destruction, there

original: skye ba'i dus na yang skye ba'i dus dang 'gal ba'i 'jig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba yang skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa'i dus su yang de dang 'gal ba'i skye ba mi rung ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus na yang skye ba'i dus dang 'gal ba'i 'jig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba yang skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa'i dus su yang de dang 'gal ba'i skye ba mi rung ba'i phyir dang /
translated: is no arising. And at the time of destruction, it would not be tenable for arising,üîΩwhich is incompatible with it, to exist.üîΩSince it is contradictory for them to arise simultaneously, and since they

original: phan tshun las dus gcig tu skye ba thob pa 'gal ba dang / phan tshun med pas 'di dag gsal ba'i phyir phan tshun bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun las dus gcig tu skye ba thob pa 'gal ba dang / phan tshun med pas 'di dag gsal ba'i phyir phan tshun bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: would be manifest without each other, they would be mutually exclusive.

original: skye ba ni skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir phyin ci log go //
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir phyin ci log go //
translated: Arising is mistaken, because it is devoid of the essence of arising.

original: yang na 'gag pa la ma ltos par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'gag pa la ma ltos par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it would be said that without cessation, there would be no arising.

original: skye ba'i phyin ci log ni rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa dang 'gag pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang / 'di ltar 'gag pa yang brjod de /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyin ci log ni rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa dang 'gag pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang / 'di ltar 'gag pa yang brjod de /
translated: The error of production is that which is not established by its own nature and depends on cessation, and in this way cessation is also described.

original: gang yang 'di dag phan tshun bzlog pa phan tshun byas pas 'grub la /
analyzed: gang yang 'di dag phan tshun bzlog pa phan tshun byas pas 'grub la /
translated: And these are mutually established by mutually acting as causes.
